loans.name: Nemroz Group

texts.en: This is the Nemroz group, which is comprised of four members who would like to take a loan for the advancement of their businesses, confident that they will repay the loan on time.  Samar G., the group leader, would like to take a loan for her husband’s sewing shop. The second member is Khadeja who wants to take the loan for her brother to buy a bigger cart for the sale of onions and potatoes. The third member is Zarghona, who wants to take the loan for her husband's taxi business. The last member is Sharifa who wants to take the loan for his husband’s fruit cart. They have all requested a group loan of 40000 Afghani.

loans.use: To improve their businesses

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.fr: H. Clarisse est née en 1972 à Glazoué au Bénin. Il y a environs 15 ans que Clarisse réside au quartier Zogbo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à JOMAKI Brice, un revendeur, Clarisse a quatre enfants à sa charge, dont trois sont ses enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble à Zogbo. Clarisse vient en aide à son mari en ce qui concerne l’entretien et l’éducation des enfants. Clarisse n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire. C’est depuis près de 20 ans que Clarisse vend des produits vivriers (maïs, riz, etc.) et divers autres articles à son domicile. Clarisse s’approvisionne à Glazoué et aussi à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Son activité lui procure des revenus l’aidant à gagner sa vie. En ces périodes, Clarisse ne dispose pas assez de fonds pouvant lui permettre de satisfaire le grand nombre de clients et de se faire plus de revenus à la hauteur de ses différentes charges. C’est donc pour renforcer son activité, que Clarisse sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Clarisse a déjà bénéficié d'un prêt à ALIDé, et qui a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Clarisse H. was born in 1972 in Glazoué in Bénin. Clarisse has lived for about 15 years in the Zgobo neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Married to Brice JOMAKI, a retailer, Clarisse has four children in her care, three of which are her own. All the children are at school. The family lives together in Zogbo. Clarisse helps her husband with the upkeep and education of the children. Clarisse went to primary school only. For almost 20 years Clarisse has been selling food produce (corn, rice, etc.) and other miscellaneous items from her home. Clarisse stocks up at Glazoué and also at Dantokpa, Bénin's international market. Her business allows her to bring in an income which helps her to make a living. At present Clarisse does not have sufficient funds to allow her to satisfy the large number of clients she has and to have a higher income in order to cover her various expenses. In order to strengthen her business Clarisse is thus asking for a second loan from ALIDé. Clarisse has already had one loan from ALIDé which was repaid without any problems.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags of corn

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María, es socia del Bancomunal Niño Nativo, ubicado en el distrito de Acoria, en el departamento de Huancavelica, es casada y tiene un hijo de 10 años. María inició su negocio con la venta de arroz, azúcar, leche y otros productos de primera necesidad, le ha ido muy bien porque en Acoria no hay mercados, ahora María empezó con un nuevo negocio, ha comprado una fotocopiadora y  también vende útiles de escritorio. 
Agradece las reuniones de su bancomunal porque le han enseñado a ahorrar, su hijo también está aprendiendo y le ayuda a guardar el dinero.
El préstamo que solicita le ayudará en comprar más productos al por mayor para su negocio y también realizar el mantenimiento de su carro.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Niño Nativo Community Bank which is located in the district of Acoria in the department of Huancavelica. She is married and has a 10-year old son. María started in business selling rice, sugar, milk, and other daily necessities; she has done very well as there are no markets in Acoria. Next she bought a photocopier and opened a new business; she also sells office supplies. She is grateful for the meetings run by the bank as she learned how to save. Her son too is learning, and she is helping him save his money. María will use the loan to buy more products at wholesale prices for the store, and also to do some maintenance on her car.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy basic groceries at wholesale prices

loans.name: Luz Margarita

texts.es: Luz Margarita M. R. de 31 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de San Martín, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive en casa propia, junto a su esposo y dos hijos de 7 y cuatro años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Luz posee una tortillería y una pupusería, la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitación. Cada mediodía se encarga de elaborar las tortillas, las cuales cuentan con mucha demanda por el hecho de ser parte de la dieta salvadoreña. Así mismo por las tarde elabora pupusas, las cuales son un platillo muy típico de este país. Luz solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de más maíz, y así mismo comprar otros ingredientes como queso, frijoles y chicharrón, los cuales son para las pupusas. Luz es una mujer muy trabajadora quien se esfuerza día con día por obtener ganancias las cuales sean de beneficio para su familia.
texts.en:
Luz Margarita M. R., 31, lives in the municipality of San Martín, located in the San Salvador department. She lives in her own home with her husband and two children who are 7 and 4 years old and who study in school. Luz has a business making and selling tortillas and pupusas from her home. Each day at midday she makes the tortillas, for which there is a strong demand as they are a staple of the Salvadoran diet. In addition, in the afternoon she makes pupusas, a dish very typical of this country. Luz requests a loan that she will use to buy more corn and other ingredients such as cheese, beans and pork rinds for the pupusas. Luz is a hardworking woman who strives each day to earn money for the benefit of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, beans and pork rinds

loans.name: Maimoaga

texts.en:
Maimoaga T. is 30 and married with 1 child (1-month-old).  She owns a business venture, driving a taxi.  Maimoaga has 4 years of experience in this business.  Maimoaga needs a loan of WST $1200 to maintain the vehicle.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Maimoaga joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Maimoaga's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Maimoaga T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.3 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.3 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.3 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.4 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to maintain vehicle

loans.name: Rosa Elvia

texts.es: Rosa Elvia M. M. de 51 años de edad, reside en Puerto el Triunfo, el cual está ubicado en el departamento de Usulután. Vive únicamente junto a sus dos hijas, las cuales le ayudan en el negocio. Rosa posee una venta de tortillas, en la cual se encarga de elaborarlas y posteriormente venderlas entre los vecinos del lugar, los cuales son clientes fijos, ya que desde hace muchos años atrás que ella se dedica a este tipo de trabajo. La tortillería está ubicada en su casa de habitación en la cual cada mediodía se dedica a lavar el maíz, luego llevarlo al molino y posteriormente elaborar las tortillas, que son uno de productos con más demanda en este país, ya que son parte de la comida diaria de los salvadoreños. Es por esta razón que este negocio es muy rentable para maría quien vive de las ganancias obtenidas por este. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor de manera que pueda obtenerlo a menor precio, así mismo comprar algunos cilindros de gas propano para poder contar con una provisión extra de estos. A pesar que Rosa es madre soltera, ha sabido enfrentarse a dicha situación trabajando muy duro para sacar adelante a sus hijas y brindarles todo lo necesario a ambas.
texts.en:
Rosa Elvia M. M. is 51 years old, and lives in Puerto el Triunfo, located in the Department of Usulután. She is single, and lives with her two daughters who help with her business. Rosa works selling tortillas, which she makes and then sells throughout the neighborhood. She counts on a good customer base, as she has been in this type of business for many years. Her tortilla business is located in her home where, midday, she dedicates herself to washing the corn, then milling and making the tortillas. These are in great demand in this country, as they are an integral part of the Salvadoran diet. For this reason, the business is profitable, and she lives off of the income it generates. She is requesting a loan to buy corn at lower wholesale prices. She would also like to buy some tanks of propane gas in order to have an extra supply of these. Despite being a single mother, she has known how to face her difficult situation by working hard to help her daughters get ahead and to provide for them.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and propane gas.

location.town: Puerto el Triunfo, departamento de Usulután

loans.name: Santos Hermogenes

texts.es:
Este Sr. Se llama Santos Hermogenes B. Téllez, tiene 49 años de edad, casado, es soltero, él se dedica a la venta de helados, en este negocio se desempeña desde hace 17 años, de  tiene un hijo varón que tiene Dieciséis años de edad y está estudiando la escuela secundaria.

Con nuestra institución ha obtenido la cantidad de Veinte y Cinco créditos, en su mayoría los ha sacado para gastos del negocio, esta vez lo necesita para mejorar su vivienda.

Vale mencionar que en los Veinticuatro créditos otorgados anteriormente, este señor ha sido muy responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Santos Hermogenes B. Téllez, 49, is married. He has sold ice-cream for the past 17 years. He has a 16-year-old son who is in secondary school. He has had 25 previous loans with our institution; most of which have been used to stock his business. This time, however, he needs funds to make home improvements. It is worth mentioning that he has been responsible with his obligations in all his previous 24 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda C. is from the village of Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Rosalinda is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns & operates a business venture making and selling "chicharon" (fried pork rinds) in the local community. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosalinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the third loan taken out by Rosalinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Spencer's Group

texts.en:
Spencer G., from the village of Del Pilar, Cabatuan, Isabela, is the 24-year-old leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Spencer, who is single, owns and operates a motorcycle transport business providing transportation services to local community members. He is just starting this business. In 2010, he joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Spencer is now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the enterprise.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Alkham

texts.en:
Alkham is a farmer who lives with his family, including his wife and five children. His wife and elder son help him with caring for their land. In the past, Alkham has had problems with harvesting, and also having to sell his crop in advance and therefore seeing reduced earnings.
Now, Alkham has gained a lot of experience in his business and today his crop is one of the most demanded at the market. He now faces a small problem because his field is infertile, which makes it difficult to grow his crop. To solve this problem, Alkham has decided to request a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field and make his crop more productive.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Modesta es conviviente, tiene 47 años y 5 hijos de los cuales 3 estudian en el colegio, 1 de ellos termino sus estudios superiores y el otro todavía es pequeño.
Modesta pertenece al Banco Comunal Nueva Vida y lo que mas le gusta son las capacitaciones y el incentivo al ahorro.
Modesta tiene un puesto en el mercado Basilio Auqui en donde vende frutas variadas al por mayor y menor, de acuerdo a la temporada, actividad que realiza todos los días desde la madrugada hasta las 6 de la tarde. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de plátano. 
Modesta sueña con que todos sus hijos sean profesionales y que su hija viaje a España.
texts.en:
Modesta is 47 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has 5 children, 3 of whom still study in school. Her eldest child has graduated from secondary school and her youngest child is still small. Modesta belongs to the Nueva Vida (New Life) Communal Bank and what she enjoys most are the training classes and the incentive to save. Modesta has a stall in the Basilio Auqui Market where she sells various fruits seasonally, wholesale and retail, every day from early morning until 6:00pm. Her loan will be invested in purchasing plantains. Modesta dreams that all of her children might become professionals and that her daughter may travel to Spain.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASING PLANTAINS TO SELL

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase gold jewelry and cosmetics

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (20203040013) is a 39 year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  H. is the group leader of a 8-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Đồng Thôn 1 nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03).


H. is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, H. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Trương Thị M. (0) is a 22 year-old female who is requesting a 7.840.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business.


2.  Trương Thị L. (0) is a 20 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  Trương Thị N. (0) is a 38 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  Trương Thị M. (0) is a 45 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


5.  Nguyễn Thị M. (0) is a 39 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector selling home products.


6.  Trương Thị T. (0) is a 33 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is the mother of one son and three daughters. Two of her daughters are married. The third daughter and her son are 14 and 16-year-old students, respectively. Sabah's husband, Khalil, sells vegetables and fruit from his booth in the vegetable market.

Sabah works in tailoring. She uses her income to pay for her son's and daughter's education expenses, while her husband's income pays for their household expenses. 

Khalil saved money to buy a shop to replace his vegetable booth. He considered borrowing money from his friends to complete the transaction, but Sabah decided to come to FATEN instead and take a loan for this purpose.

Khalil appears in the picture because Sabah is a conservative woman.

loans.use: Purchase a vegetable shop

loans.name: Hector Javier

texts.es:
Hector de 44 años de edad es casado, trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 17 años, desempeñandose como tecnico urbanistico. 

Esta solicitando  su 6to credito con el objetivo de reparar el techo de su casa que se encuentra en mal estado y con las lluvias se moja parte de su casa.  

Su mayor sueño es poder tener su casa con las condiciones necesarias para su familia.
texts.en:
Hector is 44 years old and he is married. He has worked at the city hall of Juigalpa for the past 17 years as an urban planner. He is requesting his sixth loan with the plan of repairing the roof of his house. The rainy season is soon to come and the roof leaks and floods his house. His greatest dream is to have a house that is equipped to meet the basic needs of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the roof.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 29 años, es una joven profesional muy trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres. Trabaja como profesora en una escuela de primaria, de lunes a viernes hasta 2:00 de la tarde, asimismo alquila disfraces infantiles a sus alumnos para los diversos eventos que tienen en la escuela. Este último negocio decidió emprenderlo, al ver que sus alumnos alquilaba estas vestimentas a precios muy elevados, así que adquirió estas prendas para rentarlos ella misma pero a un precio más cómodo, por lo que le resulta rentable, y más en fechas festivas como la semana del niño, día de la madre, del padre y los desfiles de fiestas patrias. Los  8 años que trabaja como profesora y ahora como negociante le han ido muy bien, por lo que se siente muy feliz, y en adelante piensa tener su propio taller de costura, para que diseñe sus propios disfraces, y así aumentar sus ganancias. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, y en su anterior crédito ha sido ha sido muy puntual y espera serlo ahora también, en su grupo se ha ganado el respeto de sus compañeras. Con el crédito que solicita comprará telas, para mandar a coser más disfraces, y de ese modo seguir alquilando.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 29 years old. She is a hard working and young career woman. She lives with her parents. She is a primary school teacher from Monday to Friday until 2pm. But she also rents out children's costumes that the school children use for various events. She decided to start up this business because she saw that the school kids were renting these costumes at very high prices. she acquired some costumes and started renting them at better prices, a venture that has been very successful, especially during the holiday seasons such as the Week of the child, Mother's Day, Father's day, and for national holiday parades. For the past 8 years she has worked as both a teacher and a business owner and she has seen great success, giving her a great deal of personal pleasure. In the future she hopes to have her own sewing shop to design her own children's costumes and increase her earnings. This is her second loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). In her previous loan she has been on time and she plans on keep that up. She has earned the respect of her community group. This loan will be destined to purchase various fabrics to have costumes made so that she may continue to rent them out.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics to create children's costumes.

loans.name: Namirembe Bakyara Tweheyo Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
As they say that determination leads to destiny, A. Emmanuel is gaining momentum in his charcoal-selling business which operates from the Kampala city markets. Many people tend to undermine casual work in Uganda but the 40-year-old married father of five children has been able to earn a living through this business for over 10 years. Charcoal is commonly used in Uganda as a form of energy in many homes to cook food and to warm houses when it's cold, as prices for paraffin, gas and electricity are always high. 

Through selling charcoal, Emmanuel is able to earn 323,000 Ugandan shillings monthly although having drawbacks such as not being able to transport his products to bigger markets. With this loan, he hopes to expand and supply his charcoal to larger charcoal markets. This will help to improve his sales revenue to cater for his family’s needs.

Emmanuel belongs to the Namirembe Bakyara Tweheyo Group, Ntungamo.

loans.use: To pay transportation costs providing access to bigger markets

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie B. is from the town of Banga. She is 42 years old. Rosalie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalie owns and operates a business venture in the agricultural sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Rosalie also helps her husband maintain their rice farm.

Rosalie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosalie has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rosalie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock and feed for her pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to pay the tuition fees of her children and to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and feed for her pigs

loans.name: Abdirasul

texts.en:
Abdirasul K. is a married father of 4 children. He grows wheat, watermelons, onions, rice, and carrots, which he plants once a year. His wife is a teacher in a local school. To help meet the hard physical labor of his farming work his children work with him. Farming is the main source of earning income to sustain this family’s living conditions. Abdirasul is applying for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. This fund will ensure the economic prosperity of this friendly family.
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Khusnidin

texts.en:
Khusnidin is a hard-working entrepreneur from Istaravshan, Tajikistan. He owns a small market vending business where he sells clothes and shoes. Khusnidin decided to start his own business after he was unable to find other work. Because of difficult living condition his sons had to leave for Russia to earn money. Currently the business of Khusnidin is the main source of income for his large family. 

He has requested a loan of 7500 Somoni to purchase some new inventory for his business. Khusnidin will use profits from his business to improve his standard of living and do some remodeling to his home. He dreams of opening another two vending places for his sons.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase new clothing in order to increase the variety of goods for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa A. is from Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 38 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Generosa owns and operates a transportation business. Generosa has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Generosa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Generosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This will be the third loan taken out by Generosa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 31-year-old married man with four children living in an owned house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His family's dream is to educate his children up to a tertiary institution. He has been operating a cinema hall for two years now and this has greatly developed as he diversified from still photos into movie shows with a business desire to own a modern cinema hall. Patrick intends to use the credit facility to buy DSTV, a generator and a clipper.

loans.use: To purchase DSTV, a generator and a clipper

loans.name: Anselme

texts.en: Anselme owns a salon.  He is 34 years old, single, and has one child. Anselme has been in the business of running his salon for seven years.  His loan will be used to purchase more salon equipment and hair products.  He hopes to use the new profits from his business to expand his salon and continue to grow.

loans.use: To add equipment in the salon for business purpose

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina, de 55 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su  esposo Raúl, con quien tiene 4 hijos, pero aun viven con dos de ellos.Todas las mañanas esta trabajadora mujer pasa apresuradamente al mercado aledaño de su barrio, para realizar las compras de carne, verduras y demás condimentos. Luego de las compras empieza con la preparación del menú del día, pues ella trabaja desde hace 27 años, para el  comedor popular de su barrio, ubicado a dos cuadras de su casa. En ese lugar  brinda sus servicios  con otras damas que son  vecinas de su barrio, y por su labor le brindan como  pago cinco  platos de comida  diarios, con los que alimenta a su familia. Su esposo trabaja en la  carpintería de su casa, fabricando accesorios para el  hogar, y  Dina lo ayuda por las tardes en el lijado de maderas, y se  mantiene muy entretenida con esta labor. Para el futuro tiene planeado  adquirir una  máquina lijadora eléctrica, pues siente que su labor será más rápida.Es su 34avo crédito  que tiene con MFP, y se ha comprometido nuevamente en ser muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, pues considera  que este crédito le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Dina tiene planeado invertir  el dinero del crédito en  la compra de cantidad de materiales como maderas, colas, clavos, entre otros accesorios, que necesita y de esta manera espera continuar fabricando sus muebles.
texts.en:
Dina is 55 years old.  She lives in her own home alongside her husband Raúl.  They have four children but now only live with two of them.  Every morning this hard-working woman hurries off to the market in an adjacent neighborhood to buy meat, vegetables and condiments.  After she has done her shopping, she starts preparing her meals for the day.  She has been working for 27 years in her popular neighborhood eatery which is located two blocks from her home.  Here she provides her services with other ladies from her neighborhood.  As payment for her work, she receives five plates of food a day with which she feeds her family.  Her husband works from home as a carpenter , making household accessories, and Dina helps him in the afternoons, sanding wood.  She keeps busy with this work.  In the future, Dina plans to acquire an electric sander since she feels that this would make her work quicker.

This is Dina's 34th loan with MFP and she has, once again, pledged to be responsible in making her repayments.  She considers that this loan will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  Dina plans to invest her loan money in buying a quantity of materials such as wood, adhesives, nails, and other accessories that she needs.  In this way, she hopes to continue making her furniture.

loans.use: To buy materials for her furniture workshop

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 41 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Jorge de 48 años y de sus 2 hijos que son mayores y trabajan independientes; juntos se esfuerzan a diario para salir adelante. Desde hace 2 años,  esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a la venta de comida (menú) diaria, pues reparte estos platillos a sus 15 comensales fijos que son trabajadores de una empresa y le pagan semanalmente. Esta muy satisfecha pues la labor es tranquila, empieza a cocinar muy temprano, y luego alista sus taper para repartir la comida al mediodía, así se la pasa de lunes a sábado y solo descansa los domingos. Dice que aunque no tiene hijos pequeños se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante ya que quiere terminar de construir su casa de material noble. Para mas adelante tiene planeado instalar un restaurante donde pueda ofrecer sus diversos platillos, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. María tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de ingredientes, al por mayor, como arroz, aceite, menestras, huevos y azúcar que necesita para continuar cocinando, y espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Maria is 41 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Jorge who is 48 years old and their two adult children who work independently. Together they strive daily to get ahead. For two years, this hardworking woman has been selling food daily. She delivers meals to 15 regular diners that work at a company and they pay her weekly. She is very satisfied since her work is peaceful. She starts cooking very early and then gets her food ready in containers to distribute the food at noon. She does this Monday through Saturday and only rests on Sundays. Even though she does not have small children, she strives daily to get ahead because she wants to finish building her home made of noble materials. In the future she plans on setting up a restaurant where she can offer a variety of dishes and in this way she can improve her profits. This is the third loan she has obtained from field partner MFP and she promises to make her payments on time because she does not want to look bad to the people who made this contribution, which will allow her to continue working in search of progress, possible. Maria plans on investing the loan in purchasing wholesale ingredients such as rice, oil, beans, eggs and sugar which she needs to keep cooking. She hopes to improve her profits.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of beans, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie B. is from the village of Tumbao, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 40 years old. Rosie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. Rosie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Rosie is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like junk foods & canned goods. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Rosie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like snack foods & canned goods

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CAPAC QOYA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Qoya, provincia de Calca, Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Teofilo; El socio tiene 54 años de edad, el socio  es casado; el socio tiene 1 hijo; el socio trabaja prestando servicio de taxi, el socio tiene un vehículo y lo desea vender para comprar otro automóvil más y hacerlo trabajar en la prestación de servicios de taxis en la ruta Cusco Calca. El socio desea el crédito para invertir en algunos pequeños arreglos de su vehículo para poder venderlo y con la venta que genere este y un ahorro que tiene comprar un nuevo auto del año.

El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “CAPAC QOYA” community bank. This bank is located in the district of Qoya, province of Calca, departament of Cuzco.

The member is Teofilo. He is 54 years old and married. He has 1 son. He works as a taxi driver. He has a vehicle and wants to sell it to buy another car and have it work as a taxi on the Cuzco Calca route. He wants the loan to invest in some small repairs on his vehicle to be able to sell it and with the sale's proceeds and some savings, buy a new car, this year's model.  

The member is happy with the loan that has been given him and is committed to making his payments according to schedule.

loans.use: To invest in fixing up his vehicle and selling it.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Mónica, tiene 41 años de edad, tiene un hijo, nació en la ciudad del Cusco y ahora vive en la misma ciudad. Monica es una mujer carismática y emprendedora que trabaja de forma independiente, ella tiene una pequeña agencia de viajes llamada “Argos Travel” donde brinda servicios de turismo para visitar y conocer el Valle Sagrado, Machupicchu y otras zonas arqueológicas del Imperio Incaico, Cusco, Perú.  Mónica en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar pasajes aéreos y otras cosas más.

Mónica pertenece al banco comunal “Inti Pakareq” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Mónica is 41 years old and has one child.  She was born in the city of Cusco and lives there now.  Mónica is a charismatic and enterprising woman who works for herself.  She owns a small travel agency called 'Argos Travel' where she provides tourism services for people visiting el Valle Sagrado (The Sacred Valley), Machupicchu and other archaeological sites of the Incan Empire in Cusco, Peru.  Mónica needs this loan to buy plane tickets and other items.

Mónica is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Inti Pakareq" community bank.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is being given with this loan and she pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy plane tickets and some other items

loans.name: Aleksan

texts.en:
Aleksan A. was born in 1949 in Ijevan. He has two daughters and a son.  Aleksan’s children are married and live separately from their parents. 
For about 15 years, Aleksan Antnonyan worked as a driver.  Now he and his wife are engaged animal husbandry.  With the profits from farming, Aleksan provides for his family’s needs, such as buying necessary furniture and organizing his children’s weddings. He also helped his son to set up his own business. 
This is Aleksan’s third loan from Nor Horizon and second loan from Kiva. He has never delayed his loan repayments, and now he is asking for a 600,000 AMD loan to buy one more cow, and fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: to buy one more cow, and fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Carmen Janeth

texts.es:
En  el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Confraternidad de Amigas. Este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque en este cantón  los lugareños preparan  deliciosos dulces  que son reconocidos en la provincia y todo el país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Carmen, tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 6 y 2 años, el mayor estudia en escuela. El marido es mecánico automotriz.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que se dedica al comercio, tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, también vende ropa de todo tipo y productos de Esika (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su esposo le ayuda en su trabajo cuando tiene tiempo libre, los productos los compra en Portoviejo aunque la mayoría los recibe en su local.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, ropa, perfumes, cremas y otros productos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio, es la secretaria del banco  y le gusta porque todas sus compañeras se llevan muy bien en el grupo.
 
Su meta es crecer con su negocio día a día.
texts.en:
The “Confraternidad de Amigas” (Confraternity of Friends) communal bank meets every two weeks in Rocafuerte Canton.  This place is known for its kind, hard working residents and because in this canton residents prepare delicious candy that is famous throughout the province and the nation.

We met Carmen, 26, here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has two children who are 6 and 2 years of age.  The oldest is in school and her spouse is an Auto Mechanic.

She is a great housewife who is also a merchant.  She has a home-based grocery store and also sells all kinds of clothes and Esika brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women’s accessories).  She works every day from 6am until 8pm and sometimes even later.  Her husband helps her with her work when he has spare time.  She buys her products in Portoviejo although most of them are delivered to her locale.

She will use this loan to stock her store more.  She will buy rice, sugar, clothes, perfume, creams and other products.  She’s been in the communal bank since the beginning and is its Secretary.  She likes it because all her fellow members get along very well in the group.  Her goal is to grow with her business day by day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, clothes, perfume, creams, etc.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Aminata.  She is married, and has two school-going children. She has one additional dependent, whom she adopted.  In the year 1992, she started her Africana dress and sandals business. She has been able to manage the business and has a very good loan repayment history. She opens her business 6 days a week and 9 hours a day. 

Aminata has received and successfully repaid one loan and now needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL. She needs a loan in order to buy African dresses, sandals and accessories for her business. In the future Aminata hopes to educate her children to the university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy sandals, necklaces, bracelets and Bamako clothing to sell.

loans.name: Diana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Diana  D. 38 años D. edad es una madre D. familia que vive con su esposo y  su  hijo, tiene  casa propia, cuenta con solo servicio D. agua y luz  en el distrito D. TambogranD. a tan solo 1 hora D. distancia D. la provincia D. Piura y a unas 3 horas D. la ciudad D. Chcilayo. TambogranD. se caracteriza por ser una zona D. mucha actividad agricola y ganadera.

Diana se dedica  a la crianza D. ganado ovino (tiene 40 ovejas en su corral ) desD. hace varios años, su corral donD. se encuentran sus ovejas está en la parte posterior D. su casa.  A sus animales los cría con alimentos balanceados como con pastos naturales  y una  vez que tengan el peso y el tamaño óptimo las ofrece en el mercado D. TambogranD..  Con el dinero que va adquirir por la venta D. sus ovejas, podrá atender las necesidades diarias D. su hogar y familia.  También cuenta con unas hectáreas D. tierras D. cultivo que su padre le heredó, en la cual siembra plantas D. limón para vender desD. hace 6 años .

A solicitado un préstamo Diana a Edpyme Alternativa D. 2000 nuevos soles para  comprar comida balanceada para poder alimentarlas  asegurando un buen crecimiento y engorD. D. sus animales.  Con la buena crianza D. sus animales Diana estaría asegurando la venta D. sus animales.
texts.en:
Diana is 38 years old and she is the mother of a family. She lives with her husband and their son. They own their home and they only have running water and hydro. It is located in the district of TambogranD., only about 1 hour's distance from the province of Piura and about 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo. TambogranD. is known for its agricultural and farming activities.

Diana has been raising sheep (she has 40 sheep in her corral) for several years. The corral where she keeps her sheep is located in the rear portion of her property. She raises her livestock by feeding them balanced feed such as natural grasses. When they have reached an optimum weight and size she offers them for sale in the market at TambogranD.. With the profits she earns from the sale of her sheep she will be able to proviD. for the daily needs of her household and of her family. She also has a few hectares of land that her father inherited to her. She has been cultivating lemon plants to sell for 6 years.

Diana has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles to purchase balanced feed for her livestock. This will ensure the growth and fattening of her livestock. Diana is assuring the sale of her livestock but raising them well.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for her sheep.

loans.name: Hamzah

texts.en:
Hamzah is an ambitious 21-year-old young man. He started to work and support himself when he was young so that he could save for his future to get a house and to have a family. He built a special tent to sell watermelon and vegetables based on the season.

Hamzah started his own business four years ago selling different kinds of vegetables (mainly watermelon) and has been successfully running since then. People trust buying from his because he makes sure that his vegetables are always fresh and his prices are reasonable. After having good experience in this field, Hamzah has applied for a new loan to expand his business by opening another branch in another area and to start selling fruits in addition to vegetables.

loans.use: To open another branch to sell fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Rosaira

texts.es:
Rosaira Vive en el barrio “El Santuario” al sur de la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge y su hijo de 12 años de edad; allí  en su propia casa tiene un negocio, que consiste en vender a créditos mercancías variadas como cosméticos, perfumes y accesorios, mediante  guías especializadas de productos; ella comenzó cuando hace 6 años, una amiga le generó esa iniciativa, lo que a Rosaira le representó  generar ingresos personales,  que aplicó a su propio hogar y especialmente al bienestar de su único hijo, con el cual sueña ver próspero y exitoso en un futuro.
 Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el comprará una vitrina mostrador para lograr una mejor exhibición de sus mercancías,  aplicando  técnicas de merchandising  que impacten sus ventas, con tal de aumentar la rentabilidad desde el punto comercial y en consecuencia llamar la atención de sus clientes hacia las mercancías que exhibirá a propósito del día del padre y con ello  lograr facilitar su acción de compra, porque la competencia es su mayor desafío y ella está aplicando todas las herramientas con tal de continuar sosteniéndose en el mercado y fortalecer su rentabilidad sobre las ventas en un porcentaje no menor del 25%.
texts.en:
Rosaira lives in the El Santuario neighborhood, south of the city of Barranquilla, with her husband and her 12 year old son. She has a business in her own house, which consists of selling on credit a variety of merchandise, such as cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories, through catalogs. She started this business 6 years ago when a friend inspired her to get started. To Rosaira, this meant generating her own income, which she used for her own home and especially for the wellbeing of her only son. She dreams of seeing him prosper and be successful in the future.

Her Kiva loan is the first financing she has done with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it she will buy a display vitrine so that she can better display her merchandise and apply merchandising techniques that will improve her sales. In this way she can increase her income from her store and also attract the attention of her customers toward her merchandise. She will display it in anticipation of Father’s Day and this will facilitate sales. Since competition is her greatest challenge, she is utilizing all of her tools so that she can continue in the market and strengthen her earning power, with a profit percentage of not less than 25%.

loans.use: to buy a display vitrine.

loans.name: Haldi Foty Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Haldi Foty   a été créé en Mai 2010 lors l’inauguration de leur  banc villageois. Il compte 25 femmes qui habitent toutes le même quartier, ce groupe est aminé d’une bonne entente. Elles  font toutes le petit commerce.


Madame Néné (assise en troisième position de la gauche vers la droite) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 46 ans, veuve, elle prend en charge 10 enfants, 04 enfants de sa coépouse et un petit fils. 


Elle vend des fruits et légumes, activité qu’elle pratique depuis trois ans.


Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter des fruits et légumes destinés à la vente.


Les bénéfices de cette activité lui permettront d’aider ses enfants dans leur scolarité et la nourriture
texts.en:
The Haldi Foty  group was created in May 2010 when their "village bank" was inaugurated. It is made up of 25 women, all from the same neighborhood and animated with good understanding. They are all small-scale retailers. 
 
Madame Néné (seated, third person going from left to right) is the leader of the group. She is 46, a widow, and is raising 10 children, four children of her co-spouse and one grandson.  

She sells fruit and vegetables, a business she has been in for three years. Her new loan will allow her to buy fruit and vegetables for resale. 

The profit from this business will allow her to help her children pay school fees and to feed them.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Mukunda

texts.en:
Mukunda is 61 years-old .  She is married and has one child, aged 20.  In 1999, she established her business raising cows.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received, and successfully repaid, 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy a young dairy cow.  

In the future, Mukunda plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.  In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction and as fuel for fires.  Its gases can be captured in methane storage tanks.  The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young dairy cow

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Close to Abena, on the floor, are umbrellas and underwear. She also sells food stuffs like cassava and plantains at Kokoado, which is a village near Elmina. She is a single parent taking care of three children. The last born child is the boy standing by Abena in the picture. She educates, feeds, and clothes her children with the income she makes from her sales. She wants to increase the sale of the goods so she can build a shop from the income. A loan will be used to acquire different types of underwear to sell.

loans.use: A loan will be used to acquire different types of underwear to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for bales of assorted used clothing including four bales of children's dresses and one bale of ladies' dresses .

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco, tiene la edad 39 de  años, está casado y vive con sus 4 hijos y su esposa. El va a comprar con el crédito los insumos necesarios para la asistencia de su cafetal. El cuenta con varios años de experiencia en el manejo de este cultivo y lo que él pretende es darle una mejora y ayuda extra para así aumentar este próximo año la cosecha de café. El con esta mejora tiene como meta generar las ganancias para salir adelante con el crédito, crecer con el proyecto y darle a su familia una calidad de vida mejor. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Fransisco is 39, and lives with his wife and 4 children.  He is going to use the loan to buy the supplies necessary to maintain his coffee crop. He has several years of experience growing coffee.  

He intends make improvements and give his crop extra help, in order to increase his coffee harvest in the coming year. With the loan and these improvements, his goal is to generate more profit and grow as a coffee producer, so that he can get ahead, and provide his family with a better quality of life.

He hadn't had previous loans from state-owned banks, but FUDECOSUR offered him better terms, and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To maintain his coffee crop

loans.name: Anarbu's Group

texts.en:
Anarbu is the leader of this group. She is 52 years old  and is married to a school teacher. Together with her husband, she has raised six children, three of whom are studying at school. 

Anarbu works as a secretary at a school.  With her husband’s help, she also breeds livestock and then resells them at a higher price in order to contribute additional money to family budget.  In this way, the family earns an additional 3000 soms per month. With the money received from this loan,  Anrabu wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the near future, she plans to start building a shed for keeping livestock.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to sell clothes

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana nació en la provincia de Paucartambo en la ciudad de Huata Grande y tiene 42  años de edad, ella es casada y tiene seis hijos. 

Actualmente, Juliana vive en la ciudad de Huancarani  y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos como por ejemplo ponchos, pantalones, chullos y mantas, ella también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores. En esta oportunidad Juliana requiere el crédito para comprar lana y algunos animales mas como cuyes. 

El Banco Comunal “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Juliana was born in Paucartambo Province in the city of Huata Grande.  She’s 42 years old, married and has six children.  

Currently, Juliana lives in the city of Huancarani where she carries out her economic activities.  She manufactures woven items like ponchos, pants, ‘chullos’ [traditional Peruvian knit caps] and blankets.  She also raises small farm animals.  On this occasion, Juliana needs the loan to buy some wool and also some animals, like more guinea pigs.

The “Once de Mayo-Huancarani” (May 11-Huancarani) communal bank meets monthly in Huancarani District of Paucartambo Province, Cusco Department (Perú).  Cusco is known for being a very touristy, commercial zone as well as for its traditional “Inti Raymi” festival and also because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

loans.use: to buy wool and some animals, like guinea pigs.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 39 year old married woman who has 7 children. Her husband is a driver and she is an employee at one of the factories in Jordan.
To be able to help in supporting the family income, Hanan also started making decorative pieces 3 years ago. These items look like plants and flowers. Hanan makes the pieces using plastic and other materials, while still keeping her original job at the factory.

Now Hanan has applied for a loan in order to help her proceed with her business and open a specialty store for selling what she makes.

loans.use: to help her proceed with her business and open a specialty store for selling what she makes.

loans.name: Ma. Sol

texts.en:
Ma. Sol is 53 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 50,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more stocks of products to sell.

Ma. Sol has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 25 years and also earns an income from a restaurant, entertainment (videoke), and ready-to-wear store.

Ma. Sol aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of products to sell.

loans.name: Nebert

texts.en:
Nebert is 41-years-old. He is married with one child and is responsible for two more dependents. They live in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His family dream is to have enough sources of income to build a better house. 

He has been dealing in brick making and farming for the last five years and faces a challenge of little capital and the changing seasons which make it difficult for him to work, especially during the rainy seasons. Nebert needs the loan to buy fire wood for the brick making and to pay workers so as to increase on production.

loans.use: to buy firewood for brick making and to pay workers.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice, a 32-year-old married mother of one child, operates a salon and boutique in Kwachocha, located in Malindi town. In business for the past eight years now, she earns a monthly income of about Kshs. 30,000, which she uses to support her family.

Now applying for her second loan of Kshs. 50,000 from KADET LTD., Beatrice plans to use the entire loan to expand her business by stocking ladies’ make up, body lotions, perfumes, bathing soap, hair weaves, wigs, necklaces, and bracelets. She will use the anticipated additional profits to continue supporting her family, purchasing more inventory, and gradually expanding her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy body lotions, perfumes, bathing soap, hair weaves, wigs, necklaces, and bracelets.

loans.name: Felister

texts.en:
Felister is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya where she produces maize, beans and vegetables. She has been farming for 10 years and is married with 7 children who are all adults apart from the youngest who is still at school. She, herself, is 60.

Felister has requested a loan of 40,000KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry for a new venture in poultry farming. She says the business will improve her farming income and enable her to provide the basic needs for her family, especially the last born who is still at school. She intends to keep exotic breeds and be the main supplier of eggs for the local market.

She says fluctuation in prices is the main challenge since costs are at an all time high.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Bidii Shg B Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is the facilitator of the Bidii SHG B group. Beatrice and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Beatrice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Beatrice had an excellent maize yield harvesting 24 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Beatrice was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from her maize sales, Beatrice will invest in livestock rearing and educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Bidii SHG B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Beatrice with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Nambalai Farmers Group

texts.en:
Boniface is the facilitator of the Nambalai Farmers group. Boniface and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Boniface takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Boniface had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Boniface was only able to harvest two bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Boniface and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Boniface will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Nambalai Farmers group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel vive y trabaja en Camaná, Perú, an oasis in the otherwise long, dry Sechura Desert that dominates the coastline in the Southwestern part of the country. Camaná was historically a major tourist destination in Perú, however, frequent and forceful earthquakes and tsunamis in the last decade (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007) decimated the city, permanently destroyed Camaná’s tourism industry, and lost many their jobs, livelihoods, and homes. But the one upshot of unemployment is that it creates an environment primed for microfinance. Microfinance allows a jobless entrepreneur to realize their would-be microenterprises, like the one your client is pursuing today.
Miguel es un hombre casado de 25 años, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad , uno tiene 2 años y el otro tiene 5 años el cual esta cursando el nivel inicial, el  se dedica al negocio del servicio de cabinas de Internet.  Miguel es un hombre luchador, trabajador con muchas ganas de sacar adelante a  su familia, lleva en el negocio hace 1 año, gana un promedio de S/. 200.00 soles semanales.  Con el crédito que se le otorgará gracias a Kiva de S/. 1000.00 soles, será invertido para  darle mantenimiento a sus máquinas (computadoras)
uno de sus sueños es tener su propia casa para que en un futuro no muy lejano les pueda dar una mejor calidad de vida  a su familia y tener más espacio para sus hijos, su asesor cree que es un buen cliente y que si pagará puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Miguel lives and works in Camaná, Peru, an oasis in the otherwise long, dry Sechura Desert that dominates the coastline in the southwestern part of the country. Camaná was historically a major tourist destination in Peru.  However, frequent and forceful earthquakes and tsunamis in the last decade (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007) decimated the city, permanently destroyed Camaná’s tourism industry, and lost many their jobs, livelihoods, and homes. But the one upshot of unemployment is that it creates an environment primed for microfinance. Microfinance allows jobless entrepreneurs to realize their would-be microenterprises, like the one your client is pursuing today.

Miguel is a married man 25 years old.  He has two minor children, one 2 years old and the other one 5 and in his first year of elementary school.  He has an internet cafe business.  Miguel is a fighter, a hardworking man who wants to get his family ahead.  He has had the business for one year and earns an average of 200 PEN weekly.

With the loan of 1000 PEN that he will be granted thanks to Kiva, he will invest in giving maintenance to his machines (computers).

One of his dreams is to have his own house so he can give his family a better quality of life in the near future and have more space for his children.  His advisor believes that he is a good client and will make his payments punctually.

loans.use: to give maintenance to his computers.

loans.name: Alice Njoki

texts.en: Alice, 45 years old, is a single woman with a 22-year-old daughter. She is a self-motivated woman. For the last eight years, she has been selling clothes such as skirts, suits and blouses. In addition, she does farming to add to her source of income. Sometimes, she has low purchasing power from the customers. She will be using the loan of KES 20,000 to buy two bales of skirts and suits. Alice hopes to be the leading supplier in her town in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy two bales of skirts and suits.

loans.name: Angelica Susana

texts.es:
La señora Angelica Susana es casada, tiene 32 años, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la tejeduría de cortes típicos, lleva 9 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien la poya económicamente.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de diferentes colores y también de diferentes clase, hilos de mish y alta seda, espera en el futuro su negocio crezca.
texts.en: Angélica Susana, 32, is married and went to all six grades of elementary school; she has three children who are attending school.  She weaves traditional fabrics and has nine years’ experience.  Her husband helps her out economically.  She’s asking for a loan to buy thread in assorted colors and of different kinds, ‘hilos de mish’ [rayon thread with a silk-like appearance] and silk.  She hopes her business will grow in the future.

loans.use: to buy yarn.

loans.name: Yesenia Paulina

texts.es: La socia Yesenia; continua con su negocio de compra y venta de venta de cosméticos de Esika y Oriflame, la socia requiere con el nuevo prestamo comprar nuevos productos para tenerlos en stock como por ejemplo productos de belleza como lapices labiales, cremas, perfumes, maquillajes de ojos, cejas, rimel y todo lo que sale frecuentemente, la socia tambien debera pagar su ultima campaña para sacar nuevos productos para seguir haciendo su capital y ahorrando para continuar con sus estudios y de este modo ser mejor cada dia.
texts.en:
The communal bank's member Yesenia is continuing with her business buying and selling Esika and Oriflame cosmetics.  With this new loan that the member is requesting, she will purchase new products to keep in stock, for example beauty products such as lip pencils, creams, perfumes, make up for eyes and eyebrows, Rimmel makeup, and everything that she sells on a regular basis.

The member also needs to pay for her efforts to search for new products, in order to continue building her capital and to save for continuing her education, and in this way improving every day.

loans.use: to stock up her business with beauty products

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en:
Mediatrice is 36 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 3 and 12 years, they all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been farming for the past 5 years. With the loan from kiva, she would like to pay the workers who harvested beans. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumptions and pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay the workers who harvested beans.

loans.name: Bhan's Group

texts.en:
Bhan,standing to the left hand side of the photograph in a green saree is a humble resident of Koraput district,Odisha,India. She lives with her husband who is a truck driver and her two sons are unemployed.
Working in the fields is one of the most difficult jobs today, due to the great effort needed to make progress, but Bhan is a woman who has never given up, despite the weather or other circumstances that may arise. She is always prepared to seek resources for her family.

She gets up first thing in the morning to perform the necessary work on her farm. In addition to this, she sells milk that she gets from her own cows. She hopes to increase her working capital to support her businesses. 

This is why Bhan along with her group member is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. Bhan will invest her portion of the loan amount in purchasing a milk cow. This will give a boost to her business and in turn she will have a better income resulting to her financial upliftment.

Bhan is eagerly awaiting for your kind help.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Luis

texts.en: I have been running my store for 2 years, and I have been successfully partly because I have two Atari videogame consoles which the local kids like to play.  My store is busy.

loans.use: Buy inventory

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married. She has a grown son who is 26 and is fostering a 10-year-old orphan boy from a disfunctional family of alcoholics. She also takes care of an elderly lady who doesn’t have a family. Irina’s business selling office supplies and providing copying services is the main source of income for her family. Irina is very sociable. Her friendliness and respectful attitude have given her a good reputation at the market. Irina has also proven to be a good manager of her finances. She has received and promptly repaid 12 loans from “Nadiya Ukraine”. Loans have enabled a gradual expansion of Irina’s business. Originally she had only one portable table with office supplies. Lending services from “Nadiya Ukraine” have helped her purchase inventory in bulk and rent a storage room. Recently she bought two copier machines and now provides copying services.
