She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Nambou

texts.fr:
L. est une cliente de HOPE Congo. Elle a 37 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l’âge varie entre  5 et 16 ans. 
Ayant constaté que le salaire de son mari ne suffisait pas pour supporter la charge de sa famille et les enfants prendre en charge les frais d’écolage des enfants, elle décide  de monter une activité en 2007,  avec la somme de 40.000 frs, elle ouvre un restaurant spécialité grillade de viande de bœuf, cuisse de poulet et de poissons.
Avec le prêt octroyé, elle compte acheter des  2 cartons de steak de viande de bœuf, 3 cartons de cuisse de poulets, et un carton de poissons, un bidon d’huile de 25l, des épices et du maniocs.
Ses ventes sont considérables, elle a des revenus journaliers de 30.000frs à 70.000 frs par jour, elle a aussi des gros bénéfices et elle est entrain d’épargner pour agrandir et ouvrir un grand restaurant.
texts.en:
L. is a client of HOPE Congo. She is 37 years old, married and mother of 4 children aged between 5 and 16 years.

Seeing that the wages of her husband were not enough to support the expenses of her family and children, as well as the expenses of their schooling, she decided to begin an activity in 2007. With the sum of 40,000 frs, she opened a restaurant with a specialty of grilled beef, chicken leg and fish. 

With the new loan, she intends to buy of the 2 cartons of beef steak, 3 cartons of chicken leg, and a carton of fish, an oil can of 25 liters, spices and maniocs. 

Her sales are considerable, with daily incomes of 30.000frs to70.000 frs, she has also a good return and she is in the process of saving to grow and open a large restaurant.

loans.use:
Purchase  cartons of :
sides of pork , sausage, chicken legs, chicken wings

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia tiene  31 años y vive en la Comunidad de San Isidro de Chicon que se encuentra ubicado a 15 minutos  de la ciudad de Urubamba, Cusco – Perú. En la comunidad de Chicon los pobladores se dedican a la ganadería y agricultura. Alicia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas, chanchos y otros pequeños animales que sirven para el consumo de la familia o para vender. También Alicia se dedica a la venta de granos secos. Alicia en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar para animales menores. 

Alicia pertenece al banco comunal “Los Dinámicos de San Isidro de Chicon” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Alicia is 31 years old and lives in San Isidro de Chicón which is located 15 minutes from the city of Urubamba, Cusco, Perú.  Chicón’s residents are mostly farmers and raise livestock.  Alicia raises small farm animals like: guinea pigs, chickens, pigs and other small animals which are for her family’s consumption or to sell.  She also sells dry grains.  On this occasion Alicia needs the loan to buy small farm animals.

Alicia is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Los Dinámicos de San Isidro de Chicón” (San Isidro de Chicón’s Dynamic Ones) communal bank and she is grateful for the opportunity she’s been given through this means and she also commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy small farm animals.

location.town: San Isidro de Chicon- Urubamba - Cusco

loans.name: Together As One Group

texts.en:
Henrietta K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Henrietta was born in Yonni Bana, a village in northern Sierra Leone, about 36 years ago. She is married to a medical doctor and they have three children.

For four years, Henrietta has been selling gara lappers (locally dyed cloth). Henrietta will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy materials to make gara lappers to sell. 

This is the first loan that Henrietta and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials to produce gara cloth for sale

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis tiene 44 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa propia en Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Actualmente, su comunidad no cuenta con los servicios básicos de luz o agua.

Se dedica a la cultivación de limón el cual lo asiste diariamente y lo cosecha semanalmente. También cuenta con una camioneta la cual la trabaja los días sábados y domingos realizando cargas de mercadería. Realizan estas actividades desde hace más de 6 años. Desea invertir su crédito en la compra de abono para el limón y en el pago de jornales a los trabajadores que contrata para el desyerbo de su cultivo. Luis desea seguir creciendo en su negocio para generar mayores ingresos y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Luis is 44 years old, married, and has one child.  He lives in his own home in Tambogrande, an agricultural area of Piura province, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.  Luis' community doesn't currently have access to the basic services of electricity or water.

Luis grows lemons.  He tends his crops every day and harvests them every week.  He also has a small truck which he uses on Saturdays and Sundays to transport merchandise.  He has been carrying out these activities for more than 6 years.

Luis would like to invest his loan in buying manure for his lemons and to pay day laborers who he hires to weed his crops.  Luis would like to continue growing in his business so that he can make more income and provide his family with a better quality of life.  For this reason, he has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy manure for his lemons

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en:
This is 25-year-old Abdulai C.. He is married and has one child, aged 1 year. 

Abdulai has been selling motor spare parts and lubricants. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 400,000 every month. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Abdulai requires this loan in order to buy engine oil for resale. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 150,000. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy drums of engine oil for resale.

loans.name: Homer Francisco

texts.es: Homer Francisco es un hombre casado de 26 años. Que se dedica  a la venta de mercadería en general como ropa y chinelas y zapatos. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a este medio de vida pues  tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo el se encarga de proporcionarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios. Es por este motivo que solicita este crédito para la compra de perfumes, pañuelos, sabanas, calzado, ropa interior y cosméticos. Por lo que él tiene el negocio ubicado en una parte muy concurrida del mercado para seguir incrementando sus ventas y de paso hacerse más conocido.
texts.en: Homer Francisco is 26 years old and married.  He sells general merchandise, such as clothing, flip flops, and shoes.  He’s been doing this for eight years because he has three children and must support his family.  He is asking for this loan to buy perfumes, handkerchiefs, sheets, footwear, underclothing, and cosmetics.  His business is located in a well trafficked part of the market and he wants to continue increasing his sales and also become better known.

loans.use: to buy inventory items

loans.name: Joacklyn

texts.en: Jacklyn, a 28-year-old married mother of two children, neither of whom is yet in school, sells beans and cow-peas to earn a living. She has requested a loan to buy more beans and cow-peas for her business, and she hopes to buy cows and goats to raise in the future to earn extra income.

loans.use: to stock more beans and cow-peas to sell.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.en:
Jose Luis is 39 years old and lives with his partner and two young children. With a systems and engineering background, Jose Luis has owned and operated for two years a small internet café that also offers international phone calls, photocopies and faxing.   

He intends to use the loan proceeds to invest in his business (new computers, a photocopier, etc). Jose Luis’ hope is that all of his hard work will grow the business to the point where he can buy his own property for the business, instead of continuing to pay rent as he is now.

loans.use: to buy new computers, a photocopier, etc.

loans.name: Martha Yadira

texts.es:
La señora Martha Yadira es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora  quien se dedica al comercio de ropa, perfumes y chiverias. Este negocio lo inicio hace 7 años inicio vendiéndole a una señora ropa usada y poco a poco ha ido creciendo gracias a los créditos y su ardua labor.
El crédito lo ocupara para la compra de mercadería en especial encargos para el día del padre. Ella sueña con tener una casa más amplia.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha Yadira is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She sells clothing, perfumes, and yogurts. Martha started her business seven years ago by selling used clothing. Her business has grown gradually over time thanks to the loans and her hard work.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise since she has special orders for Father’s Day. Her dream is to have a larger house.

loans.use: to purchase men's clothing.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a 53-year-old married woman currently residing in the village of Rizal West, San Isidro. She has four children, and they are generally adult-aged and have their own families.

Divina is engaged in a vending activity where she sells a variety of fruits and vegetables within the community where she lives. She has been doing it for almost 10 years, and she earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) monthly. According to her, through her vending activity she has been able to raise her children and send them to school. 

With her dreams and goals in life, she would like to continue improving her backyard vegetable garden. In this regard, she would like to ask for additional capital amounting of PHP6,000 for the improvement of her business. She wants to purchase additional vegetable seeds and pesticides. Divina hopes that her requested loan will be fulfilled so that she can improve the business that she manages.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetable seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is 54 and is unmarried. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Nga makes and sells pancakes for her customers in the local community. She has been engaged in the pancake making business for 20 years. To attract more customers, Nga is requesting a loan to buy new furniture and purchase better ingredients for her pancakes. 

Nga hopes that this loan will help her generate more profits and improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and better ingredients for making pancakes.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria vive en compañía de sus hijas en la asa que sus padres la dejaron. Se dedica a realizar bordados artesanales desde hace 3 años, se inicio por invitación de una de sus amigas que la enseñó este oficio, ahora trabaja independientemente en la comodidad de su casa para poder atender su hogar y sus hijas. Paralelamente  cultiva alfalfa para venderla al por mayor. Por tal razón, no tiene un horario fijo, de trabajo, pero es muy constante en la realización de sus bordados ya que  por la complejidad del trabajo y el grosor del bordado en la tela este trabajo dura hasta un mes de realizado. Como resultado termina en una bella prenda  típica que causa admiración en sus clientes y finalmente son comprados al contado. La época más rentable  en su negocio es cuando  están en plena época de festividades típicas llamadas la fiesta del Santiago que se celebra mucho por su zona. Desea crecer en su producción de faldas bordadas y contratar personas para ayudarla  en esta confección. Es su quinto crédito que tiene con MFP, siempre se ha destacado en su grupo solidario por ser puntual en sus pagos y se ha ganado la confianza de los demás integrantes, en todas estas oportunidades de crédito que ha tenido. Con el dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de hilos y telas, a la vez  comprará semillas y sacos de abono para sembrar alfalfa en algunos terrenos que adquirió recientemente.
texts.en:
Victoria lives with her daughters in the house her parents left her. She has been doing embroidery by hand for three years. She began this at the invitation of one of her friends who taught her this trade, and now she works independently in the comfort of her home so she can take care of her house and her daughters. She also grows alfalfa to sell wholesale. For this reason, she does not have a fixed schedule, but she is very regular about doing her embroidery because the complexity of the work and the thickness of the embroidery on the cloth make one project take up to a month. She ends up with a beautiful traditional outfit that her customers admire, and that is finally paid for in cash.

The most profitable time for her business is during the traditional feast of Santiago (St. James), which is celebrated a lot in her area. Victoria wants to increase her production of embroidered skirts and to hire people to help her make them. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She has always stood out in her communal bank for being punctual with her payments, and she has earned the trust of the other members in all the opportunities she has had to receive loans. She will invest the money she is asking for in the purchase of thread and cloth. At the same time she will buy seeds and sacks of organic fertilizer to sow alfalfa on some land she acquired recently.

loans.use: to buy thread and fabric, as well as alfalfa seed and sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Trinidad

texts.es:
María de 27 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con el servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola,  ganadera y turismo.

Desde hace algunos años María se dedica la venta de productos de primera necesidad (leche, arroz, aceite, papel higiénico, huevos, atún, algunas frutas, etc), su negocio lo a colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y necesidades familiares.

Para poder  implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más mercadería y de animales de corral ya que quiere incursionar en otro negocio, lo que le permitirá tener mayores ganancias para su hogar.  María es una persona responsable y trabajadora que se preocupa porque su familia salga adelante, además de brindarle otras opciones académicas a sus hijos en un futuro.
texts.en:
Maria is 27 years old and lives with her husband and children in her own house, which has water and electricity. It is located in the rural zone of Olmos district, pertaining to Lambayeque department. This zone is characterized by its agriculture, cattle-raising, and tourist activities.

For some years Maria has sold products of primary necessity (milk, rice, oil, toilet paper, eggs, tuna, some fruit, etc.). For her convenience, her business is located in her own house. With the earnings she obtains by selling products, Maria tries to cover all family expenses and necessities.

To be able to carry out her business, Maria is soliciting a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 new sols to buy merchandise and, also, corral animals, since she wants to launch another business, one that will allow her to have greater earnings for her home. Maria is a responsible and hard-working person who is concerned that her family get ahead, and she wants to offer her children other educational options in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store and farm animals for her corral.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cloth, thread and laces for her sewing business

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.en:
Ainagul is a resident of Tup. She is 51 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she has raised two daughters and a son. The daughters are married and live separately with their families, and the son studies at school. Sixteen years ago, in 1996, due to the high unemployment rate the family started to breed livestock. With an initial investment of 4000 soms Ainagul purchased five livestock animals for breeding.

Reselling livestock after fattening the family earns additional money to meet their daily needs. With money received from the loan, Ainagul wants to purchase cattle for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the near future, with the profits gained from reselling cattle, she wants to purchase a fridge to improve the family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Celena Marina

texts.es:
Celena tiene 34 años es casada y tiene 2 hijos, vive en Latacunga con su familia. Celena se describe como una persona tranquila, amigable , sencilla y de carcter fuerte.

Trabaja con su esposo en la venta de granos secos. Trabaja con Fodemi por 4 años el actual crédito lo van a utilizar para mejorar la infarestructura de su negocio lo cual les ayudará a enbodegar más productos y mejoraran sus ventas y sus ingresos lo cual va mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su sueño es mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Celena is 34 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in Latacunga with her family.  Celena describes herself as a calm, friendly, modest person with a strong character.

Celena works with her husband selling basic grains.  She has been working with Fodemi for four years and will use her current loan to improve the infrastructure of her business which will help her to store more products and improve her sales and income.  This will improve her quality of life.

Celena's dream is to improve her income.

loans.use: to expand her business infrastructure

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah is married with five children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. Hadjah has a business of selling bananas. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

Besides selling bananas, she generates additional income from rental houses. She sells her bananas at the market and sells to all categories of people at retail. Her major business challenges include the ever-increasing price of bananas and the rainy season. 

Hadjah's goals and aspirations are to start going to villages of Masaka and Mbarara for bananas. She resides in a house which she owns and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Hadjah's greatest monthly expenses include school fees and electricity bills.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 32 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Eufemia has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Eufemia has been in this business for three years. Eufemia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy stocks of groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Aquilina works hard to support her family.

She has a banana retail business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from selling firewood. Aquilina is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell in her stall.

Aquilina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell in her stall

loans.name: Muhannad

texts.en:
Muhannad is 37 years old, has been married since 2005, and recently welcomed his third child. 

Three years ago he opened a stationary store in Al Zarqa. In the beginning he used to sell basic stationary items with not much of a collection, now his store is selling not only stationary items but also kid's toys and gifts. 

Now Muhannad wants to expand more by adding more toys before the holiday season comes, that's why he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To add more toys and gifts before the holiday season comes

loans.name: Dusmurod

texts.ru: Дусмурод проживает в Гиссарском районе. Он холост. Ему 25 лет. Он живет вместе с родителями. Уже четыре года как он занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Dusmurod lives in the Gissar region. He is 25 years old, single and lives with his parents. For the last four years he has been selling groceries. Dusmurod would like to take out this loan to purchase additional inventory for his business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is 44 years old and married with a family of seven. She supports five children who are in school. For the past 13 years, Teresia has run a cereal store as well as a small general merchandise kiosk. She earns an average profit of 20,000 KES and has been able to meet the financial needs of her family.
  
Teresia is requesting an 80,000 KES loan to purchase stock for her store including beans, green grams, and rice, and to pay to transport these goods. She has repaid three previous loans. With the income from her loan, Teresia intends to expand her business by increasing the number of items she sells. Her dream is to buy a plot of land and build a house for her family and also houses to rent out.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a nice and responsible woman. She is married and the mother of three children. Elma only finished her high school education and then got married at a young age. She then got involved in rice farming as a source of income. She helped her husband transplant rice seedlings and learned a lot about this business. With the profits earned from the business, she was able to support her family's needs for meals and also pays for tuition fees for her children who are still in elementary grade.

Elma would like to further improve her crop porduction but she is limited financially to buy inputs. In this regard, she is now asking for a loan of P50,000 to buy 15 bags of fertilizers for use in farming. In the future, Elma would like to keep producing better crops to ensure a brighter future for her family.

loans.use: to buy 15 bags of fertilizers for use in farming

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia de 22 años de edad, es una madre soltera de 2 hijos de 6 y 3 años. Ella cuenta con una casa propia en el centro poblado de Pumpuriani, Chanchamayo. El calor es intenso en su provincia. Cecilia ha sabido aprovechar esta circunstancia para  vender helados y chupetes a los sedientos transeúntes de su localidad. 
Además cuenta con terrenos de cultivo, en 2 parcelas produce plátanos y en un lote siembra maíz.
El maíz estará listo para el mes de febrero y cree que para esos días el precio estará a 1.50 soles en kilo. “Mi terreno me botará 3000 kilos de maíz y estaré ganando en todo algo de 4500 soles”, comenta contenta.
El precio del maíz no es estable y ese es uno de sus inconvenientes en el negocio, llegando a costar el precio por kilo a 0.50 céntimos. Pero al fin y al cabo logra recuperar lo invertido.
En el trabajo del campo recibe el apoyo de personal operario a quien paga diariamente por sus servicios. 
De esa manera coordinada, Cecilia espera brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, traducida en alimentación, vestido y educación. Éste sería su primer préstamo de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. A la vez muestra entusiasmo al pertenecer a “Las Thinanis de Pumpuriani”, su banco comunal, del que se siente esperanzada. De recibir el dinero podrá comprar bolsas de abonos para su cultivo de maíz y para la yuca que empezará a sembrar.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 22, and a single mother with two children ages six and three. She has her own house in the settlement of Pumpuriani, Chanchamayo.  The heat is intense in her province. Cecilia has take advantage of this fact to sell ice cream and popsicles to thirsty passers-by in the village. 

In addition, she has farmland.  On two parcels she produces plantains and one parcel she grows corn. The corn will be ready by the month of February, and she thinks that by that time, the price will be at 1.50 soles per kilo. 

"My land will produce 3,000 kilos of corn, and I will be earning some 4,500 soles in all," she says happily. The price of corn is not stable, and that is one of her obstacles in business, as it sometimes reaches a price per kilo of 50 centimos.  

But when all is said and done, she manages to recover her investment. She gets help with the field work from hired hands, who she pays daily for their services. Through these plans, Cecilia hopes to provide her children with a better quality of life, translated into food, clothing and education. 

This would be her first loan with MFP, so she promises to pay her instalments on time. At the same time, she is enthusiastic about belonging to the "Las Thinanis de Pumpuriani" communal bank, which she feels hopeful about. 

On receiving the money, she will be able to buy sacks of fertilizer for her corn crop and for the yuca that she will start planting.

loans.use: To buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Jossias

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Provincia de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 5 filhos que ainda frequentam Escola. Fez somente 1ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e naõ sustenta mais ninguem.

É comerciante e dono do seu negocio ha mais de 10 anos, vende produtos diversos no quintal da sua casa onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.500.00mt por mês e aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, massas, farinha, sardinhas e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os emprestimos anteriores foram de 6.000.00mt, 7.000.00mt e 8.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende ampliar a sua actividade comercial e adquirir gado bovino para a criaçaõ, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Jossias was born in Boane District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. He is married and has five children who still go to school. Jossias only finished first grade and did not continue because his parents could not afford it. He lives in his own house with his family and does not support anyone else.

Jossias has had his own business for more than ten years. He sells a variety of products from the yard of his house, and he earns about 5,500 meticais per month. He uses the money for household expenses and saves some in his bank account.

He has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvukut through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is Jossias' fourth Hluvuku loan. He is asking for 10,000 meticais so he can buy products (rice, pasta, flour, sardines and other items) to increase his inventory. The previous loans were for 6,000 meticais, 7,000 meticais and 8,000 meticais, all used for the same activity.

Jossias promises to make his payments on time. He intends to expand his business one day and also buy some cattle to raise. In order to do those things, Jossias intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (rice, pasta, flour, sardines, etc.).

loans.name: Evarista Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Evarista, es una humilde agricultora de la zona de Masaya, junto a su familia, desde hace varios años se dedica a los  trabajos de campos, especialmente al cultivo de yuca, la gran dificultad que se le presenta es no contar con recurso necesarios para iniciar la siembra ya que en la cosecha del año pasado sufrió perdida total del mismo;  ya que afecto los enormes chubascos de agua llevandose todo el cultivo,  logrando cancelar su crédito con mucha dificultad y desasiéndose de una pequeña vaca que tenia la cual le generaba leche para su familia pero la necesidad de quedar bien la obligo a venderla ya que dice que en un futuro la podar reponer , el financiamiento lo necesita para comprar madera para yuca , fertilizantes e insumos , mano de obra  y otros suministros para realizar una buena siembra y tener producto de calidad .
texts.en: Evarista is a humble farmer in the area of Masaya. For several years, with her family she has worked in the fields. She has grown mostly yucca. The big problem she has had is not having the resources necessary to start the crops since she suffered a total loss of last year's crop.The heavy rain storms really affected her and swept away the whole crop. She was able to pay off her loan with much difficulty and by selling a small cow she had that generated milk for her family. The need to pay her debt resulted in her having to sell it, since she says that in the future she can replace it. She needs the loan to buy wood for the yucca as well as fertilizer, materials, labor and other supplies to have a good crop an have quality product.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and materials.

loans.name: Vriginia

texts.es:
La Señora Virginia es una mujer muy joven de 32 años que se encuentra casada con el señor José Luis Ramírez con el que procreó 4 hjos, el mayor tiene 12 años va en la secundaria, el que le sigue tiene 11 años, otro tiene 9 años y el más pequeño tiene 6 años los últimos 3 asisten aún a la primaria.

Desde hace ya 5 años la señora Virginia y su esposo se dedican a la fabricación y venta de fibras de alambre, que les ha ayudado en gran medida al sustento de su familia. La forma en que ellos elaboran las fibras es la siguiente:

1° Compran la fibra por kilogramo, compran alambre con el que amarraran la fibra, los kg según la cantidad de fibras que vayan a elaborar, hacen un cálculo muy riguroso.

2° Cortan la fibra

3° Amarran la fibra con el alambre, obteniéndo así las fibras que después servirán para uso doméstico (en lavara los trastes)

La señora Virginia comenta que esta actividad es una gran ayuda, ya que gracias a ella puede cubrir los gastos de su casa y de su negocio, ella tiene muchos sueños y metas, uno de ellos es llegar a poner su propio negocio ya que actualmente la venta de fibras las lleva a cabo en su casa de una forma informal, a ella le gustaría poner un local en el que se dedique especialmente a comercializar sus productos y así mejorar su vida y la de su familia, es por eso que ella se acercó a los préstamos de Fundación Realidad para así tener más y mejores opciones de ingresos
texts.en:
Virgina is a young woman who is 32 years-old. She is married to José Luis Ramírez, with whom she has four children. Their oldest child is 12 years-old and is studying in middle school. The other children are 11 years old, 9 years old and 6 years-old and all attend primary school. 

For the past five years Virgina and her husband have made a living manufacturing and selling wire fibers. This business has helped greatly to sustain their family. The way they make the wire fibers is as follows:

1. Buy the fiber (by the kilogram) and wire to tie the fiber. The number of kilograms they buy depends on the quantity of products they are going to make, so they calculate their purchases precisely.

2. Cut the fibers

3. Tie the fibers with the wire, in this form they can be used for household use (to wash dishes)

Virgina told us that this activity is very helpful because it helps her to cover household expenses and business expenses. She has many dreams and goals, one of which is to be able to have her business outside of her home. Now she is selling informally from her home, but she would like to open a location that is specifically dedicated to the sale of her products. In this way she hopes to better her life and the life of her family. It is for this reason that she came to request a loan from 'Fundación Realidad' in order to have better income options.

loans.use: to manufacture wire fiber cleaning products.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy  is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as a determined woman . She operates a beauty salon and retail business where she provides hair services and sells clothes . Her business is located within a busy business environment and her primary customers are women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving her beauty salon business . She will use the KES 58,990 loan to buy a fridge and water dispenser which will be used by her four family members on household activities. Her business goal is to expand her business within the next 5 years.

loans.use: to buy a water dispenser and a fridge

loans.name: Finagnon Sébastienne

texts.fr: Finagnon Sébastienne est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à un certain Donatien. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. La famille vit ensemble. Finagnon Sébastienne assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges familiales.  Finagnon Sébastienne a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pour subvenir à ses différents besoins, Finagnon Sébastienne vend depuis une dixaine d’année des savons et des produits cosmétiques par la technique de distribution. Finagnon Sébastienne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. En vue de renforcer davantage son activité par l’augmentation du stock de ses produits, afin de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Finagnon Sébastienne sollicite pour une deuxième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Le crédit consentis antérieurement a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des savons et des produits cosmétiques.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Roselyn works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. Roselyn is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy more clothing to sell for her clothing retail business.

Roselyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Maria Del Consuelo

texts.en: My clients order Ã­tems from me when they want something pretty for their house.  I make bedspreads, pillow cases, curtains, drapes, and other Ã­tems.  Recently, I have had success selling furniture coverings door to door to shops.   I have a lot of orders pending and I need to invest in materials.  Getting this loan will help me be able to buy the materials to help a whole new set of customers.  It is difficult to grow a business without a loan, and loans are hard to get.  Thank you for your help.

loans.use: Purchase working materials such as material, lace, and thread.

loans.name: Kelvin De Jesus

texts.en:
My name is Kelvin M. and I sell food like hotdogs and drinks. I have had my business for 4 years and I have a good clientel as I am located near to various private and governmental offices. My business generates enough income to support my family. My goal is to increase sales and with the additional earnings I will be able to by another hotdog cart and to give my brother a job as well as feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Kelvin M. me dedico a la venta de comida hotdogs y refrescos tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que estoy ubicado cerca de varias oficinas privadas y gubernamentales, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mis ventas y con las ganancias que tenga poder comprar otro carrito de hotdogs y darle trabajo a mi hermano asi mismo alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: To purchase bread, hotdogs, onion, tomatoes, salsa, mayonaisse, mustard, drinks, and napkins.

loans.name: Ut

texts.en:
Ut is 60, her husband is 7 years older. They have two sons who have stopped attending school to work for somebody in Ho Chi Minh City. Their ages are 23 and 21.

Ut and her husband are so old that they aren't able to work as labourers. They operate a grocery store. Their income is $9 per person/month. They need a loan for $75 so that they can expand and increase the variety of food in their grocery store. They are going to repay monthly.

loans.use: To expand and increase the variety of food for their grocery store.

loans.name: Justus Simiyu

texts.en: Justus has been married for seven years. He has three children, (two girls and one boy) who are all in Primary school. He operates his business hand in hand with his wife from Myanga, Chwele, Mayanja  markets which he attends on Tuesday, Wednesday, Monday and Friday, respectively. For six years Justus has been in the business  of selling cereals like Maize, Beans, Millet  and Ground nuts, which he normally gets from Malaba and other market places Like Myanga. Through his business he has been able to support his family and provide for the welfare and education of his children who are in private school. He faces many challenges like high transport cost which has gone up to $8. He gets up to $12 per day in profit. With the loan from Pemci he hopes to increase on his stock and  be able to buy himself a bicycle to improve on transportation. He dreams of expanding his business in order to supply a variety of product like cereals and retail goods in the whole Bungoma district.

loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en: Rugiatu K. is engaged in petty trading in one of the small markets in Makeni in Sierra Leone.  A widow with four children, Rugiatu is responsible for raising her children.  Because of her outstanding character and ability to organize market women, she was made the leader of the traders in the market.  With her previous loan from SMT, she was able to increase her income and meet other household expenses, including school fees for her children.  She would like to expand her business so that she can generate more income to pay for her children's expenses.  She is therefore requesting a loan of $200.

loans.use: to expand her business inventory

loans.name: Phung Thi Thanh

texts.vi:
Ms Phùng Thị Thanh is 44 years old. She owns a clothing store in Xuân Hòa village (in the township of Phúc Yên). She serves her customers very well. She makes them feel comfortable coming to her store, knowing that they will get excellent advice from her in selecting the clothes that would suit their style. On top of that, she is so friendly, warm and always has a smile on her face. Her 7 year experience in the clothing business helps her provide excellent advice to her customers of all types. She has 2 children, aged 22 and 18. Her husband, Phạm Duy Tân, has retired from the work force due to his disability. He lends her a good hand in running the store. He picks up the merchandise in Hà Nội, Móng Cái and transports back to the store. Ms Hà is the member of the TYM fund for the last 5 years. This time she requests a loan of 625 USD to buy more clothes. She hopes to be able to qualify for bigger loans from TYM fund in the future.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Phùng Thị Thanh Hà, 44 tuổi, có một cửa hàng quần áo tại phường Xuân Hòa, thị xã Phúc Yên. Những khách hàng có dịp đến đây đều luôn nhớ tới thái độ vui vẻ, nhiệt tình cùng nụ cười luôn thường trực trên khuôn mặt của bà chủ cửa hàng. Khách đến mua hàng thường được tư vấn về việc nên mua gì, mặc gì cho đẹp, cho phù hợp với lứa tuổi. Kinh nghiệm 7 năm trong việc kinh doanh quần áo giúp chị có những lời khuyên hợp lý cho mọi loại khách hàng. Chị Hà hiện có hai người con 22 và 18 tuổi. Chồng chị, anh Phạm Duy Tân, một công nhân về nghỉ mất sức, là người trợ giúp tích cực cho công việc kinh doanh của vợ. Anh chính là người đi lấy hàng từ Hà Nội, Móng Cái về cho vợ bán. Là thành viên năm thứ 5 của Quỹ Tình thương, chị Hà đang xin vay 625 USD để tăng lượng hàng nhập về. Chị mong muốn trong tương lai sẽ được vay những mức vốn lớn hơn từ Quỹ.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her shop

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor is 42 years old, married, with 2 children. He is owner of a business dedicated to the selling of sculptures and artwork of all kinds related to saints. He has been doing this for over 12 years and is located right in front of the Caacupé basilica.

Victor says that November and December, Caacupé receives a large number of visitors from all over the country, so the number of items he sells during those months is high and generates large earnings.

For the upcoming year he has a project to open a branch store, where he can also sell games, clothing and cell phone accessories; so he is gathering savings to make this dream a reality. Today he is asking for a new loan to be able to buy more Saint-related artwork and sculpture as the holidays are approaching and the demand for these items is rather high.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Victor tiene 42 años está casado y tiene 2 hijos, el es propietario de un negocio que se dedica a la venta de imágenes y esculturas de todo tipo de santos, la misma lo tiene desde hace más de 12 años y está ubicado frente mismo a la basílica de Caacupé.

Victor comenta que los meses de Noviembre y Diciembre la ciudad de Caacupé recibe a gran cantidad de visitantes de todas las ciudades del país, por lo que la venta de sus productos durante esos meses es bastante alta y produce grandes ganancias.

Para el año que viene tiene en proyecto abrir una sucursal, en donde también incorporaría a las ventas juguetes, ropas y accesorios para celulares; por lo que está juntando unos ahorros para poder concretar su sueño. Hoy solicita un nuevo crédito para poder comprar más imágenes y esculturas de santos pues ya se acercan las festividades y la demanda de estos artículos es bastante alta.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of artwork and sculptures of Saints

loans.name: Emiliana De

texts.es:
Emiliana is 38 years old, is married and has four children (the oldest is 16 and the youngest is 6). She has a very stable and united family. Emiliana, together with her husband, offer amplifier services, and her husband also works in a factory sewing slacks. They have enough experience in both their activities. But they have the longest experience working at sewing (they've done this for 11 years). Of course much depends on quality of product and service being offered to the public, who is very demanding. With this loan, Emiliana plans to buy speakers for her amplifier, which cost approximately $ US. 150 .- each, and she will purchase two of them. Emiliana has an excellent credit rating - this is the fourth loan she is requesting from our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Emiliana es una señora de 38 años de edad está casada y tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales solo una es mujer la mayor, con aproximadamente 16 años y el pequeño tiene unos 6 años. Tiene un nucleo familiar muy estable y una familia muy unida. Emiliana junto con su esposo tienen una amplificacion y por otra parte su esposo trabaja también en una fabrica de pantalones como costurero. Tienen bastante experiencia en sus 2 actividades, la costura es donde son mas antiguos con aproximadamente 11 años. La competencia en el medio es relativa y moderada, depende mucho la calidad de producto y servicio que se ofrece al público para tener demanda. Con la presente solicitud Emiliana comprara parlantes para su amplificacion que aproximadamente le cuestan $us. 150.- cada uno y comprara dos de ellos. Emiliana es una persona que tiene un excelente comportamiento crediticio, esta es la cuarta operación que solicita en nuestra Institución.

loans.use: To purchase speakers for her amplifier. (Compra de parlantes para su amplificación)

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel B. R. has a general store in the neighborhood of Juanjuicillo outside the jungle city of Juanjui, San Martin.  From the rented space Maribel sells goods that the population of Juanjuicillo most commonly purchases.  She started the store one year ago with $100 dollars and has experienced steady growth.  The store is also a comfortable environment where men come to drink beer.

Maribel is 29 years old, single, and has two children.  She initially started the business to help pay for her children’s education as well as take charge of her own.  It is often difficult for her to take care of her two young children and business but she works hard, organizes wisely, and receives help from her parents.  One day she dreams of owning a little home and sending her children to University.

Maribel is a member of the community bank, Maria Magdalena and is requesting a loan of $275 to repay over four months.  With the loan she would like to buy beer, soda, rice, oil, and restock her shelves.

loans.use: To buy beer, soda, rice, oil.

loans.name: Amin Allah

texts.en:
Amin Allah N. lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and father of two children. He has a shoe shop, a business he started 5 years ago. He has good numbers of clients, specially women, in Kabul.

Amin Allah wants to import more shoes for his shop, but for that he needs money. He wants to take an individual loan to complete his stock and make a good monthly income to help his family and build up a better business in the future. He is happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly lives on Adrián Patiño Street in the Tembladerani Region in La Paz with her children and husband. She works hard to sell shoes of every kind and has a stall in the city of El Alto. Here, she alone sells them at the flea markets on Thursdays and Sundays. The loan she requests is to increase the amount of capital she has, so she can restock her inventory to meet her many customers' demands. Nelly already had a loan from Kiva, which has already been paid off completely. Due to her credit history, she is approved for a new loan and qualified as a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

La señora Nelly vive en la calle Adrián Patiño de la zona de tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz con sus hijos y su esposo. Ella se dedica a la venta de calzados de todo tipo y tamaño y tiene un puesto de venta en la ciudad de El Alto lugar donde vende solo en ferias que son jueves y domingos. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y poder surtir mas su producto ya que tiene muchos clientes. Nelly ya obtuvo un crédito de Kiva, el cual ha sido pagado en su totalidad. Por su antecedente histórico puede acceder a un nuevo crédito, se califica como muy buena cliente.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Marthar

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Marthar H.. She is married and has three children, ages 2, 5, and 11.

In 2003, Marthar established her grocery store. Marthar requires a loan in order to purchase fruit, vegetables, rice, and oil. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, the women lack tangible collateral assets, and financial institutions do not consider them to be credit-worthy. This leads to poor financial support and, as a result, limited access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys the equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase fruit, vegetables, rice, and oil in bulk.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Señora Elva lives in the Yarina District of the Ucayali department, and belongs to the Mujeres con Futuro Comunal Bank. Elva is 63 years old and separated, but her income isn’t enough to support her family of 8 children. When Elva received her first loan of 300 Soles from Manuela Ramos, she started a business selling local fruits. Now she sells fruit from her home, which has the advantage of allowing her to take care of her home and children while running her business. At night she asks her children how they’re doing in school and helps them with their homework. With a loan of 1,000 soles, Elva will buy fruits like: plantains, coconuts, sweet peppers, mandarin oranges, and candies, and sodas. Elva is very happy with the loans that she’s received because they’ve helped her save and given her good terms. She hopes to continue to receive support to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elva pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres con Futuro, ubicado en el Jr. José Olaya Mz. Ñ Lt. 10, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 63 años y es madre de 8 hijos, es separada, pero los ingresos con los que cuenta no alcanzan para mantener a su familia. Elva con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de frutas regionales. En la actualidad vende sus frutas en la puerta de su casa, le da muchas ventajas por que así puede atender su casa y a sus hijos que aun depende de ella, por las noches les pregunta a sus hijos que tal les ha ido en su escuela y les ayuda a ser sus tareas. Con este préstamo de S/.1, 000 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará frutas regionales como: plátanos, coconas, ají dulce, mandarina, golosinas, gaseosas. Elva esta muy feliz es una gran ayuda los prestamos, por que la ayudan a ahorrar, las facilidades que le dan son muy buenas, y espera que la sigan apoyando para seguir creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: Elva will use the loan to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en: Mrs. Sophat U. is a grocer in Trapaing Krobao Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 54 and a widow with two children. one child breeds pigs and the other is a farmer. The child who breeds pigs has improved business and is ready to expand.  Mrs. Sophat U. is requesting a loan to  to buy three pigs for her child's business. Previously, Mrs. Sophat U. obtained a loan from Acleda Bank to purchase more grocery goods to start her grocery business. This loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: To buy three pigs for her child's business.

loans.name: Akbar

texts.ru:
Akbar K. is a businessman with 22 years of experience. He sells vegetables and fruits. He is married and has two children. Akbar plans to obtain the loan to increase goods circulation and subsequently make his business more profitable. Besides his business, Akbar works at a family farm, growing vegetables and selling the harvest for profit. He would use a portion of the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina, Kiva Volunteer.

Каюмов Акбар бизнесмен. Занимается бизнесом уже 22 года. Торгует овощами и фруктами. Женат , имеет двоих детей. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Это поможет увеличить прибыльность его дела. Кроме бизнеса он работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Выращивает овощи и получаемый урожай продает. Поэтому часть кредита использует на приобретение семян и удобрений

loans.use: To increase goods circulation

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Heng Y. was born in 1949 and she now lives in Preak Takeo Village in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. Kang Nov, are farmers who cultivate twice a year.  It is now the rainy season and Mrs. Heng Y. needs to cultivate rice.  Since she does not have enough money to plant seedlings, she asks for a loan to buy rice seeds and to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow her field. Mrs. Heng Y. has two children one of whom is employed in a security guard company while the other sells grocery products in Phnom Penh, Cambodian city. Her husband is shown on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and she would use the part of the loan to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow her field.

loans.name: Abdumajid

texts.ru: Иброимов Абдумаджид житель района Куляб.Возраст  42 года, женат, имеет 6 детей.Образование средне-техническое,по специальности маляр.Заработная плата маленькая поэтому клиент занимается животноводством. На доход от бизнеса он содержит свою большую семью.В семье работает только он один. В данный момент планирует купить очередного бычка.Погасит кредит в течении 12  месяцев.
texts.en:
Abdumajid I. is a resident of Kulob. 42-years-old, he is married and has six children. He attended a vocation-technical secondary school and became a house painter, but to earn extra money, he raises livestock. As the sole wage-earner in his family, he supports his large family with the income from this business. At present, Abdumajid is planning to buy his next steer. He will repay the loan over the course of twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a steer

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
Gulchehra Y. is 24 years old. As a good housewife, Gulchehra could not just sit still. Besides taking care of her 2 kids, Gulchehra runs a small cattle breeding business. She also raises sheep, and will use this loan to purchase a cow to raise for milk production and to finance the feeding and care of the animals.

This is her first loan with IMON, and like most of the women dealing with their first loan, it's a bit scary. It's stressful to think of the loan payments, but she decided to go ahead with the loan anyway. Her dream is to buy calves and raise them. The remote village where she lives has lots of pasture land, and the people make good use of it, raising lots of sheep and cattle. With great hope she is asking for a loan to purchase calves to raise for milk production. She is committed to paying back the loan on time. You could become an important part in Gulchehra family's life, and she deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Benkola (Accord) Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe sont en majorité des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 20 ans et 1 enfant. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles polygames avec leur mari et enfants dans le village de Marka-Coungo (Région de Koulikoro République du Mali). 
Les femmes du groupe BENKOLA se sont connues par des relations de mariages et sont spécialisées dans le commerce des produits de beauté.
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe) avec Soro Yiriwaso et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Ce nouveau prêt servira à acheter, 300 boites de pommade et crème, 200 bouteilles parfums de différentes qualités et d’autres effets pour le maquillage.
 Elles s’approvisionnent exclusivement à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès de grossiste de ce domaine. Elles reviennent vendre les produits dans les marchés de Marka-Coungo et de Fana au comptant en détail et à crédit à une clientèle essentiellement constituée de femmes. 
Elles espèrent chacune réaliser un bénéfice par cycle de 30 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille (frais de nourriture, sanitaire et scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
The members of the group BENKOLA are mostly married women who average 20 years of age and one child. They live in traditional polygamous families with their husband and children in the village of Marka-Coungo (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali).

The women of the group know one another via marital ties and are specialized in the commerce of beauty products. They are on their eighth solidarity loan (group loan) with Soro Yiriwaso. All of their preceding loans have been correctly repaid. This new loan will serve to buy: 300 jars of ointment and cream, 200 bottles of perfume of different grades, and other beauty care products.

They get their supplies exclusively in Bamako (capital of Mali) from wholesalers in this field. They come back to sell the goods at the marketplaces of Marka-Coungo and Fana, cash or credit accepted, to customers essentially composed of women. They each hope to realize a profit of 30,000 francs CFA per cycle each month that will be used to cover family expenses (cost of food, hygiene, and schooling for the children).

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ointments, creams, and other beauty products

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es: Leonarda tiene 25 años, vive con su pareja y su pequeño bebé de pocos meses de nacido. Se dedica a la atención de su pequeña tienda de abarrotes desde hace 5 años. Leonarda es una mujer que ha pasado muchos inconvenientes en su vida y que ha sabido sobrellevarlos, haciéndola más fuerte, siempre ha trabajado, desde que terminó sus estudios secundarios, brindándole toda la atención a su negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder realizarlo desde casa y atender a su pequeño bebé al mismo tiempo, ella quiere seguir trabajando muy duro para poder brindarle un futuro mejor a su familia, para lo cual necesita de nuestra ayuda. Leonarda se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitad comprará más cantidad de productos para implementar su tiendita.
texts.en:
Leonarda is 25 years old and lives with her husband and their small baby who is only months old. She has run a small grocery store for the past 5 years. Leonarda has passed through many trials in her life and has been able to overcome them, which has helped her to become stronger. She has worked since she finished high school, dedicating all her time to her small business. What she enjoys most about her work is her ability to run her business from her home where she can tend to her baby at the same time. She would like to continue working to offer a better future for her family which is why she is seeking help. This is the second loan she has requested from Microfinanzas Prisma and she has always been punctual with her payments. She will use the money to purchase more products to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the merchandise of her store

loans.name: Zaynab

texts.en:
Zaynab A. H. is 40 years old and lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with her husband and their three children. She has been working in clothing sales for a year. Zaynab has requested a loan of  800 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store that will allow her to have a larger collection of clothes. This is the first time that she has requested a loan.
Zaynab hopes that the loan will help her solve her financiA. issues. Zaynab is exceptionA. in her work. She has low prices, as well as diversity and a good quality of clothes. Her clients are friends, neighbors and tourists. When she first started her business, she faced difficulties like knowing the retailers and having a good idea about what was in fashion. She decided to do this type of work because she knows how to convince her clients and she is quite competitive in her business. In the future, she plans to own her own store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Proeng

texts.en: Mrs. Proeng S. is a 62-year-old widow who lives in Choer Teal village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she grows vegetables. She faces a problem because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizer to support her field, so she has decided to ask for a loan. Mrs. Proeng S. has two children. One child repairs motorbikes. The other is a farmer who helps his mother in her work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her field.

loans.name: Raïnatou

texts.fr: A.    habite le quartier d’adidogomé, où elle exerce le commerce de pagnes et de bijoux de façon ambulante, ce commerce marche bien pour elle et la demande est très elevée, pour y faire face, elle sollicite un crédit de 300000F pour agrandir son stock avec l’achat de pagnes et bijoux, elle fait ce commerce depuis 1997 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de lomé . Elle mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
A. lives in the Adidogomé district, where she goes door-to-door selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and jewelry. Her commerce is doing very well, and demand is quite high. To respond to this, she is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to expand her inventory by buying some pagnes and jewelry gotten from the grand marketplace of Lomé. She has been in this business since 1997. She is married and the mother of two.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics and jewelry

loans.name: Yorng

texts.en: Mrs. Yorng P. was born in 1980 and she now lives in Srae Boeng village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. On her plantation, she has an obstacle because she does not have enough money to buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticides, and fuel in order to water to support the field. In order to deal with these problems, she decided to request a loan for these purposes. Her husband, Mr. Khem Nay, is a laborer and he is also a motor taxi driver. Mrs. Yorng P. has a child who is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticides, and fuel

loans.name: Zainab M.akram Group

texts.en:
Zainab baj is a citizen of a city named Riwind, in Pakistan. She is thirty-six years old and married. She has been living in this city for the last fourteen years. Her husband's name is M., and he is a driver of a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). The owner gives him very little income even though the owner knows that her husband works really hard. Zainab baji decided to apply for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw for her husband so that he can get the entire amount of income from his work.

Zainab baj is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Qubra baji wants a loan to buy artificial jewelry to sell. Nawab baji wants a loan to buy thread to sell. Suraiya baji and Bashiran baji each want a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee the others' loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Various, including buying an auto-rickshaw

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en:
Gabriela runs an ice cream shop from her home in Andahuaylillas and also sells lunch from a stand in the town’s market. Her daughter helps her run the ice cream shop so that she can dedicate herself to preparing meals. At her lunch stand, Gabriela serves set lunch menus, starting with a soup (made of quinoa, wheat or potatoes) and followed with a main course of stew, rice with chicken, chicken pasta, saltado (beef or chicken stir-fried with french fries and vegetables and served over rice), or matasca (a traditional Peruvian beef and potato stew).

Gabriela starts cooking each morning around 7:30 am so that she’ll be ready to start serving her clients at 11 am. She has been working this way for about four years now. Gabriela is 42-years old and is married with four children. Three of her children are adults while the youngest is still an adolescent.

Gabriela is just getting her ice cream business up and running again since she doesn’t serve ice cream during the rainy months from January to March. She is requesting a loan of 3000 soles to invest in her ice cream shop. She makes all of the ice cream from scratch, so she needs to buy raw ingredients like milk, sugar, flavoring and food coloring. She will buy fresh whole milk from local producers for 1.30 soles per liter, and 50-kilo sacks of sugar for 90 soles apiece.

Gabriela’s goal for the future is to improve and expand her ice cream shop by buying a more modern mixer, a bigger freezer, and small carts so that local children can sell her homemade ice cream around town.

Gabriela is a member of the Las Triunfadoras (The Triumphant Women) Village Bank, a group of 19 women from the town of Andahuaylillas, about 40 minutes outside the city of Cusco in the Peruvian Andes.

loans.use: To buy milk, sugar, food coloring and flavorings to make ice cream

loans.name: Romel

texts.en:
Romel lives in the village of San Isidro, Quirino, Isabela. He is 31 years old and married to Maricel. They are blessed with three children, Nelmark, 12, Romarie, 10, and Marjoe, 5. The three sisters all attend school. The oldest is about to enter high school while the two younger ones are in elementary school. Romel is hoping that he will able to provide for all of their needs, especially education.

Romel supports his family by running a rice farm. He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide and seeds for the coming planting season. He hopes that ASKI will provide him with working capital to maintain his farming business. His goal is to have a good yield to pay back the loan. Romel is doing his best to support his family and save for his children’s college education. 

His family living situation is good because he, his wife and children share love and unity. One thing he really hopes is that all of them will finish college, and his is willing to work doubly hard to make this happen and achieve his goals in life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insectide and seeds

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: María del Rosario R. C. tiene la edad de 29 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña María tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. María es una mujer muy emprendedora y por muy sencillo que sea su trabajo, es el que mas le gusta ya que muchos de sus clientes son niños. Los propósitos de María son de invertir cada día en su pulpería par que sus clientes no se desanimen. Por los financiamientos es que su negocio ha mejorado y realmente ha visto el cambio. Y así recurre a Fundación León 2000 con el deseo de que le ayuden con el capital de trabajo y así comprara productos como golosinas, gaseosas, pan y jugos. Sus sueños son que la ayuda que se recibe de las organizaciones amigas esté ayudando a las personas que realmente lo necesitan.
texts.en:
María del Rosario R. C. is 29 years old and married. She has 2 school-age children. Her business is a bodega, which she has run for more than 5 years. María is a very enterprising woman, and as simple as her work is, it is what she loves best, since many of her customers are children. Maria intends to invest each day in her bodega so that her customers are not discouraged. She is requesting financing because her business has grown and the change is visible. Therefore, she came back to the Fundación León 2000 hoping to receive assistance with working capital, for the purchase of sweets, sodas, bread and juice. Her dream is that the help she receives from friendly organizations will also help those people who really need it.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo Valentín (de la misma edad), quien es chofer, y con sus hijos Magali de 22, Mayra de 20 y Valentina de 3 añitos en su casa propia. Desde hace 2 años se viene dedicando a la atención de sus cabinas públicas de Internet, las cuales implementó en su casa. Nos cuenta que anteriormente tenía que alquilar un local, pero gracias a un préstamo con MFP pudo arreglar su casa para instalar sus cabinas allí mismo. Ahora trabaja más tranquila y le gusta mucho su negocio ya que se le hace más fácil dedicarse de lleno a él, aunque muchas veces trabajar sola implica tener que resolver algunas dificultades con las computadoras, felizmente siempre ha sabido salir adelante y sabe que si quiere seguir progresando tiene que trabajar mucho, además está pensando poner a un costado de su local un centro de llamadas telefónicas. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, y dinero que solicita será para seguir mejorando su local, además de instalar cabinas telefónicas para generar otros ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana, 45, lives in her own house with her husband, Valentín, and her two children. Valentín is a chauffeur, and he is the same age as Ana. Her children are Magali, 22; Mayra, 20; and Valentina, 3. For two years she has been in the business of public Internet access, which is set up in her house. She previously had to rent a place, but thanks to a loan with MFP, she was able to arrange to set up the cubicles in her house. She now works more calmly. She really likes the business since it is easier to work on it full time, even though many times all she has to do is resolve problems with the computers. Happily, she has always known how to get ahead, and she knows that if she wants to keep progressing, she needs to work a lot. She is also thinking of putting a center for making phone calls on the side of her place. This is her fourth loan with Prisma. The money is to keep improving her place and to install telephone booths to generate other income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her place and set up a calling center

loans.name: Kabughabugha Women Itungu Mary Group

texts.en: Mary I., a 20-year-old married mother of five children, three of whom are in school, has been in the business of selling cassava flour for over two years. She is requesting the loan to purchase bags of cassava which she will make into flour for sale. Mary is a hard-working young businesswoman whose hope is to open up a shop.

loans.use: To purchase bags of cassava to make into flour for sale.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel L.'s dream is to own a tricycle (a local three-wheeled transport vehicle). For now, she is busy managing their small rice field to be able to have an abundant harvest to support her siblings. She is 45 years old and still single. She has been a farmer since she was just a small kid.

Believing that buying the farm necessities will help improve their yield, she applied for a loan worth Php 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). She will use the loan to purchase one bag of rice seeds, herbicides and 5 liters of crude oil.

CEVI helps small business grow. It provides credit, training, and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase one bag of rice seeds, herbicides and 5 liters of crude oil

loans.name: Dramane

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Dramane K. est âgé de 32 et vit avec ses épouses et leurs enfants  dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Wayerma I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur  Dramane K.  après avoir tenté beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initié à  l’activité d’achat et de vente de bazins blancs, soude caustique, teintures, etc. depuis maintenant quatre ans. Il mène cette activité à Wayerma I en face de l’Agence Malienne pour la Presse et la Publicité (AMAP) de Sikasso, non loin de la prison centrale où il dispose d’une boutique. Monsieur K. est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ deux  ans. Il est à son deuxième prêt individuel après  avoir remboursé sans difficulté le premier. 
Il compte acheter, 15 pièces de bazin, 10 sacs de potasse, 15 paquets de soude caustique et 10 boîtes de teinture de couleurs différentes à Bamako pour les revendre à une clientèle composée généralement des femmes teinturières de Sikasso et environs, en détail, au comptant et quelques fois à crédit. 
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Dramane K., 32, lives with his wives and their children in a big traditional family in Wayerma I, one of the working class neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Mr. Dramane K. tried out a number of businesses without success, then began buying and selling white “bazin” (a damask cloth used for local dyeing), caustic soda, dyes, etc. He has been in the business for 4 years now. He has a shop in Wayerma I opposite the Malian Agency for Press and Publicity (AMAP) in Sikasso, not far from the central prison. Mr. K. is much in demand with his clientele for the quality of his products.

Wishing to better satisfy his ever growing clientele, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso about two years ago. He is on his second individual loan after having reimbursed the first one without difficulty.

He intends to buy 15 lengths of “bazin” (damask), 10 sacks of potash, 15 packets of caustic soda, and 10 boxes of dye of various colors. He will buy these goods in Bamako and then re-sell them to a clientele composed generally of women who do dyeing in Sikasso and surrounding areas, retail, for cash, and sometimes on credit.

With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 150,000 F CFA which will be used essentially to grow his working capital, help support the family, and pay the interest on the loan, investing any remainder back into his business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of white damask cloth, caustic soda, dyes, potash, etc. for resale

loans.name: Naboth's Group

texts.en:
M. Naboth is the leader of his lending group in Ntungamo. He is 44 years old and a businessman involved in agriculture. He has been in this business for 20 years and the experience has made his work easy, hence winning him more customers. He is able to make a profit of about 200,000/= monthly and it is from this that he is able to pay school fees for his 6 children and 3 dependents plus saving for his children’s upkeep.

Naboth has been able to start up poultry and piggery businesses and the loan is going to help him expand these two businesses further by increasing the number of birds (chickens) and pigs, as well as buying more feed for their rapid growth.

loans.use: Buying more chickens and pigs plus their feed

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: R. is a 48-year-old woman, married to Soeun, age 65, and they both have given birth to three children. Two of them are married and earn a living by planting various crops on their own farmland, while other one daughter is a seamstress for garment industry. R. currently plants a rice crop, which she will harvest and collect her productivity when they are mature. R. requests a $500 loan in order to pay the cost of having a new electricity line for family's using. With the remainder of the loan she will buy an old motor for family's driving purposes. Note: R. was not available at that time so her husband appears in the picture instead.

loans.use: To pay the cost of having a new electricity line for family's using

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeurn K. lives in Slaeng Kaung village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Oem Ry, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate rice to earn a living.

On this plantation they face an obstacle because their field has infertile soil which it is bad enough to affect their crop. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Soeurn K. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the paddy field. She would use the rest of money to buy a cow for breeding.

Mrs. Soeurn K. is 58 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a construction worker and the other is employed in a garment factory. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a cow for breeding

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria A. owns a sari-sari store business in their location. Aside from selling variety of goods, she also earns additional income by selling sand and gravel. She has been earning big from these businesses. Though, she is 66 years old already, she is still strong and very able to develop more enterprise for her family to enjoy.

She requested another loan from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise to resell in her store. The loan as well will go far in buying more stocks of sand and gravel. She hopes that the loan will give her a good return of investment. Receiving this loan will not jsut lead her business expansion but earning big as well.

loans.use: buy additional merchandise to resell

loans.name: Delia Amparo

texts.es: La señora Delia P. tiene 51 años de edad, es casada, y vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y la menor de sus hijas la cual estudia en un Instituto de la ciudad. Vive en el caserío de Santa Matilde perteneciente al distrito de Santiago – Ica. Tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes el cual ha logrado mantener después del terremoto ya que se vió seriamente afectada porque su casa era de adobe. Actualmente ha logrado reconstruir su casa gracias al apoyo del gobierno y su negocio lo está acondicionando nuevamente con algunos ahorros que le brinda el alquiler de un vehículo que tienen hace varios años.
