Además se dedica a la elaboración de comida para fiestas y compromisos sociales. Su esposo no labora ya que ha perdido la vista debido a un problema de salud. Requiere financiamiento para invertir en su bodega y poder diversificar sus productos aprovechando los meses de fiestas navideñas. Su sueño es terminar de construir su casa de material  noble, hacer crecer su negocio y ayudar a su esposo con el tratamiento de su enfermedad.
texts.en:
Sra. Delia P. is 51 years old, married, and lives in her own home with her husband and three dependent daughters who attend school at an institute in the city. She resides in the village of Santa Matilide, which is in the district of Santiago – Ica. Delia manages a small grocery store. She was seriously affected by the earthquake because her house was made of adobe. Thanks to support she received from the government, she was able to rebuild her house and reestablish her business. With some savings, she acquired a vehicle that she has been renting out for several years. Delia also prepares food for parties and social engagements. Her husband is not working because he lost his sight as result of health problems.

Delia is requesting a loan so that she can invest in her grocery store and diversify her products in time for the Christmas season. Her goals include finishing the construction of her house through the use of sound materials, growing her business, and helping her husband by securing treatments for his illness.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for the Christmas season

loans.name: Adrián

texts.es:
Adrián R. A. es un señor de 36 años de edad que vive con su esposa y su hijo en una comunidad llamada Cimarrón de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y la agricultura. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. Cimarrón se localiza aproximadamente a hora y media en bus de Turrialba, el centro de comercio más cercano. Sin embargo, varias veces al año el camino se vuelve intransitable por las lluvias.

Desde hace varios meses que don Adrián ha querido iniciar con un negocio de cría de pollos para engorde y gallinas ponedoras para la producción de carne y huevos, cuenta en estos momentos con el local para tal fin pero le faltan los animales para que su negocio surja, él espera vender sus productos a los vecinos de su comunidad. Dice que el proyecto le es muy interesante.

 Actualmente don Adrián está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢500.000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de pollos y gallinas; concentrado, productos para el tratamiento de enfermedades, entre otros. Con esto el espera hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar tanto su calidad de vida como la de su familia. 

Don Adrián es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Nuevas Esperanzas para Cimarrón, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Adrian R. A. is a man of 36 years of age who lives with his wife and son in a community called Cimarron Santa Teresita de Turrialba in the Cartago Province. It is a small rural community of about two thousand people. Its population is engaged in milk production and agriculture. It has an irregular mountainside, and much of the ground is maintained like a moist tropical forest. Cimarron is located approximately 1.5 hours by bus from Turrialba, the nearest trading center. However, several times a year, the road becomes impassable due to rain. For several months, Mr. Adrian wanted to start a business raising chickens for fattening and laying hens for meat and eggs, but at this time he lacks the animals for which his business could grow. He expects to sell his products to neighbors in his community. He says that the project is very interesting. Mr. Adrian is currently applying for a micro-credit of 500,000 colones for the purchase of chickens and hens, and products for the treatment of diseases, among others. With this loan, he hopes to grow his business and improve the quality of life for his family. Mr. Adrian is a partner of the New Hope Community Bank for Cimarron, one of 100 community banks of EDESA in Costa Rica. This is his first loan, and he hopes to continue growing on a personal and economic level, as well as participate actively in the community bank in his community.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hens and chickens for fattening

loans.name: Gonzalina

texts.es: la sra. Gonzalina R. S. tiene 38 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, actividad a la que se dedica desde hace 2 años, con los ingresos que le genera el negocio cubre con sus gastos personales y tambien con parte de los gastos del hogar contribuyendole a su esposo. ella comento que la necesidad del credito es para surtir mas y asi mejorar las ventas en su negocio. este negocio les esta mejorado las condiciones de vida. con el credito va a surtir mas su negocio y asi mejorar sus ventas lo que le permitira mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sra. Gonzalina R. S. is 38 years old. For two years, she has been selling popular consumer products. The revenue she generates is used to cover her personal expenses and part of the household expenses. Her husband’s income is used for the remaining expenses. Gonzalina says she needs a loan for additional inventory so that she can increase her sales. This business provides a way for her to improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Kibimbiri Group B, Kihihi

texts.en:
K. Kenneth is 53 years old and the leader of his lending group in Kihihi. He is married with six children aged 13 - 28 years old and he takes care of three other children and one orphan.

Kenneth has been a trader dealing in the buying and selling of fish from Kihihi town council for 15 years and he is happy that, at the moment, he is able to make 100,000/= as profits a week.

Most of Kenneth’s customers are daily customers, so he is sure of his daily sales and what to buy from the suppliers so that the fish do not go bad from non-sales.

He needs to expand his business so that he can win more customers and be able to build a permanent house for his family. He needs a loan to inject it in his fish business which will increase his stock, giving him more profits. Kenneth is such a trustworthy and welcoming man, and this has won him much.

loans.use: Buying more fish for resale.

loans.name: Phiader

texts.en:
Phiader is a 47 year old married woman who has three children. One of her children is still in school and another one is married with children. Her husband is a farmer. She has been selling vegetables for three years. She also sells new clothes and earns income from farming maize, beans, oranges and mangos. 

With this loan, she wants to add inventory, such as clothing and vegetables. Previously, she was only selling used and new clothes. She hopes to send her children to college and buy a plot of land some day. In the future, she wants to employ others. She describes herself as hard-working.

loans.use: To add inventory, such as clothing and vegetables

loans.name: Juana Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Juana del Socorro se ha destacado por ser muy trabajadora dedicándose al negocio de venta de verduras en el mercado Central del departamento de Chinandega donde a diario ofrece los productos para dar lugar a obtener los ingresos para el bienestar de su hogar y su familia.
Ella ha acudido una vez más a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los productos tales como zanahorias, chayotes, papas, tomates y chiltomas. Ella espera que el crédito sea otorgado porque desea lograr la satisfacción de cada uno de sus clientes que a diario le visitan en el mercado.
texts.en:
Juana del Socorro stands out as a hard-worker selling vegetables in Chinandega's central market. She offers her products daily in order to earn income for her home and family's well-being. She has called upon Ceprodel once again to request funds to buy products like: carrots, prickly pears, potatoes, tomatoes and peppers. She hopes the loan will be approved because she wants to be able to meet all of her customers' needs when they come to visit her in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Luz Marleni

texts.es:
La sra H. D. G. D. 46 años D. edad vive con sus hijos quienes trabajan independientemente y aportan en la unidad familiar todos viven en Los Florales – Acomayo – Parcona – Ica en casa propia.
La sra se dedica a la venta D. verduras enteras y picadas listas para la preparacion D. comidas tambien venD. fruta en esta temporada ella se dedica a este negocio desD. hace 20 años y gracias a este trabajo a logrado obtener su casa darles educacion a su hijos ya que ella esta separada D. su esposo desD. hace mas D. 12 años y ella ha sido madre y padre para ellos.
En su trabajo es bien dedicada emprendedora y da muy buena atención a sus clientes por lo que son fieles a ella antes vendia en calle maurtua pero cuando fue la inundacion en 1997 ella se traslado a la Calle Huancavelica donD. actualmente ofrece sus productos.
Solicita un financiamiento para poder invertir más en su negocio ya que estamos en temporad D. uva y mango.
Ella trabaja desD. las 6.30 a.m. hasta las 2:00 p.m. y en la tarD. venD. chanfaina en su casa por eso tiene buena acumulacion D. bienes.
texts.en:
H. D. G., 46, lives with her children, who work independently and contribute to household expenses. They all live together in their own house, which is located in Los Florales-Acomayo-Parcona-Ica. She sells both whole vegetables and diced vegetables that are ready for food preparation; she also sells seasonal fruit. She has been in this line of work for 20 years and, thanks to it, she has managed to obtain her house and educate her children since she has been separated from her husband for over 12 years and has had to be both mother and father to them. She is a very dedicated entrepreneur in her work and she gives very good customer service so she has secured regular customers. She used to sell on Maurtua Street but, after the flood of 1997, she moved to Huancavelica Street, where she currently operates. She is requesting funds to invest in her business since grape and mango seasons are now. She works from 6:30am until 2:00pm. In the afternoons, she sells chanfaina (a type of stew) in her house; this is how she has managed to acquire some assets.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor M. is a married woman. She supports her family by selling vegetables and dried fish and operating an eatery business. She lives in Prk Everlasting, Escalante City Negros Occidental with her husband and their one child, who is 31 years old.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004. With the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts, she has improved her living conditions. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 10,000.

Flor is now borrowing Php 25,000 to use as additional capital for her business. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Flor aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Rosana

texts.es:
Rosana tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en su casa propia.
Ella tiene hectáreas de sembríos de arroz en otra ciudad, por lo que viaja muy frecuentemente con su esposo para traer sus productos y venderlos en Lima. Ellos logran buenas ventas porque le ponen mucho empeño a su negocio, tienen 9 años de experiencia en esta actividad y se sienten muy contentos porque les permite trabajar juntos por un bien en común, lograr el progreso de su familia. La parte más difícil radica en tener que viajar tanto para trasladar el arroz, dejando a sus hijos solos al cuidado de algunos familiares. Saben que todo trabajo requiere sacrificio y que todo es por brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos al lado de su grupo “Cristo Morado”, con el cual se siente muy contenta. Con dinero que solicita viajará hasta sus chacras para invertirlo en sus sembríos de arroz.
texts.en:
Rosana, 38, livs with her husband and their two children in a house they own. She has a small rice farm in another town and she and her husband travel a lot to carry their product to market in Lima. They manage to do well at market because they work hard at the business. They have 9 years of experience and they are very happy because they are working together toward a common goal: moving their family ahead. The hardest part of the business is leaving their children in the care of relatives when they travel. They know that work requires sacrifice and that everything they do will give their children a better quality of life. This is Rosana's fourth MFP loan and she has been very careful to pay past loans on time. She is very happy with her group, Cristo Morado. She will use the loan for the travel that she has to do for the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Travel for farming business.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Doña Maria de edad de 34 años, es una mujer muy esforzada por sus ideales, vive en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, con dos hermosos hijos y su esposo el cual trabaja en venta en la empresa Jummy. Hace varios años doña Maria tenia una pulpería en donde apoyaba  a su esposo con los gastos,  pero como  decide terminar su carrera el cual no termino ante por que se caso y por que estaban pequeños los niños. Le quitaba mucho tiempo ya que era medicina y era casi todo el día, estudiando y pensando en un futuro mejor para la familia es por eso cierra la venta. Por gracias a Dios, y a su esposo que la apoyo siempre,  ahora tiene dos años laborando en un Hospital de la capital de Managua que se llama Hospital Alemán, desempeñándose como enfermera y cirujana el cual esta contenta por alcanzar sus meta como profesional. Con este financiamiento desea terminar la construcción de un cuarto que le falta seguir levantando paredes, poner techo, y embaldosar  ya que es de mucha necesidad para la comodidad de sus hijos. Sus planes a futuro es seguir haciendo las mejoras ya que a un no tiene cocina aparte lo que comenzara hacer. Gracias a este préstamo lograra mejores condiciones para su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Maria is 34 years old and is a woman who gathers strength from her ideals. She lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood with two beautiful children and her husband who works in sales at Jummy. Years ago Doña Maria had a small general store in her home to help her husband with the bills, but she decided to finish her studies which she hadn't finished because she didn't have time because her kids were little. And it took a lot of time since she was studying, which took up most of the day, and thinking about a better life for her family. This is why she closed her business. Thanks to God, and to her husband, who has always supported her she now has worked for two years in a hospital in the capital, Managua, called Hospital Alemán. She works as a nurse and a surgeon and is happy to have achieved her goal to be a professional. With this loan she would like to finish building a room that still needs walls, a roof, and tiles. It's really a necessity for her kid's comfort. Her plans for the future are to keep making improvements until they have an indoor kitchen that they plan to start on. This loan will improve conditions for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials to finsih putting up walls and a roof.

loans.name: Leticia Jackeline

texts.es: La señora Leticia, es una mujer trabajadora, se dedica al trabajo de la costura, con 55 años de edad, su negocio lo inicio con fondos propios que dio su esposo producto de su trabajo el cual se desempeña en un taller de mecánica. Juntos apoyan a sus hijos para que logren una mejor educación. De los cinco hijos tres trabajan. La señora Leticia también vende pollo, huevo para obtener mejores ingresos ya que se vende mucho, es por eso la necesidad de comprar un freezer para aumentar las ventas ya que solo depende de una mantenedora, el cual no le alcanza la cantidad de pollo, ya que también tiene una variedad de productos, es por eso comprara el freezer para ser utilizado con la venta de pollo. Contenta con esta inversión ya que es de gran utilidad y beneficio de su negocio. Sus planes a futuro es poder hacer las mejoras a su casa, cambiar las tablas por pared de concreto el cual espera lograrlo a corto plazo.
texts.en:
Leticia is 55 years old. She is a hardworking woman who started her own sewing business with the funds provided by her husband from his work in an auto repair shop. Together, Leticia and her husband support their five children, providing them with a better education. Three of their children are working. To increase her income, Leticia also sells chicken and eggs. The sales are brisk; hence Leticia's need to purchase a freezer. Right now, she only has one refrigerator and doesn't have the space to stock enough chicken. She also has a variety of other products, and thus she plans to buy a freezer which will be used for the sale of chicken. She is happy about this investment since it will greatly improve her business. In the future, she plans to do renovations in her house; she would like to replace a wooden partition with a concrete wall. She hopes to be able to do these improvements soon.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a freezer to increase her chicken sales.

loans.name: Zainab Mai's Group

texts.en:
Zainab Mai is a 27-year-old woman. She operates a clothes-sewing business at her house. Her clientele base is made up of women. She receives orders from neighbors and relatives and charges them between 100 and 150 Pakistan rupees. Her customers are completely satisfied with her stitching. They trust her stitching and never argue about their deadlines.

She has given birth to four children: one son and three daughters. All of them are getting a good education from the local school. Her husband's name is A. K. and he has been a mason for over 20 years. Their earnings help them to improve the living standards of their family.
 
She has successfully repaid her three loans to Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan and a Kiva partner). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine to complete more orders and to earn good profit.

loans.use: Purchase an electric sewing machine for sewing clothes

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells drinks and pepper soup to earn her living and she has been in the business for the past 10 years. She is married with 6 children and she is 49 years of age. Her husband is a business man and they lives in Lagos. With the proceeds from the business she could assist her family financially. She wants to make more sales as this will boost her profit margin. She hopes for the loan of NGN50, 000 to purchase more drinks and pepper soup items to sell. She thanks all lenders for their huge support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and pepper soup items to sell.

loans.name: Topisia Ene

texts.en:
Topisia Ene K. is 32 years old. She is married to Parsakei K. and is the mother of four children.

Topisia is a farmer and has been farming on her own piece of land for the last three years.

She learned about KADET from other women who are already registered members. This will be her first loan.  She is planning to spend thirty thousand Kenyan shillings to buy chemicals and fertilizer for her five acre wheat farm. The other twenty thousand shillings will be used to prepare the remaining five acres to plant more wheat. Wheat has proven to do well in this area and the market is readily available as the local millers come to buy the wheat from the farm.

She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Topisia's dream is do large scale farming and attain financial independence. 

She is a hard working woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and fertilizer for her wheat farm

loans.name: Mirta

texts.es:
Doña Mirtha es una mujer muy trabajadora de 48 años de edad, casada y con un hijo que apoya aun con sus estudios. Se dedica a su negocio una pulpería que logro poner hace varios años, con ahorros de trabajo que trajo, ya que tuvo que irse a trabajar a Costa Rica, por que su situación económica estaba pésima.
Ahora se siente  estable por que tiene su propio negocio, que junto con su esposo trabajan en el despacho de la pulpería para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, y a la vez se hace el aseo y alimentos en su hogar.

Con este financiamiento comprara un exhibidor para lograr comprar mas productos de pollo, carne, embutido ya que los que tiene son de la coca cola, y no le permiten tener productos que no sean de los que ellos distribuyen. Por eso la importancia para lograr aumentar las ventas ya que son productos de consumo diario.
texts.en:
48-year old Sra. Mirtha is a hardworking woman. She is married and has a son whom she still supports as he is a student. Mirtha runs a small general store which she started several years ago with savings brought back from Costa Rico where she had had to go to find work as the economic situation at home was very bad. Now she feels more stable as she has her own business. She and her husband work in the office of the store to provide a better service to their customers. In addition Mirtha does the housework and cooking at home. With this loan she will buy a refrigerated display case so she can buy more chicken products, meat, and cold cuts. At the moment she only has Coca Cola fridges, and the company will only allow her to use them for their own products. Therefore it is important that she has a new refrigerated area so she can increase sales of these everyday products.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a refrigerated display case for meats etc.

loans.name: Hor

texts.en:
Mrs. Hor H. has spent her life cultivating rice crops. She has a lot of experience in this sector as she learned the skill from her grandparents wH. she was young. She is now married and has six children; three are married and three are single. All of her children are no longer in school and they currently work at different jobs. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her.

Growing rice crops is an annual process with which she has had great success. She is able to plant and harvest crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. She grows the rice for the purpose of eating and selling as well. The coming rainfall is good for growing; however, Hor H. doesn’t have capital yet to use on her farm. So, she is looking for a loan to hire a laborer to plow the farmland as well as to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Trương's Group

texts.en:
H. Trương Thị T. (20203040043) is a 37 and married with two school-aged children. She lives in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  H. is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Đồng Thôn 2 nhóm 06 (Nhóm 06).

H. owns a general store selling school supplies such pencils, pen and notebooks. She has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4.000.000 VND a month.


In 2009, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA which was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 7.840.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the second loan she has taken from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Đào Thị L. (0) is a 39, is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  Trương Thị H. (0) is a 33, is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her restaurant business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Trương Thị T. (20203040043) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đồng Thôn 2 nhóm 06 (Nhóm 06).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các pH. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các đồ dùng học tập như bút chì, bút viết & tập vở trong cộng đồng địa pH..  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Đào Thị L. (0) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Trương Thị H. (0) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh nhà hàng.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.en:
Maria Luisa S. is from the town of Baclayon. She is 35 years old. Maria Luisa is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Maria Luisa runs a general store, selling both food and daily use products in her local community. Maria Luisa has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1800 PHP a month for these activities.

Maria Luisa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Luisa is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Maria Luisa from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Essi Akpéné

texts.fr: A., est une femme célibataire de 31 ans, pour subvenir à ses propres besoins elle s'est lancée dans la restauration, son restaurant s'appelle " MAQUIS LA PROVIDENCE". elle s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. elle a ouvert son restaurant depuis 2006. les matières nécessaires à son activité de restauration sont épuisées, elle demande son premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter 5 sacs de maïs, 5 sacs de riz, 2 bidons d'huile, 15 casiers de boissons et divers autres produits nécessaires à son activité de restauration.
texts.en:
Essi Akpéné A. is a 31 year-old unmarried woman. She went into the restaurant business to support herself. Her restaurant is called “MAQUIS LA PROVIDENCE.” She gets her supplies at Lomé’s large market. She opened her restaurant in 2006. She has run out of the supplies that she needs for her restaurant business. She is asking for her first loan from WAGES to buy 5 bags of corn, 5 sacks of rice, 2 drums of oil, 15 cases of drinks and varous other products necessary for her restaurant business.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy drinks and products necessary for the restaurant business

loans.name: Artemia

texts.es: Artemia, D. 58 años, vive en su casa propia  a lado D. su esposo Lucio D. 62 años y sus 2 hijos que son jóvenes, juntos habitan un tranquilo paraje D. la sierra central peruana. Esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a las labores agrícolas desD. muy joven, y en la actualidad siembra papa, olluco y oca en sus chacras que son propias. Realiza su labor en compañía D. su familia, y dice que le gusta mucho cuidar los campos con esmero, porque luego D. un tiempo recoge su producción, y la comercializa a los mayoristas D. la ciudad que le ofrecen buenos precios y le compran todos sus productos porque son D. calidad. Considera que su actividad es muy rentable porque le permite vivir cómodamente, paralelamente a esta actividad, se dedica a la comercialización D. carne D. res y cordero, que compra al por mayor y venD. al por menor, D. esta manera se genera algunas ganancias extras. Como es una mujer que a pesar D. su avanzada edad, lucha cada día por salir adelante, en adelante tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, además D. comprar algunas cabezas D. reses, para criarlas y comercializarlas ante cualquier emergencia. Es el onceavo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, para continuar progresando, además esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar progresando. Tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra D. carne al por mayor para agilizar su negocio, pues tiene varios pedidos por cumplir, y espera obtener regulares ganancias con su inversión.
texts.en:
Artemia is 58 years old and lives in her own house with her husband Lucio, who is 62 years old, and their 2 young children. They live together in a quiet spot in the central mountains of Peru. This hard working woman has worked in agriculture since she was young, and currently grows potato, olluco and oca in her own fields. She works with her family and says that she very much likes taking care of the fields. She does so very thoroughly because after a time she collects the produce and sells it to wholesalers in the city. They offer her good prices and buy all her products because they are good quality. She considers her activity to be profitable because it allows her to live comfortably. AlongsiD. this work, she also sells beef and lamb, which she buys wholesale and retails in order to generate a little extra income. She is a woman who, despite her advanced years, struggles each day to move forward. In the future she plans to sow greater quantities and to buy some cattle to breed and sell in case of emergency. This is Artemia's eleventh loan with MFP, and she promises to make her repayments on time to continue progressing. She is also very grateful to all the people who provided the money that will allow her to continue making progress. She plans to invest the loan requested in the purchase of wholesale meat to improve her business, as she has several orders to meet and hopes to make a regular income from her investment.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beef to increase her income.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth M. is from Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. She is 41 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Ruth owns and operates a business providing motor transport services. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In 2005, Ruth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,800 PHP from GDMPC. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to repair her motorcycle in order to provide better service. This loan will be her 15th from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her motorcycle in order to provide better service

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Eng S., 41, has been selling food and coffee to people who live in her village. She owns a small restaurant where she operates her business. Eng S. is married and devoted to a young child who is going to the public school. She has another financial earner in her husband who is an internal staff member in the publishing industry. Eng S. is concerned that her restaurant is currently getting old and is not attractive to her customers. She wants to decorate/repair it. By doing this, she will get a comfortable place, which will encourage many customers come to her shop. Because she doesn’t have money to make that possible, Eng S. decided to seek a loan from Kiva’s project partner HKL.

loans.use: To decorate/repair her restaurant.

loans.name: Xinia

texts.en:
Xinia is a 46-year-old single mother and pepper producer who lives in the region of Upala in the Northern region of Costa Rica, minutes from the Nicaraguan border. Xinia is a dedicated producer and mother. She plans to focus her efforts on the planting and harvesting of Cayenne peppers. She works in cooperation with her family to strike a balance between accomplishing the daily tasks associated with agricultural production and the completion of domestic responsibilities. The land she works is her own. In addition to her agricultural activity, Xinia feels it is important to be an active member of her community. As a result, she dedicates a significant portion of her time to community meetings, groups and events. The rural zone where Xinia and her family live is sparsely populated with infrequent bus service and a general lack of infrastructure. Xinia is working hard towards the sustenance of her family, striving to reap the maximum benefits from her land as well as her labor. 

Although this is an individual loan, the community in which Xinia and her family live is very close-knit and interdependent. Neighbors help and support one another by sharing experiences and expertise acquired over the years. All individual members of the Upala community are dedicated to the improvement of living conditions for the region as a whole.

This loan will be used to finance the production of Cayenne peppers. Specifically, the loan will be used to finance the purchase of a variety of necessary agricultural nutrients, fertilizers and chemicals in order to ensure a healthy harvest. All laborial and logistical tasks associated with production will be carried out by Xinia, with the help of her family members in the region of Upala. The productive cycle (from planting to harvest) for these types of peppers is roughly one year. Xinia expects to harvest in the next eight months. Typically, she dedicates the hours from 7AM to 4PM everyday to her agricultural activities. 

Piper and Capiscum Processors Compañía Agrícola Industrial, or, PROPICA, is an international buyer and seller of chili pepper and ground pepper products. In cooperation with Fundación Mujer, PROPICA has guaranteed to purchase the agricultural products (the peppers) that are to be produced with the help of this loan. PROPICA acts as a guaranteed client for small agricultural producers in the area of Upala, thus ensuring that their products will reach market. 

The main obstacle Xinia and other producers in the Upala community face, is a lack of access to working capital funds. The collaboration of Fundación Mujer and PROPICA represents a unique opportunity to Xinia, her family and community. By offering a source of start-up capital and a guaranteed client to purchase what is produced, this is a chance to improve family and community standards of living. Above all, Xinia wants to take advantage of the current opportunity that has been presented. She wants to profit from this collaboration and see improvements in her home and neighborhood.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural chemicals and nutrients.

loans.name: Jessica Len's Group

texts.en:
Jessica Len J. is from the village of San Pablo, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 28 years old. Jessica Len is the group leader of a 8-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jessica Len is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Jessica Len owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector selling agricultural equipment. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling animal feed & mash to local farmers. Jessica Len has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jessica Len joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessica Len has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Jessica Len is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional agricultural equipment to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jessica Len from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional agricultural equipment to sell

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: Juana del Carmen D. L. C. D. F. D. 35 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. L. Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos menores D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Juana posee una venta D. cosméticos, cremas para el cabello y cuerpo, perfumes, lociones, shampoo, colas para el cabello y ganchos. Su negocio esta ubicado en su casa D. habitación, en donD. cuenta con muy buena ubicación debido a que muchas personas prefieren comprarle a elL. sus productos, esta es una zona muy transitada durante todo el día y sobretodo en los fines D. semana en donD. sus ventas se incrementan. ElL. solicita un préstamo con el deseo D. contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad D. mercadería, aumentando L. cantidad D. maquillajes y D. esta forma ofrecer diferentes precios, así mismo comprar cremas para el cuerpo, zapatos y ropa lo cual es lo que posee mayor cantidad D. demanda. Esto llena D. mucha ilusión ya que espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Juana del Carmen D. L. C. D. F. is 35 years old.  She lives in L. Libertad department together with her husband and their three children who are still in school.  Juana has a business selling cosmetics, hair and body cream, perfumes, lotions, shampoo, hair bands and hairpins.  Her business is in her own home.  She lives in a good location and many people prefer to buy their products from her.  It is an area which is very busy throughout the whole day and particularly on weekends when her sales increase.  She is requesting a loan as she needs money to buy more merchandise, increasing the amount of make-up she has which will enable her to offer different prices.  She would also like to buy body creams, shoes and clothes which are in high demand.  She is full of enthusiasm as she hopes to improve her profits.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Gulnigor

texts.ru: Рачабова Гулнигор проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 30 лет. Не замужем. Образование среднее. Более 7 лет занимается торговлей. Он в основном продает национальный хлеб, то есть лепешку. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Gulnigor R. lives in the city of Kulob.  She is 30 years old and single.  She has a high school education.   She has been working in sales for more than seven years.  She primarily sells a traditional flatbread.  She is taking out a loan to increase sales.

loans.use: Increasing sales

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is a 36-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda, staying in a semi permanent house with a dream of owning a permanent one in the future. For seven years now, he has been in tea farming, which has helped him buy land for plantation extension. His dream is to increase it by up to 10 acres of land. Lawrence intends to use the credit facility to plant more tea.

loans.use: Planting tea

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
Eusebia  solicito 1000 $us; se dedica a la  crianza de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la vende a Pil Andina, planta procesadora de leche.
Vive en la comunidad de Chojasivi, de la provincia Los Andes del Departamento de La Paz. Está casada y sus hijos ya son mayores de edad.
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca , así aumentar su producción de leche e incrementar sus ingresos. Es el primer  crédito en impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Eusebia requested a $1,000 USD loan, she has cows and sells the milk they produce to Pil Andina, a milk processing plant.

She lives in the community of Chojasivi, province of Los Andes department of La Paz.  She is married and her children are now adults.

The loan will be used to purchase a cow and this way increase milk production and this way increase income.  This is the first loan with impro and through  Kiva.

loans.use: Buy a good quality milking cow to increase milk production

loans.name: Jonafe

texts.en: Jonafe M. owns and operates a buy-and-sell banana business in her community. She is 34 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Bayabas, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Jonafe is just starting this business. In 2007, Jonafe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from GDMPC which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jonafe is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be invested in expanding the business. This will be her fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es:
El señor, Luis Miguel A. G. trabaja como Ayudante Fontanero en una empresa aguadora desde 2 años. Vive en la ciudad de León comunidad de Nagarote.

Es soltero de 21 años de edad, tiene 1 personas a su cargo menor de 15 años.

Este es su primer crédito en CEPRODEL, el cual piensa invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para la mejora de su casa. Agradece a CEPRODEL, ya que le permite con este préstamo comprar materiales de construcción que tanto lo necesita.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis Miguel A. G. has worked as a Plumbing Assistant at a water delivery company for two years. He lives in the community of Nagarote in the city of León.

He is single, 21 years old, and has one person under the age of 15 in his care.

This is his first loan through CEPRODEL and he plans to invest it in the purchase of construction materials for improving his house. He is grateful to CEPRODEL because, with this loan, he will be able to buy the construction materials he needs.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married and has four children.

Raed is a carpenter. He has worked in this field for a long time. In 2009, he decided to open his own carpentry shop and work on his own. He is well known in his local community and has a good reputation.

He is requesting an $1,800 loan to buy a big generator so his production will be continuous in case of electricity cuts. He is aiming to grow bigger in the future and develop his skills.

loans.use: To buy a big generator

loans.name: Marigold

texts.en:
Marigold is a married woman who lives in Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a sari-sari (general) store.  Her husband Edgardo, who is 33 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are 8 to 12 years old. Marigold joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marigold has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 21,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her ninth loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000 to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for their future, for their daily needs & for the education of their children.  Marigold is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Sheday

texts.en:
Sheday G., from the city of Labuyo Tangub City, is 31 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Sheday owns and operates a business venture providing motor transport services. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Sheday joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC, she is now requesting her third loan for 15000 PHP to repair an existing vehicle for better service. Sheday plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is 26 years old. He is married and has two children – a five-year-old son and a 4-year-old daughter. Zaza lives in the village of Mukhrani, Kartli Region, with his family and his parents. 

Zaza has a shop selling household goods. He buys the goods in Tbilisi (capital city) and sells them in his shop in the village. 

The received loan will be used to purchase inventory for the shop – goods which are demanded by his customers. According to Zaza’s estimation, this will positively influence Zaza’s income. The main part of the increased income will be reinvested in the business and a small part of it will be expended on the family for various purposes.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies for the shop.

loans.name: Lilia Lorena

texts.es:
Lilia tiene 34 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su familia en el Centro Poblado llamado La Matanza, en el distrito D. Olmos, ubicado a 2 horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital del Departamento D. Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta D. alimentos en una picantería desD. hace 4 años, ella prepara sus alimentos en su domicilio para luego ofrecerlos en venta al público en general. El negocio goza D. muy buena acogida por parte D. sus clientes debido a la buena sazón con la que prepara sus comidas. Lilia se vale D. los ingresos que recibe D. esta actividad para ayudar a su esposo a solventar la economía D. su familia.

Lilia desea equipar su local con la compra D. sillas y mesas, D. esta manera ampliar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Lilia is 34 years old, married, and lives with her family in La Matanza, in Olmos district, two hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque department.

Lilia's business is making and selling meals in a small restaurant.  She has been in this business for four years.  She prepares her meals in her home and then sells them to the general public.  Her business is very popular with her customers because of the great flavor of her meals.  Lilia uses the income she makes in this business to help her husband cover their family's expenses.

Lilia would like to equip her premises by purchasing tables and chairs so that she can expand her business and increase her sales.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her premises

loans.name: Claudia Carolina

texts.es:
Claudia, reside en  El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive con su hija de 3 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de comida, este negocio surgió hace 10 años, lo atiende todos los días de la semana preparando diferentes platillos para los clientes.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para la compra de verduras, carnes y condimentos, estos ingredientes le ayudaran a mantener una buena disponibilidad para preparar los menús diarios.
Su aspiración es trabajar por su hija, darle lo necesario e ir mejorando las instalaciones de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Claudia lives in the El Transito section of San Miguel.  She lives with her 3-year old daughter and dedicates herself to selling food.  She started her business 10 years ago, and tends to it every day of the week making different dishes for her customers.

Currently, she needs a loan to buy vegetables, meats and condiments.  These ingredients will help her maintain her ability to prepare her daily menus.  Her desire is to work for her daughter, providing what she needs and making improvements to their home.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats and condiments.

loans.name: Segundo Benitos

texts.es:
Segundo es un hombre soltero de 56 años, posee una casa propia con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en el anexo  Santa Rosa (lugar donde existen muy pocas viviendas y pobladores ),el cual se encuentra a unos 15 minutos del distrito de Mórrope y a unos 30 minutos del departamento de Lambayeque.  Lugar donde se desarrolla  la actividad agricola,  ganadera y  por sus festividades religiosas.

Segundo se dedica a lacompra y venta de animales de todas las especies (aves de corral, vacas chanchos,etc.) desde hace unos años, su negocio lo realiza en el mercado Moshoqueque de la ciudad de Chiclayo los días martes donde hay mayor cantidad de clientela y así puede vender más rápido sus animales.  Con esos ingresos pude ayudarse  a cubrir sus necesidades. Otra forma de tener un poco más de ingresos económicos es alquilando su mototaxi (medio de transporte público pequeño).

El crédito solicitado por Segundoa Edpyme Alternativa es de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales  y seguir negociandolo como siempre lo hace en el mercado Moshoqueque al por mayor y menor. Una vez que haya realizado las ventas de sus animales podrá pagar su préstamo como tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Segundoes un hombre muy conocido por ser trabajador, responsable y dedicado ha su negocio.
texts.en:
Segundo is a 56 year-old single man.  He owns his own home which has access to water and electricity.  His home is located in the small village of Santa Rosa (a place where there are very few houses and inhabitants), 15 minutes from Mórrope district, 30 minutes from Lambayeque department.  This is a place where people work in farming and livestock raising and it is known for its religious festivals.

Segundo has been buying and selling all kinds of animals (poultry, cows, pigs, etc.) for some years now.  He carries out his business in Moshoqueque market, in the city of Chiclayo, on Tuesdays.  This is when there are most customers and he can sell his animals most quickly.  With this income, he is able to cover his needs.  Another way in which he makes a little extra income is by hiring out his motorcycle taxi (a small mode of public transport).

Segundo is requesting a loan for 3,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more animals and continue trading wholesale and retail, as he always does, in Moshoqueque market.  Once he has sold his animals, he will be able to repay his loan and also enjoy a better quality of life.

Segundo is a man who is very well known for being hard-working, responsible and devoted to his business.

loans.use: to buy more animals of different kinds and to have maintenance work done on his motorcycle taxi

location.town: Anexo Santa Rosa - Lagunas - Mórrope - Lambayeque

loans.name: Anatori

texts.en: Anatori is a forty-three year-old married man with six children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in carpentry for eighteen years.  He started with 100,000 shillings and now has 2,000,000 shillings. His challenges are an increase in timber prices and debtors.  His vision is to have an electrical machine and to educate his children.  Anotori needs the loan to buy mahogany timber.

loans.use: to buy mahogany timber .

loans.name: Doris Sabina

texts.es:
Doris, vive con su esposo y un hijo, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, aprendió de su madre a prepararlas, trabajan juntas y su horario es de 9:00am a 2:00pm.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña, gas, bolsas plásticas y cal, todos estos materiales son muy necesarios para realizar las ventas diariamente.
Su aspiración es aumentar la clientela, que pueda crecer en las ventas, para generar los ingresos que cubran los gastos del hogar y le permitan ahorrar para comprarse su propia casa, donde puedan vivir con su familia.
texts.en:
Doris lives with her husband and son.  Her business is selling tortillas.  She learned how to prepare tortillas from her mother and the two of them work together.  Their work hours are 9.00am to 2.00pm.

Doris is requesting a loan to buy corn, firewood, gas, plastic bags and lime.  All these materials are essential to her in making her daily sales.

Doris' aspiration is to increase her number of customers so that she can increase her sales.  This will enable her to make the income she needs to cover her household expenses and also allow her to save up to buy her own home where she can live with her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, gas, plastic bags and lime

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luis  es un padre de familia, vive en una  comunidad urbana con sus esposa y sus dos menores hijas, los cuales residen en la comunidad de  José Leonardo Ortiz, jose luis cuenta con todo los servicios básicos.

 José Luis se dedica aprestar servicios de transporte público en mototaxi (moto con cabina para transportar persona) en una unidad móvil de sus propiedad, está actividad la realiza desde hace 4 años en los que adquirido experiencia en el rubroy clientela fija para el servicio que ofrece.

José Luis está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para que le pueda dar un mantenimiento a  su unidad móvil para que de esta manera pueda ofrecer un mejor servicio.

  José Luis es una persona honesta muy trabajadora, que desea sacar adelante asu familia y poder brindarles un mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José Luis  es un padre de familia, vive en una  comunidad urbana con sus esposa y sus dos menores hijas, los cuales residen en la comunidad de  José Leonardo Ortiz, jose luis cuenta con todo los servicios básicos.

 José Luis se dedica aprestar servicios de transporte público en mototaxi (moto con cabina para transportar persona) en una unidad móvil de sus propiedad, está actividad la realiza desde hace 4 años en los que adquirido experiencia en el rubroy clientela fija para el servicio que ofrece.

José Luis está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para que le pueda dar un mantenimiento a  su unidad móvil para que de esta manera pueda ofrecer un mejor servicio.

  José Luis es una persona honesta muy trabajadora, que desea sacar adelante asu familia y poder brindarles un mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Realizar  mantenimiento a su unidad móvil.

loans.name: Lach

texts.en: Mrs. Lach is a 63-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Cham Province. Mrs. Lach is married to Sin, age 68. The couple works together in the farming business, and they have three children. Two of the children are married and one is single. Two of Mrs. Lach's children are food sellers in  Kompong Som Province. Presently, they intend to decorate their store but they lack some funds to do that. To help support her kids’ business, Mrs. Lach would like to ask for a Kiva loan for her kids to rent a new store and also to use to decorate their store.

loans.use: to assist her kids to rent a new store and decorate their store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking 31-year-old businesswoman. She is single and blessed with one child. For the last two years, Elizabeth has been providing for her child by engaging in dairy farming. She supplements her income by selling clothes. 

Elizabeth is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy animal feed. Within the next five years, she hopes to have expanded her business and become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is 33 years old, married and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has four school-aged children. She sells good food at home to earn a living. She has been working on this for three years and luckily earns a monthly sum of PHP 6,000. Charity has applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to purchase adequate supplies needed in her food production business undertakings. She has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. She hopes to have a small food vending area in the marketplace to earn more income and meet her daily needs.

loans.use: To purchase adequate supplies to prepare food.

loans.name: Florinda Antonieta

texts.es:
La señora Florinda Antonieta, es soltera, tiene 20 años D. edad, estudió 3 años D. primaria, se dedica a la confección D. tejidos, la elaboración D. faldas, inicio este trabajo siendo operaria para otro negocio, y lleva ya 5 años D. experiencia.

Solicita un crédito para aumentar su capital D. trabajo ya que va a comprar más materiales para la elaboración D. faldas que realiza, va a compra telas D. diferentes diseños y colores para tener más producción, ya que espera en el futuro espera tener su negocio propio y granD..
texts.en:
Señora Forinda Antonieta is unmarried and is 20 years old.  She has had three years of primary school education.  She works making skirts.  She began this work as an employee of another business and has already had 5 years of experience.

She request a loan in order to increase her working capital so that she can buy more materials to make skirts. She will buy fabrics of different designs and colors in order to increase her production since she hopes to have her own large business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials to make skirts

loans.name: Rita

texts.pt:
Nasceu  em Vilanculos,  provincia  de Gaza, sul  de Moçambique, viuva  e  mãe  de 2 filhos  dos  quais  todos  frequentam  a  escola. Fez a 6ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta sua cunhada que vive com ela. 

saiu da sua terra natal a procura de melhores condições de vida, é negociante ha mais de 2 anos e dedica-se a venda de produtos diversos, e tem um rendimento de cerca de 4.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos ( amendoim, arroz, sumos,oleo, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
Pretende construir uma mercearia para ampliar a sua actividade comercial,e apostar na educação dos filhos, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Rita was born in Vilanculos, which is in Gaza Province in southern Mozambique. She is widowed and has two children who both go to school. Rita finished sixth grade and quit school because she didn't have the money for it. She lives in her own house with her family and supports her sister-in-law who lives with her.

She left her hometown looking for better living conditions. For more than two years Rita has been a businesswoman selling a variety of products, and she earns about 4,500 meticais per month. She uses the money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account (at BIM).

She has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is Rita's first Hluvuku loan, and she is asking for 10,000 meticais to buy products (peanuts, rice, juice, oil and other items) to increase her inventory.

She intends to build a mini-market in order to expand her business, and she plans to invest in her children's education, so she will ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (peanuts, rice, juice, oil, etc.).

loans.name: Amarmurun

texts.en: Amarmurun is 43 years old and lives with her two children and husband in a Mongolian yurt in Huvsgul, a province of Mongolia. Her daughter is a high school student. Amarmurun operates a business selling dairy products. She started her business in 2000. Now she is cooperating with another person to manage the business. Her husband also sells nuts and fruits at the same local market. She is an open-minded and diligent woman who says "Next year, my daughter will be a college student. Thus, I need to pay her college tuition fee and other expenses by increasing my sales. I think that I will have no time to relax." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase dairy products, fruits and nuts at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To purchase dairy products, fruits and nuts at wholesale prices

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira is the leader of this group. She is 23 and married to a security guard. 

At the moment, the family breeds livestock and prepares hay to feed livestock during the winter season. Gulmira keeps eight cows, 30 sheep and three goats. Reselling some farm animals after fattening, she earns about 2,500 KGS per month. 

With money received from the loan, she wants to increase the number of livestock. The loan's purpose is to purchase two sheep. In the future Gulmira wants to expand the business and improve her living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase two sheep.

loans.name: Sop Khelcom Group

texts.fr:
Groupe de solidarité reconstitué il y a environ 6 mois.Il est composé de 14 femmes.Elles font du petit commerce, vente de divers produits.

Maguette, (sur la photo de groupe elle est placée à gauche en médaillon) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 49 ans.Elle est mariée; mère de 4 enfants. Elle fait du commerce de détail dans les marchés hebdomadaires"loumas".

Ce nouveau crédit lui permettra, en sus des céréales (mil arachides et haricots "niébé") qu'elle va acheter, de diversifier et augmenter les produits à vendre. 

Elle voudrait avec les profits générés par son activité assurer à sa famille un meilleur cadre de vie. Exemple par l'amélioration de la nourriture et la prise en charge de la santé de la famille.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was reconstituted around six months ago and is made up of 14 women. They are all small-scale traders selling a variety of products.

Maguette (shown in the inset on the left of the photo) is in charge of the group. She is 49 years old, married and mother to four children. She trades on a retail basis in the weekly "loumas" markets.

This new loan will allow her not only to buy cereals (millet, groundnut and "niébé" beans) but to diversify and expand the products she sells.

With the profits she generates from her business she would like to ensure a better quality of life for her family, by improving their food and looking after their health, for  example.

loans.use: to buy various cereals ("niébé" beans, millet, groundnut)

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 61 years old and married with six children. Conchita works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in the store.

Conchita has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as rice, feed, soft drinks, beverages and various groceries. 

Conchita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in the store

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is single. She is 45 years old. She lives in Pangabuan, Tangub City. Alice is selling herbal coffee to earn a living, and she has been in this business for more than five years. Each month, Alice earns 2,000 Philippines pesos (Php) from her herbal coffee selling. She is engaged in this business because it's very salable in her community. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of Php 10,000. She will use the loan for the additional capital for her herbal coffee business to sustain her daily needs. She is in her second loan cycle. Alice has been a member of GDMPC this year. In the future, she will use the profits she will earn to sustain herself. Alice wishes that her business will progress.

loans.use: to purchase additional herbal coffee.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
La señora Alejandra ya ha tenido dos créditos con KIVA las cuales sus pagos han sido puntuales. 
Esta solicitando su cooperación para este préstamo ya que desea invertir en comprar más mercancía que es (perfumes para hombres y mujeres y productos de belleza), para su negocio, porque sus clientes le están solicitando varios productos para regalar en la navidad. 
Con una parte de las ganancias planea pagar el crédito ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para ella y su hija que está estudiando. 
Desea mejorar los ingresos y tener más variedad de mercancía en su negocio.
texts.en:
Alejandra has had two loans with Kiva and her payments have been made on time. 

She is asking for your cooperation for this loan which she wants to invest by buying more merchandise for her business such as scents for men and women and beauty products, because her clients are asking for several items for the Christmas season. 

With her profits she will pay for the loan and also this is the source of income she has for herself and for her daughter who is studying. She wants to increase her income to have more of a variety of merchandise in her business.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for her business

loans.name: Houlezondi

texts.fr:
Houlezondi est une femme âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a 4 enfants, dont 3 à l’école. Le premier a 16 ans et le dernier a 9 ans.  
Houlezondji travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2006. Elle vent des céréales pour tous clients au marché. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, elle n’a pas de difficulté principale. 
Houlezondji a requis son 3ème  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales et de l’huile. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Houlezondi voudrait élargir l’activité et ouvrir une boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Houlezondi, age 40, is married to a driver. She has four children, out of which three attend school. The oldest is 16, the youngest is 9 years old.

Houlezondji has been working as reseller since 2006. She sells cereals to any customers at the market. She gets her supplies in Lomé and works alone. At this time, she doesn't have any specific problems.

She's seeking her third loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy cereals and oil. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the forthcoming years, she would like to expand it and open a shop.

She says that with her profits, she intends to ensure a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy cereals and vegetable oil

loans.name: Cleotilde Dilena

texts.es: Cleotilde Dilena tiene que buscar la manera de proporcionarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios. Su negocio es una joyería, la cual tiene de poseerla 28 años, la dedicación y el esfuerzo constante han hecho que ella continúe trabajando. El objetivo de su préstamo es para la compra de plata, oro, pesa digital entre otras cosas necesaria. Debido a esta época que se acerca la mayoría de sus  clientes  ya le han solicitado varios encargo y con este crédito pretende realizarlo.
texts.en: Cleotilde Dilena needs to look for a way to provide the income that her family needs.  She’s had a jewelry store for 28 years and her perseverance and constant effort have made her continue working.  She will use the money from this loan to buy more silver, gold, and a digital scale, among other things that she needs.  Given the season, she has already gotten requests from most of her customers.  She will use this loan to make it so.

loans.use: to buy silver, gold, a digital scale and other things.

loans.name: Saidbako

texts.ru: Саидбако женат и имеет четверых детей. Он целеустремленный и ответственный человек. Саидбако занимается купле- продажей скота, и содержит их дома. Он имеет землю, на  которой трудится допоздна. На земле он выращивает картофель и зерно. Отходы от урожая идут на корм скота и содержит их за счет этого. Саидбако хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль. От полученной прибыли он хочет благоустроить свой дом. Саидбако хотел бы получить займ для покупки 3 голов крупного рогатого скота, а на остальную сумму хочет посеять пшеницу, ячмень и картофель.
texts.en:
Saidbako is married and has four children. He is a purposeful and responsible person. Saidbako is engaged in the buying and selling of livestock and takes care of them at his home. He has land on which he works late into the night. On his land he grows potatoes and corn. Excess from the harvest goes to feed livestock and he supports them in this manner. Saidbako wants to grow his business and make a good profit. With the profits, he wants to do landscaping at his home. 

Saidbako would like to receive a loan in order to buy three heads of cattle and to use the remaining money to sow wheat, barley, and potatoes.

loans.use: To buy cattle and seeds

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea, de 37 años, es una mujer amable, buena y muy trabajadora. Convive con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos, y juntos habitan en su casa propia. Ella trabaja mucho al igual que su conviviente para así poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de comida, todos los días desde muy temprano sale a hacer sus compras, de ahí prepara sus deliciosos platos que tiene acostumbrado a sus fieles clientes que van por las noches en busca de ellos. Le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que le permite generar ingresos para su familia, además de no necesitar la ayuda de ninguna otra persona ya que ella se abastece sola. Al principio cuando empezó a vender no se sentía cómoda ya que nunca había hecho este tipo de trabajo, pero con el tiempo se fue acostumbrando y más aún cuando empezó a generar buenos ingresos en los días buenos. Tiene muchos planes a futuro ya que desea crecer y progresar, pero por el momento solo se esta concentrando en ampliar su actividad con algunas cosas que necesita. Este será el crédito número 2 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos, por su parte se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas y así no quedar mal con el grupo al que pertenece ya que todos son muy responsables y muy buenos. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará algunas sillas y mesas que necesita para ampliar su negocio, además de ingredientes e insumos para seguir preparando sus deliciosos platos de comida.
texts.en:
