Andrea, age 37, is a kind, good, and very hard-working woman.  She lives with her life partner and their two children in their own house.  She works a lot, the same as her life partner, in order to give her family a better quality of life.

She sells food every day.  She leaves very early to make her purchases.  Then she prepares her delicious dishes that her loyal customers are accustomed to having.  They look for her food in the evenings.  She likes her work a lot because it allows her to generate income for her family.  Also, she does not need help from another person as she meets the demand by herself.

At first when she started to sell she did not feel comfortable because she had never done this type of work.  However, in time she was getting used to it, especially when she started to generate good income on good days.  

She has a lot of plans for the future because she wishes to grow and make progress.  However, for the moment she is only concentrating on expanding her business activity with some things that she needs.  This will be her second loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she will have a loan in order to be able to fulfill her objectives.  She pledges to be punctual with her payments.  She does not want to disappoint the group that she belongs to because all of them are very responsible and very good.

She will use the requested 1,000 soles to buy some chairs and tables that she needs to expand her business.  She will also buy ingredients and supplies to continue making her delicious dishes.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make food and to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Yusifu S

texts.en: This is 42 year-old Yusifu S.  He is married to a businesswoman and has 4 children aged 18, 13, 11 and 3 years respectively. In 1996, Yusifu S established his jeans, polo shirts, Lacoste clothes, and bags business. He started business at the time his father died when he was in form two (education level) and there was no other financial support. He decided to leave school and went to a mining area. He engaged in mining and acquired some funds which he used to start his business.   Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,510,800 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Yusifu S has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase jeans 70 pieces @ Le35,000, shirts 36 pieces @ Le25,000, lacoste - 24 pieces @ Le22,000. The balance of the loan will be used for transport. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,160. In the future, Yusifu S plans to complete his construction building, educate his children, and he also wants to open another shop. His major challenge is the fluctuation in foreign currency.  Competition is high but he is different from his competitors because he always has what the customers want.  He serves 10 customers each day.  His business is popular because he provides good customer care and he has quality items. Yusifu does not have any employees. His suppliers are located in Conakry, Guinea and he transports his goods by public transport. He buys three times in a month.  He ploughs the profit back into the business.  He plans to expand and this will be accomplished by acquiring more loans. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase jeans, shirts, and Lacoste clothes

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is 60 years old and married with 3 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Bernardita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Bernardita has been raising pigs for 7 years and also earns additional income from feeds retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ropolon Group

texts.en:
Veronica is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Veronica was born in Tonkolili district in northern Sierra Leone 42 years ago. She is married to a trader. The couple has six children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Veronica sells cosmetics and has been doing business for many years now. 

With the help of this loan, Veronica and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Veronica will use her share of the loan (500,000 SLL) to buy a wide variety of cosmetics to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cosmetics to add to her current inventory

loans.name: Lem

texts.en:
Lem, 58, lives with her husband and two children in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has struggled to feed and care her children by farming rice which she has been in the business for 11 years. She can earn about 10,000KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 
Lem has been with VisionFund for four cycles and now she is applying for a loan to pay for fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice healthily and earn more healthy crops to make a living better.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Mediatrix

texts.en:
Mediatrix is a married woman, 65 years old with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Mediatrix has a fishing business in the Philippines. Mediatrix requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy new fish net, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Mediatrix has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new fish net, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Tirso Meza

texts.en:
Like two of my brothers, I have been owner of a bakery, it is a familiar tradition for more than 40 years and we have all fought very hard to maintain our businesses, in my case, with the new motor I will be able to increase my production and will fulfill the orders of my clients and I will not have problems to repay the loan because my incomes will increase.

Because all the materials that I use have increased their price, I will use part of the money to buy a great amount of products to obtain discounts and to reduce my costs.

loans.use: I will invest the money in the purchase of a new motor for the machine of my factory since the motor is too old and it is already giving problems.  I Also will invest part of the money to buy materials to make my bread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lucy Would like to buy shares

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Mrs. Dorcas O. is married and has four children. She was trained as a tailor in a notable fashion home in Nigeria. According to Dorcas herself, LAPO was a big help to her in the year 2002, when she was in need of money to upgrade her business. She is now asking for a loan of US$400 to further improve the business.

loans.use: To buy an additional sewing machine and sewing materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes to resell to women and children

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Description of Business

Maria has 5 years experience selling electrical goods. Her husband helped her raise a loan to start the business. She used to work everyday from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. covering not only her own neighborhood but others too. She was welcomed everywhere she went for the quality of her products.

Purpose of the Loan

The loan will be used to buy merchandise. She hopes to enter the market for clothing sales. She also wants to stock her business with electrical products such as irons, toasters, microwaves, etc.

Personal Information

Maria is married. She is 36 years old and has 3 children who study in nearby schools. Her husband fishes [which helps?] with the household expenses. Her small house is made of cana (a reed-like wood). With both incomes, they hope to improve their house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Maria tiene una experiencia de 5 años con su actividad de venta de articulos electricos. Su esposo fue la persona que le ayudo en conseguir el capital. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m. Recorriendo las calles de su sector y además visitando referidos de otro sector. Tiene buena acogida por la calidad de sus productos.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de mercadería. Espera poder incursionar con la venta de prendas de vestir. Y además surtir su negocio con artículos eléctricos como lo son: planchas, tostadoras, microondas.

Información Personal

Maria es casada. Tiene 36 años y 3 hijos. Los cuales estudian en una escuela cerca del sector donde viven. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca. Ayudándole con los gastos del hogar. Su casita es de caña. Con el ingreso de ambos esperan adecuar su domicilio.

loans.use: Buy more electrical goods and other items for sale.

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.es:
Mr. Timoteo A. lives in his own house in the Rio Seco neighborhood of the city El Alto with his wife and three daughters. Mr. Timoteo works as a chauffer for a private home and his wife does embroidery in a clothing shop at the city La Paz. With their savings they have built the structure and some dividing walls in their two-story home, which is partially finished and they currently live in the first floor. They will use the loan to finish the construction of the second floor. This is the first time Mr. Timoteo asks for a loan and in the socio-economical analysis done to him he qualifies favorably and is a candidate for credit.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

El señor Timoteo A. vive en casa propia en la zona de Río Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto con su esposa y sus tres hijas; el señor Timoteo trabaja como chofer en un domicilio particular y su esposa realiza tejidos para una tienda de ropa en la ciudad de La Paz. Con sus ahorros construyeron la estructura y los muros divisorios en su vivienda que consta de dos plantas, de las cuales esta terminada parcialmente la planta baja en la que actualmente viven El crédito solicitado será utilizado para la construcción en obra fina de la planta alta. Esta es la primera vez que el señor Timoteo solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Terminado de habitaciones en casa

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hard-working mother of three. She sells some cloth, but mostly pots and other light-weight metal containers. The most amazing part is that she walks around the city in search of customers while balancing all of her stock on a piece of cloth placed on top of her head. This type of selling strategy is called “hawking.” It is common in Ghana, but normally for lighter-weight items. A lot of hawkers complain of neck and head pains from hawking, but Elizabeth, at the age of 55, says the only challenge that she has encountered is not having enough profit to expand her business.

Much of Elizabeth’s profits went to her children’s education fees, but now 2 have completed school, so she is able to focus more on her business. Her goal is to eventually sell from an indoor store so she is able to carry more stock. With the profits that she will be making, she plans to pay for the education of her youngest child and to finish building a house for her family.

Elizabeth is a member of the Bisa Ewurade group. The group lending system allows several people to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount.

(*Photo Note: in the photo a friend helps Elizabeth lift the heavy load onto her head to start her day hawking).

loans.use: To expand her inventory by purchasing metal pots and containers.

loans.name: Marciano

texts.es:
Marciano Z. is 47 years old and has been married for 23 years to Ermelinda who is 45 years old. They have two daughters, one of which is in school and the other is an adult and thanks to her parents has already finished her university education.

15 years ago he started with a small grocery store in his home where he sells all types of basic products such as milk, sugar, flour, rice, fruits, vegetables, etc. Before, his wife worked selling crafts, but now she helps him run his business, because it is the most important and most frequented store in the city.

Now he hopes to buy more merchandise such as various drinks and basic products such as flour, herbs, noodles and rice in large quantities because at this time of year his sales increase considerably.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Marciano Z. es un señor de 47 años de edad casado hace más de 23 años con Sra. Ermelinda de 45 años de edad. Tienen 2 hijas una en edad escolar y la otra ya es mayor de edad y gracias a sus padres ya ha culminado sus estudios universitarios.

Hace 15 años empezó con una pequeña despensa en su domicilio en donde vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad como leche, azúcar, harina, arroz, frutas, vegetales, etc. Anteriormente su esposa trabaja en las ventas de artesanías, pero actualmente lo ayuda con la atención del negocio, ya que es el centro de compra más importante y concurrida de la ciudad.

Ahora desea comprar más mercaderías como ser: bebidas en general y artículos de primera necesidad como: harina, yerba, fideos y arroz en grandes cantidades ya que en esta época del año aumentan considerablemente las ventas.

loans.use: purchase of sodas, juices, mineral water, flour, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Maria's Group

texts.en:
Hilda, Agustina, and Maria are members of the community bank “Señor de Huanca”. Hilda has been a member for five years and Agustina and Maria for about one year. In that year they have learned how to be responsible, punctual, and hard working. They have also learned about friendship and how to work together like sisters.

Hilda is 37 years old and has two children, ages 14 and 11. For the past 10 years she has run a grocery store. Before that she sold propane. However, she did not enjoy it and was able to save enough to start her new business.

Agustina is 32 and has three children. Every Saturday and Sunday she travels to different markets in the region and buys grains which she sells in Ayacucho. She started this business six months ago with a loan from her community bank.

Maria is 39 years old and has 6 children ranging from 4 years old to 20. She also owns a grocery store. Before that she sold shish kabobs from a cart, but is able to make more money now.

They need loans of 1400, 1000, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1) respectively to buy things such as rice, sugar, milk, potatoes, and a small piece of land to grow vegetables. The community bank emphasizes saving and each associate has an interest earning account. Hilda, Agustina, and Maria are saving to pay for their children’s education, to improve their homes, and to buy a motorcycle. Their dreams are to own their homes, have land, and that their children can be professionals.

loans.use: to buy items such as rice, sugar, milk, potatoes, and a small piece of land to grow vegetables

loans.name: Muzafara

texts.en:
M. Muzafara is 45 years old. She is married with four children. 

Muzafara has been baking the national bread “lepeshka” for about 10 years. Her two sons help her in the business. Working hard and being a loving mother, Muzafara plans to use the generated income for higher education for her children. Muzafara would like to repair her bakery shop. She requests a $600.00 US dollar loan for the term of 12 months. Let us help this hard-working woman develop her business.  Borrowing for the first time, Muzafara thanks all for their support and trust and promises to manage the loan with accuracy.

loans.use: Repair of the bakery shop.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
It's been eight years since Socorro began selling food, however she doesn't have a steady place to run her business so she's constantly changing her location. She's a hard-working woman who gets up every morning and tries to find ways to bring in more income to manage her household expenses. Unfortunately, three years ago she separated from her husband and now has to work twice as hard to support her small children.

Apart from working in the market in the mornings, each afternoon she works at home by cooking and doing laundry for others and cleaning houses. That is how her business began because she said that she was inexperienced and had no other choice, however this work isn't stable or profitable. Her goal in the future is to rent a room that can serve as a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Hace ocho años que Socorro atiende en su pequeño puesto ambulante de comida. Constantemente ella cambia su lugar de venta. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que se levanta todas las mañanas viendo siempre la manera de poder conseguir ingresos suficientes para el mantenimiento de su hogar. Lamentablemente hace tres años que se separó de su esposo, es por esto que ella debe trabajar el doble; ya que aun tiene hijos menores. Aparte de trabajar en el mercado durante las mañanas, por las tardes, ella ofrece sus servicios a domicilio tanto en la cocina, en lavandería y también en la limpieza del hogar. Es así como comenzó ella, pues en su poca experiencia ella dice que no tenía otra opción; sin embargo, afirma que no le gustaría trabajar estable como empleada del hogar porque no le es rentable. En un tiempo, más adelante, ella quisiera alquilar un local para tener un restaurante.

loans.use: To find a set place/ post in the market, where she can sell food. (Conseguir un puesto estable en el mercado)

loans.name: Lourdes Eliane

texts.es:
Lourdes dedicates herself to the sale of cosmetics and perfumes by catalog, and her husband works at an entity as a store assistant. Lourdes is 23 years old and, with her husband, has two children ages 4 and 2 respectively.

The cosmetics brands she sells are Yanbal and Avon. In her house she also has a place for making calls, and she has been doing both activities for about four years. There is substantial competition with regard to cosmetics sales, but demand for these products is also high. Her sales allow her to meet her obligations. She seeks the current loan to purchase cosmetics, whose prices vary depending on make and type of product.

This is Lourdes’ third time with the foundation, and she has shown herself to be responsible with her payments. She currently has loans with other financial entities where she has also met her installments on a timely basis.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Lourdes se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y perfumes por catalogo y su esposo trabaja en una entidad como auxiliar de almacenes. Lourdes de 23 años de edad y su esposo tienen dos hijos de 4 y 2 años respectivamente. Los cosméticos que ella vende son los de Yanbal y Avon, en su casa también tiene un punto de llamadas lleva con ambas actividades una antiguedad de aprosimadamente 4 años. Existe bastante competencia en cuanto a la venta de cosméticos pero así también la demanda es elevada, la comercialización de los mismos permiten cumplir con las obligaciones que tiene Lourdes. La solicitud del presente préstamo es para la compra de cosméticos y el precio de los mismos varian dependiendo de la marca y del tipo de producto. Esta es la tercera secuencia de Lourdes con la institución y durante este tiempo demostró ser una persona responsable con sus pagos, actualmente también tiene créditos en otras entidades financieras donde también cumple con sus pagos.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Llerme

texts.es:
Llerma belongs to the Ladies of the Orient Community Bank, located in Jr. Libertad No 820 in the Calleria District in the Ucayali Department. She is the 40 year-old mother of 3 children. Her husband is a farmer, but the income is not enough to cover the costs of the family, so with the first loan that Llerme received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to start a small salon.

She wakes up at 7 am to cook breakfast for her children and husband, and to go open her beauty shop and attends to clients until 5 pm.

With this loan of $375, she will buy hair dye, nails, hair cutting supplies, hair settings (perms), hairdryers, etc.

Llerme is very pleased that she is achieving her dream and now can support her children and costs of her home. She is thankful for the support provided by Manuela Ramos for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Llerme pertenece al Banco Comunal Damas del Oriente, ubicado en el Jr Libertad No 820 del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años y es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es agricultor, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuenta no son suficientes para los gastos familiares, es así que Llerme con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña peluquería.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un local de belleza, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, de allí abre su local de belleza para atender a sus clientes hasta las 5 pm.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: tintes, lacas, maquina para cortar pelo, fijadores, secadores de cabello, etc.

Llerme se siente muy contenta pues esta logrando cumplir sus sueños ahora puede apoyar a sus hijos y en los gastos de su hogar, esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Products for her business

loans.name: Guzal

texts.ru:
Guzal is 27 years old. She is single and lives with her parents. She is the head of a sewing shop. She needs a loan to be able to repair her apartment. Her parents have given her an apartment and she would like to repair it. However, she does not want to take money out of the business because during the past winter there were issues with electricity and it was necessary to close the shop. Guzal let the workers go home because it was impossible to work in the cold and without light. In addition to that most of the sewing machines require electricity. She has already borrowed money before for the business and was able to fully repay the loan. This time she has come to us for a consumer loan.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Гузаль 27 лет она не замужем, живет с родителями. Она руководит швейным цехом . Ей необходим кредит для ремонта своей квартиры. Ее родители подарили квартиру, и она решила сделать ремонт. Но с бизнеса ей не хотелось брать , потому что этой зимой были проблемы со светом и цех вынуждены были остановить. Гузаль отпустила работников, так как невозможно было работать в холодных условиях зимы и при отсутствии света, большинство швейных машинок работали на электричестве. Она раньше кредитовалась и получала кредит для бизнеса, закончив кредитование без проблем, она опят обратилась к нам, теперь она получила кредит для личного пользования.

loans.use: Repair of Apartment

loans.name: Mahmood

texts.en:
Mahmood is married. He is educated. He was in Pakistan for 7 years. While he was living in Pakistan, he worked in an ice cream shop. He has 7 years experience in his business. When he came back, he opened an ice cream shop in Kabul.

But he can’t complete his lease purchase, so he has requested an individual loan to complete his stock and further his business with more success so as to make good monthly income for his family and enroll his children in a better education in Kabul.

Mahmood is very happy about this process of loans in Afghanistan that helps poor people and helps people that come from different countries. He is happy with all members of his family.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Hadia's Nyota Njema Group

texts.en:
Hadia is 24 years old. She is single with 3 children between 8 and 3 years old. She became a food seller in 2003. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Hadia now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mwatima R., Mosi B., and Mwatima A..

loans.use: To by more food items for her business.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es salaam Tanzania! Janeth K. is a married woman with two children who are 6 and 9 years old. Since 2006, Janeth has been selling milk from her cows daily to locals in her neighborhood. This has enabled her to earn monthly profits of approximately $200. She is now requesting a loan of $275 in order to purchase another cow to allow her to increase the amount of milk she sells daily and therefore increase her profits. In the future, she hopes to be able to open a second business.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through microleasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase another cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en: Mrs. Pheap L., 45, sells roast beef and breeds pigs. She has been operating this business from the front of her house since earL. 2007. Her customers always visit her house to eat her roast beef.  She currentL. earns approximateL. US$8.00 each day. She has two young children and spends a lot of time taking care of them as well. Mr. Pheang Song, her husband, is 46 years old and is a mobile dealer in domestic animals. Mrs. Pheap hopes to expand her husband's business. ConsequentL., she is requesting a loan US$1,000 to purchase more oxen, buffalo and pigs. They all live in Kantang Commune, Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: Purchasing more oxen, buffalo and pigs

loans.name: Sanata

texts.fr:
Enfant d’une famille de nomade spécialisée dans les activités de pêches, Sanata Djiré a été très tôt initiée aux activités génératrices de revenus par ses parents.. Après une longue phase d’apprentissage, elle décida de se spécialiser dans le commerce de poissons fumés. Aujourd’hui âgée de 48 ans Madame Sanata Djiré est dans un régime polygamique et vit avec son époux et ses 4 enfants (dont une fille et trois garçons) dans sa propre maison dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la préfecture de Koutiala (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
 Avec une expérience de 18 ans elle est très sollicitée et appréciée dans les foires hebdomadaires des villages environnants.
Elle est en relation avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 3 ans. Après 4 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) et un prêt individuel, tous correctement bien remboursés, elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel.
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 10 gros paniers de poissons fumés dans la région de Mopti auprès des pêcheurs (Bozos et Somonos) pour les stocker et les vendre en détail. Les ventes sont effectuées au comptant en gros et en détail, dans le marché de poissons de la ville de Koutiala, et dans les foires hebdomadaires des villages environnants à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs, de ménagères et de restaurateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et le reste pour renforcer le fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
A child from a nomadic family specialized in fishing, Sanata Djiré was, at a very early age, initiated into income-generating work by her parents. After a long apprenticeship, she decided to become specialized in the commerce of smoked fish. Today, she is 48 years old and in a polygamous arrangement, living with her husband and four children (one girl and three boys) in her own house in the Hamdallaye district of Koutiala Prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). With eighteen years of experience, she is in great demand and highly valued at the weekly fairs of the surrounding villages. She has had an association with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso for three years. After four solidarity loans (group loans) and an individual loan, all correctly repaid, she is on her second individual loan. This loan will be used to buy 10 large baskets of smoked fish in the Mopti region from fishermen (Bozos and Somonos) in order to stock up and to make retail sales, in bulk and for cash, at the fish market of the city of Koutiala and at the weekly fairs nearby to customers composed of retailers, homemakers, and restauranteurs. She intends to realize a monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA, which will be used to cover the loan interest, to provide for the family, and the rest to boost working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy smoked fish

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina U. is 31 years old and married with two children. She sells tailoring materials and sarongs. She also sews clothes for her customers. 

She is happy because the festive season is approaching and the demand for her sarongs will increase. She is requesting a loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Martha Imelda

texts.es:
Martha inició el negocio para obtener un ingreso que le permitiera vivir mejor, ya que se jubilo del Instituto Mexicano del Seguro Social (IMSS) y con la pensión que recibía no era suficiente. Por lo que comenzó en Noviembre de 1995 su negocio, cuando una amiga le comentó que ella se dedicaba a vender ropa y le iba muy bien, fue así que la invitó a hacer un viaje a los E.U. para comprar cosas. Primero empezó vendiendo entre sus compañeros de trabajo y vecinos y le empezó a ir muy bien. Después se dediqué a la venta de ropa y viajaba a la ciudad de Moroleón, Guanajuato, pero en la actualidad encuentra ropa mas barata en Michoacán y en Villa Hidalgo, Jalisco por lo que surte directamente haya además de que es ropa nueva.

Ahora ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $8,000 que pagara en12 catorcenas para realizar un viaje en cual va a comprar ropa para vender en esta época de fin de año que se acerca.
texts.en:
Martha started the business to have an income that would allow her to live better, since she retired from the Mexican Social Security Institute (IMSS), and the pension she received wasn't enough. Because of this she started her business in November of 1995, when a friend told her that she was selling clothes and it was going very well for her. She invited Martha to go on a trip to the US to buy things. Martha started selling among her friends from work and her neighbors, and that started to go very well for her. Afterward, she sold clothes and traveled to the city of Moroleon, Guanajuato, but she found clothes cheaper in Michoacan and Villa Hidalgo, Jalisco, because they got their stock directly (from the manufacturers), plus, it was new clothing. Now Martha needs a loan of $600 that she will pay back in 12 installments. She will use it for a trip during which she will go to buy clothing to sell during the end-of-year time that is drawing near.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Spean

texts.en:
Spean L., 50, of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, makes a living selling various products from her home including vegetables, fruits, and groceries. She is the widowed mother of four children, three married and one single, the latter assisting her in her business.

L. hopes to improve her investment and so is requesting a $500 loan from HKL. The loan will be used to buy additional merchandise to sell.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Bárbara

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León la señora Barbara M. se dedica a su actividad de venta de granos básicos los cuales son comercializados en su local vendiendo todo tipo de granos tales como arroz, maíz, frijoles, entre otros.

Hoy en día ella requiere mejorar las condiciones de su negocio ofertando mayores cantidades de granos básicos y es por esta razón que muy sabiamente ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de dichos granos y así continuar en su comercialización diaria. Es importante destacar que con este crédito se beneficiará grandemente y logrará salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the municipality of El Sauce in the city of León, Barbara Martinez works selling staple grains. Her business sells all kinds of grains, such as rice, corn, and beans, among others. She now needs to improve the caliber of her business by offering greater quantities of goods, and for this reason she has applied for a loan through Kiva partner Ceprodel. She will use the money to purchase said grains and thus continue her day to day sales. It is important to point out that this loan will be extremely beneficial to her and allow her to keep her buisiness going.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing staple grains

loans.name: Thlang

texts.en:
Thlang P. is a 56 year old villager who lives in a medium-size stone house in Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. He earns a living driving a taxi motorbike in and around his community. He also provides a photography service to visitors in a tourist area. Thlang is married with two children who are still young and are going to school. His wife Sophal (who is pictured above) is 27 years old and makes a living sewing clothes for the neighborhood.

Thlang is asking for a loan to use for his wife's business. They will purchase more sewing machines and other necessary tools in order to fulfill customer demands.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing machine and necessary tools.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey P. is a villager in Kok Romeat village in Kandal province. She is employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Pum Sophorn, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice.

Aside from the plantation, he owns a loud speaker which he rents for weddings, ceremonies, parties, and so on.

Srey wants to expand her husband’s plantation by purchasing a piece of land to cultivate rice. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan. She has two children, one who attends the local school. The youngest is too young to work or study. Her husband and child are presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: Purchasing land to cultivate rice.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
La señora María Luisa F. se ha destacado por ser una excelentísima cocinera que elabora alimentos para luego ofertarlos en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua capital de Nicaragua.

Es de importancia destacar que la señora F. hoy en día atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en su negocio y para ello ha buscado apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito y así mejorar su situación económica y beneficiar a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Luisa F. has distinguished herself as a very excellent cook who prepares food which she later sells in the wholesale market in Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. It is important to point out that Mrs. F. today goes through the need to invest in her business, and for that reason she seeks support from Ceprodel, to benefit from a loan and thereby improve her financial situation and benefit her family.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of premium material

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Ry C., 28, pictured with her husband at the field, is a professional tailor who lives in the Kandal province with her husband and one young child. She typically earns US$2 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver and also a farmer. On average, combining both businesses, he makes US$6 per day. Ry would like to take out a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her husband so that he can grow more crops.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Bertha O. is a 37-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of three who are currently in school. Through hard work Bertha provide support for her children's education. She is a food vendor who has been selling banku and fufu in her neighborhood for the past two years now. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper, gravy stew or any kind of soup and fried fish or meat. Fufu is obtained from pounded cassava with plantains taken with hot soup, together with meat and fish.

Bertha has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy banku and fufu as breakfast, lunch, and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, cassava, plantains, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. As a part of her business expansion, Bertha has added cooked rice and stew to her product line, and when asked she said most of her customers request the rice, so she saw it as an opportunity. She hopes to raise more income to help her husband take care of the children's educational needs. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Unity’.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia es una mujer muy trabajadora, desde muy joven ha luchado por forjarse una buena vida, y hoy a sus 53 años todavía lo sigue haciendo, vive en su propia casa y lo que más quiere es tener una vejez tranquila. Tiene una pequeña carretilla en la que vende anticuchos (brochetas), la ubicación que ha elegido está cerca al centro comercial que es muy concurrida por las personas. Antonia atiende a sus clientes con mucha paciencia y cariño, ya que lo que más le gusta es ver a la gente degustando sus deliciosos anticuchos. Son ya 10 años los que lleva en este negocio y se siente muy feliz realizándolo, aunque sufre mucho en los meses fríos del año, porque tiene que permanecer hasta cerca de las 4 de la mañana en la calle para vender sus anticuchos, por eso anhela tener un restaurante de comida rápida donde pueda vender con más comodidad y así mejorar sus ingresos. Este es el primer préstamo de Antonia con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y desea hacerlo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa, siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en sus reuniones. Los mil nuevos soles solicitados los invertirá en comprar ingredientes para preparar más anticuchos y generarse mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Antonia is a very hard-working woman. Ever since she was young she has strived to make a better life for herself, and she continues to do so at 53 years old. She lives in her own home and, more than anything, she hopes to have a worry-free retirement.
She sells anticuchos (kebabs) from a cart that she stations close to a busy shopping centre. Antonia most enjoys seeing people try her delicious anticuchos, so she serves her customers with great patience and care.
She has been happily running this business for 10 years, despite suffering in the colder months when she has to stay out in the street selling her anticuchos until almost 4 in the morning. This is why she dreams of opening a more convenient fast food restaurant that would increase her earnings.
This is Antonia’s first loan with MFP; she knows she has to make all her repayments on time and aims to do so. She is a very active member of her communal bank, always keeping up-to-date on the agreements reached in their meetings. She will use the requested 1000 PEN to purchase ingredients to make more anticuchos and to generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make anticuchos

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine R., a 53-year-old widow with three school-aged children, is from the city of Dipolog where she owns and operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp to the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2006, Josephine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital, Josephine is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used for the same purposes. This loan will be her eighth from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Muborak

texts.ru: Муборак Олимова проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст 25 лет. Находится в гражданском браке, имеет 2 дочерей. Муборак имеет цех, где производит хлеб, хлебные кульки для мороженного. Т.к. она имеет постоянных клиентов, производит тоже под заказ. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 6 лет. Муж также помогает ей. Кредит просит для покупки станка, чтобы изготавливать хлебные стаканчики для морожнего.
texts.en:
Muborak O. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 25 years old. She is in a common-law marriage and has 2 daughters. Muborak owns a factory where she bakes bread and ice-cream cones. Because she has consistent customers, she also bakes to-order. She has been involved in this business for over 6 years. Her husband helps her as well. Muborak is requesting a loan for the purchase of a machine to make ice-cream cones.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of an ice-cream cone-making machine

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
Agness is a member of the Maendeleo borrower group. She is 37 years old and married, and she has two children, ages 15 and 20.

Agness started her own grocery business two years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 250,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Agness's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested a loan in the amount of 350,000 Tsh in order to buy more soda and beer for sale in her store.

With the additional profit she expects to gain from the use of this loan, Agness hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more soda and beer for sale in her store

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: La señora Reyna Isabel de 36 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, soltera con tres hijos de 7, 13 y 18 años de edad, el mayor trabaja y los dos menores estudian su negocio es una pulpería que desde hace varios años administra, difícil ya que no tiene la ayuda del padre de sus hijos, con este préstamo que esta haciendo es para comprar granos básicos, carne, golosinas y otros productos para incrementar las ventas y poder tener mejores utilidades. Da las gracias a la institución por la oportunidad de incrementar el inventario de su negocio el cual traerá beneficios para su familia.
texts.en:
Reyna Isabel is 36 years old and resides in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She is single and has three children ages 7, 13, and 18; the eldest works and the two younger children study. She has run a small convenience store for many years, which has been difficult given that she does not have help from the father of her children. With this loan she will purchase basic grains, meat, candies, and other products to increase her sales and earn better profits. She thanks the institution for the opportunity to increase the inventory of her business, which will bring benefits for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains, candies, and other products.

loans.name: Azindoh

texts.en:
H. is married with three children. She lives in upper GTTC Nkwen- Cameroon.  H. and her entire family are living in a house with 3 rooms.

H. had to overcome some challenges in life such as taking care of her children; supporting her husband to take pay her children school fees

This will be Helens fourth time to receive loan from GHAPE. She has been a member since 2004 She has been quite successful in the past with her business due to her location of her business, and her reasonable prices.  Also with the experience, she is now having good profit from the business.
 
Part of her profits from this loan will be used to take care of her children, buy necessities for the family and give them good medication when  ever they sick and will cloth her children.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients

loans.use: Buying of palm oil, rice, groundnuts, beans

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Hog raising is the business maintained by Gloria C.. She is happily married to Armando, a farmer.  Her family lives in the distant place of San Antonio, San Agustin, Isabela, a mountainous and far place. The couple is blessed with three children: Angelina - 13 years old; Angelo - nine years old and Armando C. Jr. - five years old.  All of them are in the elementary level.  Gloria hopes the best for her children that is why, she is working hard in her hog raising business to earn bigger income for them. Her husband works hand in hand with her.   

Gloria would like to buy additional feeds supply for the maintenance of her business. She wanted to seek the assistance of KIVA lenders, requesting the amount of PHP6, 000. This would serve a big help most especially in the maintenance of her hog raising business. She hopes that she could be able to avail the amount of loan she is requesting.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
With her income in her business, Fely M. allows her to support their family needs. She is 41 years old married and gifted with only child. Fely is engage in business selling of kugon or a kind of roof light material made of dried grass. She is also manages a charcoal making business. Her business is risky because she needs to go in mountains with his husband just to get kugon to sell. In terms of charcoal making she also cuts wood and dried them for some days to make a charcoal. When it totally become charcoal, she sells it in market of Mallig and in their village. 

The couple is dreaming that their child will successfully finish her education and will have a better future. Their tried their best to comply in their responsibility to their child as a good parents. Fely wanted to borrow the amount of Php 6,000 for additional capital for the improvement of her businesses.

loans.use: additional capital for her business

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou T. is from the village of Catibac, Catarman Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Marilou is single. To make a living, Marilou owns & operates a business providing sing-a-long services to local community members. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marilou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marilou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Apolinario

texts.en:
Apolinario R. is from the village of Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. He is 65 years old. Apolinario is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Apolinario owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Apolinario has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Apolinario joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Apolinario is requesting a loan of 2,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Apolinario from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his agricultural business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: William Ramiro

texts.es: El señor William Ramiro tiene una pequeña pulpería ubicada en Laureles Norte en donde vive junto con su esposa y tres hijos, que cursan sus estudios, en su negocio se ha descapitalizado debido a las ventas bajas por las crisis del desempleo, el inicio con ahorro propios y luego con financiamiento es por tal razón no ha cerrado por que ha invertido. Sus planes es poder tener su propio taller de saldadura. Ya que  hace trabajos cuando lo buscan por que anteriormente de eso dependía. Con este préstamo comprara, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche de pote, lácteos, carnes, cosméticos, productos de limpieza y otros que puedan sastifacer las necesidades del cliente como vender mas para poder ayudar a su familia a que no pase ninguna necesidad. Da las gracias Afodenic por impulsar el crédito ya que gracias a estos se logra la buena inversión.
texts.en:
Mr. William Ramiro owns a small grocery store located in Laureles Norte where he lives with his wife and three school-going children. His business has lost money because of poor sales due to the unemployment crisis. He has not closed down the business as he invested his personal savings as well as loans. His plans are to open his own welding workshop as he used to work as a welder for his income. With this loan he will buy rice, beans, sugar, pot milk, dairy products, meat, cosmetics, cleaning products, etc. to satisfy the needs of the client and sell more to satisfy his family's needs. He is grateful to Afodenic to promote his loan as it will provide a good investment.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, pot milk, meat, and dairy products to increase sales.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet C. runs a general store selling food products in her community. She is 38 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Paitan, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. Juliet has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2006, Juliet joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Juliet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her fifth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to pay for the tuition fees of her children.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité  Kuña Kyrey se encuentra en su 8vo ciclo, tienen un ahorro de Gs. 3.724.000, son señoras que viven en la zona de San  Luis Capiatá, trabajan hace mas  de dos años con la Fundación paraguaya. 
Para ellas este crédito es de gran ayuda pues gracias al dinero al que acceden pueden hacer crecer sus negocios y mantener de una manera digna a sus familias.
Cada una tiene una actividad independiente pero de una o otra manera todas se ayudad comprendo o vendiendo los productos que ofrecen.
Una historia muy especial y conmovedora es de la Sra. Diana Alarcón quien vende remedios naturales, esta es una profesión muy común de las madres en nuestro medio. La Sra. Diana acude muy temprano al mercado para comprar en cantidad sus productos y luego recorre en las despensas de los Barrios de San Lorenzo para vender sus productos, ella ya tiene una clientela formada y su gran parte de su producto con venta segura. Agradece a la Fundación por la ayuda Brindada.

texts.en:
The Kuña Kyrey committee is in its 8th cycle, and they have savings of Gs. 3,724. They are women who live in the area of San Luis Capiatá, and they have been working with the Fundacían Paraguaya.

This loan is of great help to them because, thanks to the money they can access, they can grow their businesses and support their families with dignity.

Each woman has an independent business, but, one way or another, each helps by understanding or selling the products that they offer. One very special and moving story is about Diana, who sells natural remedies. This is a very common profession for women in our midst. Diana goes very early to the market to buy her goods in bulk and later travels to the small stores of the neighborhood San Lorenzo to sell her products, she already has regular customers and guaranteed sales for the great part of her products. She is grateful to the Fundacíon for the help offered to her.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: According to the professions of the women, the loan will be used to by goods such as: creams, shampoos, underwear, clothes, pans. In the food industry: egg, milk, cheese, meats, vegetables, fruit  breads, etc...

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
A la edad de 28 años, el joven Nelson C. se ha caracterizado por tener su negocio de venta de calzados tanto para damas, caballeros y niños comercializándolos en el mercado central de Chinandega donde a diario le visitan sus clientes para comprar los calzados.
Él es un joven soltero pero tiene dos hijos en edades escolares que mantener y por esta razón busca la manera de salir adelante confiando de que todo le saldrá bien y obtendrá el crédito el que será utilizado directamente para la compra de los zapatos y para la compra de cerámicas y ladrillos para mejorar el local porque se ha expandido y ahora alquila teléfonos para llamadas. De esta manera obtendrá los ingresos para el mejoramiento del nivel de vida de él y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nelson Charmorro is a 28 year old young man who is known for having a business selling footwear for women, men, and children. He sells at the central market in Chinandega. His customers visit him there daily to buy footwear. He is single, but he has two school aged children to support. That is the reason he is looking for the way to get ahead. He is confidant that everything will turn out well, and that he will get the loan. He will use it to buy the shoes and to buy tiles and bricks to improve his location. He has expanded, and he now rents out telephones for calls. This way he will get the income to improve his standard of living and that of his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Marina es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Huayllapampa, Marina tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Marina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
El sueño de Marina es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Marina is a member of the Community Bank "Violeta". She lives with her common-law husband, she is 35 years old and she has 2 children. She lives in the community of Huayllapampa. Marina runs a grocery store from her house, selling general merchandise, vegetables and meats, something she does every day.

Marina requires a loan of 1000 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar.

Marina's dream is to expand her business.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice and sugar.

loans.name: Mawuli

texts.en: Mawuli Y. was born in Kpalimé, Togo, a town two hours north of the country’s capital. She is 36 years old and now lives and works in the Agoé district of Lomé, Togo. Mrs. Y. runs a grocery store called “Etablissement Manu,” which she began in 2004. She often purchases her stock at the Grand Marché of Lomé and sells her products to a variety of customers in her neighborhood. Mrs. Y. is now asking for her first loan from WAGES, which she will use to replenish her stock. Specifically, she plans on purchasing cooking oil, rice, cosmetics and other diverse products. With this loan, Mrs. Y. will be able to further contribute to the daily expenses of her husband and two children.

loans.use: Purchase of grocery products for resale

loans.name: Gerardo Jose

texts.es: El señor Gerardo ha sido un hombre muy esforzado, tiene 50 años de edad, vive en el barrio Linda Vista, gracias al  apoyo de sus padres  logro el bachillerato con la ventaja que salía  bachiller y técnico a la vez en el instituto. Lo que desde joven logro comenzar a trabajar y apoyaba a sus padres, ya que eran una familia muy humildes. Su primer trabajo es en el Banco Nicaragüense en donde comienza como auxiliar contable. Luego se casa y junto a su esposa procreo tres hijos ya mayores de edad. Tiene veinte cinco años laborando y ayudado a sus hijos con los estudios, su casa no la ha logrado terminar por completo a un es de tierra y falta repellar las paredes lo que espera lograr a corto plazo. Siempre deseo sacar una segunda carrera que es derecho por gracias a Dios,  la término lo que espera poder comenzar hacer acesoria contable y legal para tener mejores ingreso. Con este financiamiento lo quiere para pagar el titulo de derecho que le es caro y no cuenta con este dinero es por eso de gran necesidad para poder pagar y comenzar su objetivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
Gerardo, 50, has struggled much. He lives in the Linda Vista neighborhood. Thanks to help from his parents, he was able to finish high school receiving both his high school diploma and technical certification. From a very young age he began to work in order to help support his parents because they were a very humble family. His first job was with the Banco Nicaragüense where he worked as an accounting assistant. Then, he got married. He and his wife had three children, who are now all adults. He has worked for 25 years and has helped his children with their education. He hasn't mananged to finish his house completely; it's still made of dirt and the walls need replastering, which he hopes to do in the short term. He always wanted a second career: law. Thanks to God, he completed it. What he wants to do now is offer legal and accounting consultancies in order to earn better income. He will use this loan to pay for the costs of getting his professional law title; this is a very expensive process and he does not have the funds necessary for this and to start working toward his new professional objective.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for his professional law title which is very expensive and he does not have the money to do so.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 43 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Sosimo de 51 años y sus 2 hijos, a quienes desea verlos con una carrera profesional.

Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, ropa y zapatillas. Lo que más le gusta es que con esta actividad puede dedicarle tiempo a su familia, mientras su esposo lleva 20 años cultivando café por ser un producto muy rentable,  por lo que en época a de cosecha, ella se suma al trabajo en las chacras. Esta pareja tiene la esperanza de que sus hijos sean hombres de bien, por ello les inculcan valores.
Para el futuro planean plantar más variedades de café e instalar una tienda de ropa, aprovechando que tiene personas conocidas que le hacen pedidos especiales de prendas.

Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y siempre está pendiente de cada acuerdo que se determina en su banco comunal para desarrollarlo en conjunto, pues en este grupo practican la responsabilidad, solidaridad y compañerismo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará cosméticos, gran variedad de ropas y zapatillas de diferentes tamaños, con el resto invertirá en la compra de sacos de fertilizantes y botellas de insecticidas para las plantaciones de su esposo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 43 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband Sosimo, age 51, and their 2 sons, whom they would like to see in professional careers. For the past two years, Rosa has sold beauty products, clothing and casual shoes. What she likes best is the fact that this work allows her to dedicate time to her family. Her husband has spent 20 years growing coffee, since this is a very profitable product. Accordingly, Rosa helps with the field work during the harvest season. The couple is teaching their sons values and hope that they will grow up to be good men. For the future, they plan to plant more varieties of coffee and also open a clothing store, taking advantage of the fact that Rosa knows people who regularly place special orders for clothing. This is Rosa's second loan with MFP, and she always keeps up with the agreements reached within her communal bank aimed at mutual development, since the members of this group practice responsibility, solidarity and mutual support. With the funds she is requesting, she will buy cosmetics and a great variety of clothing and shoes of various sizes; with the rest, she will invest in buying sacks of fertilizer and bottles of insecticide for her husband's coffee plantations.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying more merchandise

loans.name: Leaso

texts.en:
Leaso V. is 38 and married with 3 children (ages 6 - 11).  She owns a business venture, 0.  Leaso has 3 years of experience in this business.  Leaso needs a loan of WST $1250 to purchase game prizes.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Leaso joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Leaso's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase game prizes

loans.name: Nieva

texts.en:
Nieva S., 51, is making sure that her family has enough provision for their daily needs. Married to Jose S., a bus driver, Nieva is blessed with three children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been into newspaper sales for quite some time now. She mainly buys and sells tabloids, newspapers and magazines.

Nieva has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow twelve times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she has used the money she has borrowed to expand and improve her business.     

To ensure the continued success of her business, Nieva is applying for a PHP 40,000 loan. This money will be used to buy more magazines, newspapers and tabloids for selling. Nieva dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education, and have a long and comfortable life with her entire family.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more newspapers and magazines to incorporate into her current product inventory

loans.name: Catherine

texts.fr: Née en 1958 à Calavi au Bénin, H. Catherine est mère d'un enfant qui est scolarisé. Catherine ne vit plus avec son mari. Il y a une dizaine d'année que Catherine  s'est installée au quartier Aïbatin à Cotonou,capitale économique du Bénin. Catherine vit seule avec son enfant et assure seule ses différentes charges. Catherine n'a jamais été à l'école. Depuis vingt ans environs, Catherine mène comme activité, la vente de maïs à son domicile. C'est à Banikoara, dans le Nord du Bénin, que Catherine achète ses produits. Catherine a bénéficié une fois déjà de crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. Catherine désire rehausser le niveau de son activité et accroître sa part de marché. Mais Catherine ne dispose pas d'assez de moyens pouvant lui permettre de réaliser son projet. C'est pour cette raison que Catherine sollicite pour une deuxième fois, le concours financier de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1958 in Calavi, Benin, Ms. H. Catherine is the mother of a child, who has attended school.  Catherine no longer lives with her husband.  About ten years ago, she settled in the Aïbatin district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She lives alone with her child and is covering her various expenses by herself.  Catherine never attended school. For about twenty years, she has been running a business selling corn out of her home.  She purchases her supplies in Banikoara, in northern Benin.  Catherine once benefited from a loan from ALIDé that she repaid.  She would like to enhance her business and to increase her market share.  But she doesn't have enough funds enabling her to carry out her plans.  For this reason, Catherine is requesting financial assistance from ALIDé for a second time.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of corn

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and cement

loans.name: Yamileth

texts.es: Yamileth P. G., tiene la edad de 31 años, está casada, y  tiene 2  hijos, uno de 14 y otro de 5 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de algunos terneros y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Yamileth tiene algunos años dedicada al ganado. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.
texts.en:
Yamileth P. G. is 31 years old, married, with 2 children: one 14-year-old and one 5-year-old. She is asking for a loan in order to buy some calves and feed. She wants to fully provide for the cattle so she can get the best return possible when they are sold. She also wants to increase the number of animals she has and be able to keep them in better conditions, including suitable land for keeping and raising the cattle. This is the first time she has sought a loan from FUDECOSUR, and is very happy with the help she has been given. Mrs. G. has several years experience with cattle. She hopes the future will include a better quality of life and economic stability to her family, and to be able to keep growing as a person and as a farmer.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Powell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: 11Thieu Toan Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Tinh P. T. (18) is a 54-year-old woman living in the town of Thieu Toan-Thieu Hoa. Tinh is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, a Kiva partner. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 11 Thieu toan (07.01.11.Thieu hoa).

Tinh is widowed and has an adult child. To making a living, Tinh raises livestock. The main source of income for her business comes from raising cattL. for saL.. Tinh has been engaged in this business for more than 30 years and earns approximately 1.500.000 Vietnamese Dong (VND) a month from it.

In 2002, Tinh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tinh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2.124.000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  

She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND, which will also be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the seventh loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tinh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  H. T. Can (6) is a 59-year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business of raising livestock.

2.  N. T. Hue (22) is a 47-year-old woman who is also requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her livestock business.

3.  L. T. Nhung (59) is a 38-year-old woman who is also requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support his livestock business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Tinh P. T. (18) là 54 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thieu  Toan-Thieu Hoa.  Tinh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 11 Thieu toan (07.01.11.Thieu hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Tinh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 30 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Tinh kiếm được khoảng 1.500.000 VND.  Vào 2002, Tinh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Tinh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2.124.000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  H. T. Can (6) là 59 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  N. T. Hue (22) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  L. T. Nhung (59) là 38 tuổi nu.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en: Joseline wants a loan to buy a freezer and tables and to pay rent for her business. She is 34 years old and married with seven children between 3 and 19 years old. She lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She owns a restaurant that started eight years ago as a tea room and has grown into outdoor catering. She expects to keep expanding her business and own assets.

loans.use: To buy a freezer and tables and pay rent for her restaurant.

loans.name: Felecite

texts.en:
Felecite was born in 1983. She is married with three children. Felicite's husband is a driver. They both work hard for the benefit of their family. Felecite owns a business selling clothes. She employs one person from her community as a helper. This is her second year of success in her business. The hours of her shop are from 7 in the morning to 5 in the evening, every day except one in the week.

Felecite is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more clothes to sell. With this loan, Felecite hopes to earn more profit which will allow her to buy her own house.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Madres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Madres Trabajadoras” tiene  más de 3 años de formación y trabaja con la Fundación Paraguaya, la mayoría de sus integrantes ya  realiza actividades productivas, para este ciclo incluyen entre sus integrantes a 2 señoras que también emprenderán actividades.
 Incluyen entre las actividades realizadas la venta de frutas y verduras, venta de comestibles artesanales como empanadas de carne, empanadas de pollo, empanadas de jamón y queso, venta de mercaderías. 
Todas anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos, es por eso que se esfuerzan el doble para facilitarles los materiales  para  su desarrollo y formación. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Sandi quien se dedica a la venta de ropas en un puesto de venta que posee en el mercado de Asunción. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de ropas como   remeras, pantalones, buzos, y otros.
texts.en:
The “Madres Trabajadoras” (Working Mothers) committee was formed more than three years ago and works with “Fundación Paraguaya.” Most of its members are already involved in productive businesses. During this cycle, they are adding two other entrepreneurial women. Their business activities include the sale of fruits and vegetables; the sale of artesian foods such as meat empanadas, chicken empanadas, ham and cheese empanadas; and the sale of general merchandise. All of them want a better future for their children, so they double their efforts to provide them what they need for their growth and development. One of the members, Sandi, sells clothing from a stall that she has in the Asunción market. She is asking for this loan to buy clothing, such as shirts, pants, jackets, and other things.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing for resale

loans.name: Encuentro Con Jesus  4 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group. Encuentro de Jesus 4 (encounter with Jesus). She lives in a simple structure with her husband and two children. She says that her most difficult challenges are spiritual. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying attending church and worshiping the Lord.

Maria is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for 5 years. She started with some clothing a friend gave her. She focused and invested all the sales. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying rice, oil, beans and a bag of used cloths.
