She will use the profits to reinvest and meet any needs at home.

This Esperanza associate began with us because "In Esperanza I found support". Her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, beans and a bag of used cloths

loans.name: Cynthia Servande Group

texts.en:
Cynthia Servande is from the town of Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 51 years old and the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Cynthia Servande Group.

Cynthia is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately $115 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cynthia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. 

Cynthia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support members of her extended family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet Y. is from the town of Banga. She is 41 years old and married. She has 8 children, the eldest is aged 19 and the youngest, 6 years old. To make a living, Janet owns & operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice, for sale. Janet has been engaged in farming for over 19 years. She and her husband work hard to provide for their family. She also hopes to have another source of income for the family.

Janet joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Janet has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort J. sells groundnuts, corn mix and bananas at Abura. Comfort has been through senior high school. She has three children and is married to an electrician. Her loan will enable her to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to invest in the sale of other types of fruits. If she has any further incremental sales, she would use the profits to educate her children.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Layal

texts.en: Layal is 26 years old, married and has made a living decorating souvenirs since 2007. She is applying for a loan from All Majmoua to buy more of the supplies she needs to operate and expand her business. Her clients are brides, pregnant mothers and anyone with a special occasion to celebrate. Layal has lots of experience in this area and is very talented. She hopes to expand her business and open a larger store in the future.

loans.use: To buy the supplies she needs to run her business

loans.name: Josephin

texts.en:
Josephin is a single woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent.

She has operated a natural fruit-juice selling business for over two years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her greatest major challenge is seasonality. During the rainy winter season, the demand for soft drinks is low compared to the hot summer season. Josephin hopes to expand the business in the future.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase water pipes and taps to install fresh water for resale.

loans.use: To purchase water pipes and taps to install fresh water for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: she wants to enlarge her shop

loans.name: Odile

texts.en: Odile is 21 years old and married with a child of four months. Her husband works as a mechanic. Odile has operated a business selling motorbike and bicycle spare parts for four years. She says that her business has done a lot in her life. With this loan, she expects to buy more spare parts to sell. The profits will be used to reinvest and import spare parts. She would like to be a great spare parts dealer in the future.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts to sell

loans.name: Huberte

texts.fr: Huberte est née en 1982 et est mariée à un chauffeur. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé. Il y a cinq ans que Huberte s'est installée au quartier Irédé à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, avec sa famille. Huberte assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Huberte n'a pas été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Huberte vend depuis cinq ans environs de la friperie à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est aussi dans le même marché que Huberte achète ses produits. Huberte est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu antérieurement trois crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Dans le but d'agrandir son activité et d'accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son profit, Huberte sollicite à nouveau un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: Huberte was born in 1982. She is married to a driver. They have two children, one of whom goes to school. Five years ago Huberte and her family settled in the Irédé district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Huberte and her husband jointly provide for the family needs. Huberte did not go to school. To support herself and her family, Hubert has been selling used clothing in Dantokpa, at the international market of Benin, for about five years. She also purchases her wares at that market. Huberte is an old-time client of ALIDé and obtained three prior loans, all well repaid. With the goal of expanding her business and increasing her sales volume and profits, Huberte is seeking a new loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: Purchasing second-hand clothing

loans.name: Jesús Amelia

texts.es:
Jesús Amelia tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el pueblo joven Santa Rosa, una zona marginal que forma parte del distrito de Lambayeque, una zona de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una bodega la cual funciona en su domicilio. Allí ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de uso diario entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Ella ofrece sus productos a sus clientes tanto al crédito como al contado. Ella siempre trata de brindar un buen trato a sus clientes por lo que en el tiempo que lleva funcionando su negocio este ha empezado a contar con buena acogida. Ella también se dedica a trabajar como costurera. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo, que es panadero, a sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

Jesús desea adquirir mercadería para poder satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta actualmente, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Jesús Amelia is 26 years old, married, and lives with her family in the town of Santa Rosa, a marginalized area that is part of the District of Lambayeque and experiences considerable commercial activity. This community is located twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Jesús Amelia has a store that she operates from her home. There she offers her customers different everyday products such as basic necessities and groceries. She provides these products to her customers on credit as well as for cash. Jesús Amelia always provides good service to her customers and her business has been well-received during the time it has been in operation. In addition, she works as a seamstress. The earnings from this activity are used to help her husband, a baker, get ahead with their family’s finances.

Jesús Amelia wants to acquire merchandise to meet the current demand. For this reason she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1200 PEN to help achieve this goal.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise for her store

loans.name: Jo-Ane

texts.en:
Jo-ane S., 39, is an entrepreneur with a knack for multitasking. She is a registered nurse, but found success in establishing businesses. Her trainings in CCT* as a Community Partner enable her to reach heights in business. Jo-ane is married to Marzan, a painter.  They live in Dasmarinas where they raise their only son, who is now in elementary.

Being in the direct-selling business, Jo-ane has developed the skill to choose the quality products and deal with people in the neighborhood to turn them into regular customers. She sells shirts, pants, bags, and shoes that suit the tastes of her friends and business connections. That is the reason her business works. Jo-ane also sells frozen foods to household people who take time to cook. Monthly, she earns an average net income of Php 10,800.  

Jo-ane wants to maximize her potential as a multitasking entrepreneur. To help her continue operation of her businesses, she would like to request for a  Php 31,000 loan. She plans to use this to increase the number of products she sells in order to better meet the specific needs of her regular customers. More importantly, she is planning to use a big part of the loan to start another business.

Sure enough, Jo-ane never misses her share of customers who do not pay on time. Nevertheless, she still prays for the ability to collect their payments and use the money in her soon-to-open business. All this multitasking is a means of preparation for the multifaceted future which she wants her only son to have.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: restocking inventory

loans.name: Mirjamol

texts.en:
M. Mirjamol is a loving and self-sacrificing father. Ever since he was young, Mirjamol has been around people raising animals, and thanks to this knowledge, he dedicates himself to raising and selling cattle, work that he learned from his humble parents. With experience gained over time in the purchase and sales of cattle, he has been able to bring stability to his family. The desire that Mirjamol harbors in his heart is that of increasing his capital to invest in acquiring more animals. With these, he can create more income for his family. Above all, he hopes to offer a better quality of life for his beloved children who always support him unconditionally in his daily work. Mirjamol requests 7,500 Somoni for purchasing young cattle.       


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Maria Doraliza

texts.es:
Maria de 48 años, vende productos naturales para el cuerpo hechos con frutas. Hace  años atrás ella comenzó como vendedora de productos y haciendo promociones, (todos los vendedores son independientes).En la actualidad trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta que termine su labor. 

Para seguir trabajando y darle una mejor vida a su familia ella quiere comprar con el préstamo productos  como vitaminas. En el futuro quiere incrementa sus ventas.
texts.en:
Maria is 48 years old and sells natural body products made from fruit. Some years ago, she started selling these products and conducting promotions (all sales representatives are independent). She currently works from 8am until she finishes all of her duties.

To continue working and provide a better life for her family, Maria wants to use her loan to buy products such as vitamins. In the future, she wants to increase her sales.

loans.use: Purchase vitamins to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan C.  is 43 years old and married with three children whose ages range from 18 to 23. Two of the children are currently attending school.

Susan has a mixed farm in Kitale town, western Kenya, that produces milk, maize, beans and vegetables, which are all sold locally. She has been in the farming business for 20 years now and employs one farmhand. She mainly depends on the income from her farm to meet the basic needs of her family.

She has requested a loan of 31,200 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will enable her to pay school fees for her children and also provide for their basic needs. 

She hopes to venture into zero grazing in the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a businessman who runs a barber shop to earn a living.  He has been engaged in the business for ten years.  With the income from his business, he is able to provide for his wife and two children.  He hopes that someday, he will open other outlets for his business.  

He joined Faulu Kenya so that he could easily access loans and also save his money. He has therefore requested 10,000 Kes to buy a shaving machine.

loans.use: To buy a shaving machine.

loans.name: Jorge Antonio

texts.es: Jorge tiene 38 años de edad y es soltero. Vive en casa de sus padres, la cual está ubicada en el distrito de La Victoria. Su comunidad cuenta con servicios básicos de agua, luz, y desagüe y  ha mostrado en los últimos años un crecimiento  comercial bastante notable. Jorge gana su vida como mensajero. Trabaja para una empresa de mensajería y courier, contando con más de 3 años de experiencia. También, trabaja como electricista y cuenta con un taller mecánico en su domicilio donde brinda servicios de reparaciones. Desea hacer unos arreglos a su taller y también comprar más equipo eléctrico que necesita para brindar un servicio de calidad a sus clientes.  Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1200 nuevos soles. Con este crédito, no tendrá que recurrir a prestamistas informales que lo cobrarían tasas por encima del promedio financiero. Jorge es cliente recurrente de Edpyme Alternativa y cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Jorge is 38 years old and single.  He lives in his parents' home which is located in La Victoria district.  His community has access to basic services such as water, electricity and drainage.  Over recent years, the community has shown remarkable signs of commercial growth.

Jorge earns a living as a messenger.  He has worked for a messenger and courier company for three years.  He also works as an electrician and has a workshop in his home where he provides repair services.  Jorge would like to make some repairs to his workshop and also buy some electrical equipment that he needs to provide a good-quality service to his customers.  For this reason, he has requested a loan for 1,200 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  As a result of receiving this loan, he will not have to turn to informal lenders who would charge him rates above the financial average.  Jorge is a long-standing client of Edpyme Alternativa and he has good personal and work references.

loans.use: to buy more equipment and to make some repairs to his workshop

loans.name: Maria Timotea

texts.es:
María  de 56 años, es una mujer trabajadora  que inicio su negocio por medio de una liquidación que le dieron cuando ella trabajaba en un taller de costura.

Ella trabaja sola desde las 8H00 am hasta las 8H00pm en su taller de costura. Tiene dos hijos uno de 26 y  28 años. Con el préstamo desea comprar una maquinas de coser y telas para aumenta sus ingresos.  En un futuro desea abrir su propia boutique.
texts.en:
Maria, age 56, is a hardworking woman who started her business using a severance payment she received from seamstress workshop where she used to work.

Maria works alone from 8am until 8pm in her own workshop. She has two children aged 26 and 28. She plans to use the loan to purchase a sewing machine and a supply of fabric that she needs to increase her income. In the future, she would like to open her own boutique.

loans.use: maquina de coser y telas

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es: Bernardo tiene 63  años, es viudo y vive en su casa propia. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura y crianza de animales, su único medio de transporte es su burro con el que se transporta a considerables distancias para ir a sus terrenos de cultivos y ver todos los días en que estado se viene desarrollando y evitar la plaga de insectos que pueden afectar seriamente sus cosechas. Asimismo tiene ovejas y vacas que cuida en su establo y las lleva al campo a pastear, por ello se levanta en las madrugadas, soportando los días de intenso calor o las intensas lluvias, pero él acostumbrado al clima y al ritmo de vida que no es impedimento  para continuar trabajando. Es su primer crédito  que tiene con MFP, se siente muy contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal porque tiene buenas expectativas de trabajo y aprender más sobre el aspecto financiero por lo que se compromete a ser responsable en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para esta temporada de siembra y cultivar pastizales para el alimento de sus animales y demás productos en sus terrenos.
texts.en:
Bernardo, 63, is a widower living in his own house.  She’s spent his entire life farming and raising livestock.  His only means of transportation is his donkey that he uses to travel considerable distances to visit his fields and check up on them daily to see what state they are in and avoid insect infestations that can seriously affect his crops.  He also cares for sheep and cattle in his stable and takes them to the countryside to pasture. Because of this he rises at dawn withstanding either the intense heat or intense rainfall.  But, he’s used to the weather and the rhythm of life that are no barriers to continue working.

This is his first loan with MFP and he is very happy to belong to a communal bank because he has good expectations for work and to learn more about the financial aspects; he commits to be responsible with his payments.

He will use the loan he’s asking for to buy sacks of manure for the current planting season and to farm pasture to feed his animals as well as other products in his fields.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
This Kiva client lives in the village of Verishen in the region of Syunik, together with her daughter. Her husband has passed away, making it challenging for her, as a widow and as a woman, to manage all the difficulties of village life. 

She is engaged in agriculture, and her work is the family’s main source of income. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase two cows. With the additional income generated from this investment, she will be able to support the family and pay for her daughter’s education.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz de 20 años, es una joven soltera alegre y trabajadora con ganas de sobresalir en la vida, vive en su propia casa situada en la comunidad de Bethel anexo del distrito de Quimbiri y lo que más desea es obtener mejores ingresos para así darle una estabilidad económica a su futura familia. Ella es una jovencita muy laboriosa, con su puesto de trabajo trata de sobresalir adelante. Es comerciante y tiene un paraje de abarrotes situado en su comunidad, desde entonces la bodega de Luz es muy frecuentado por sus compradores, debido a su buen trato. Su negocio esta abierto desde muy temprano hasta altas hora de la noche. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes ya que es una de sus habilidades que emplea para ganar mayor cantidad de consumidores, lleva 03 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer de pie casi todo el día. Con el tiempo piensa incrementar sus ganancias abriendo un pequeño mini Marquet dentro de su comunidad Bethel. Este es su segundo crédito de Luz con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho con el progreso de su trabajo y esta dispuesta cumplir puntualmente con sus cronogramas de pagos. Se siente muy acorde trabajar con los socios de su banco comunal. Con el crédito solicitado comprara más productos para implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Luz, 20, is a single, cheerful and hard working young woman with the desire to get ahead in life.  She lives in her own house located in the community of Bethel, an annex of Quimbiri District.  What she most wants is to earn better income to provide economic stability to her future family.  

She is a very hard working young woman; she does her best to get ahead with her work.  She is a merchant.  She has a grocery stand in her community.  Since then her store has been very popular with buyers because of the good treatment they get.  Her business is open from very early until late at night.  What she likes best about her work is chatting with her customers since this is one of her abilities that she uses to win over larger number of consumers.  She’s been in business for three years and considers the most difficult part having to be on her feet almost all day.  In time, she hopes to increase her profits opening a small mini market in the community of Bethel.

This is Luz’s second loan with MFP.  She feels that the contribution will help her business’ progress very much and is willing to repay in a timely fashion.  She is very agreeable to working with her fellow communal bank members.  She will use the requested loan to buy more merchandise to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar de cincuenta y tres años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo el cual asiste a la escuela cerca de la localidad. Su negocio es un taller automotriz, de enderezado y pintura es uno de los más visitados por las personas del lugar pues el trabajo que el ofrece es de muy buena calidad y a precios muy accesibles. Oscar quiere ver crecer su negocio y sabe que cuando se desea algo se debe correr riesgos y es por eso que para él vale la pena todo el esfuerzo en su trabajo; esto lo ha impulsado a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le dé la posibilidad de comprar material para su trabajo como pinturas de diferentes colores, accesorios y partes para vehículos, aceites, algunas herramientas entre otros. De esta forma podrá mantener su negocio adelante de la competencia, además llevara a su hogar seguridad económica y le dará a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Oscar is 53 years old.  He lives with his life partner and his son who attends a school near their town.  Oscar's business is a garage, body shop and paint shop.  It is one of the busiest in the area because he offers good-quality work at very affordable prices.

Oscar would like to see his business grow and he knows that when you want something you must run risks.  For this reason, he believes that all the effort he puts into his work is worthwhile.  This has driven him to request a loan from INTEGRAL which will give him the possibility to buy material for his work such as different colored paints, vehicle accessories, vehicle parts, oils and some tools.  In this way, he will be able to keep his business ahead of the competition and provide his household with financial security and his family with a full life.

loans.use: to buy paint, vehicle accessories, vehicle parts, oil and tools

loans.name: Aysha

texts.ru: Айша проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 54 года. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Ее сын находится на заработках в России. Сама Айша имеет среднее образование. На сегодняшний день она занимается животноводством. Она разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 15 лет. Кредит берет для закупа скота. Она хочет увеличить количество крупнорогатого и мелко - рогатого скота.
texts.en: Aysha lives in the Yavan district.  She is 54 years old, married and has six children.  Her son works in Russia.  Aysha has a secondary education.  Currently, she is involved in animal husbandry and breeds livestock for subsequent resale.  She has been involved in this type of business for 15 years.  Aysha is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock.  She wants to increase the quantity of cattle and small livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 61 years old and has been farming in Litein,South Rift, Kenya, for the past 31 years. He is married with nine children, all of whom are adults except the last born. His farm produces milk, which he sells to the local Kokiche Cooling plant. He is also a retired teacher and earns a pension, which supplements his farming income.

He has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the additional cow will boost his family's income and make life more bearable.

Michael says, however, that the small parcels of land owned by farmers is the main undoing in farming as it limits their capacity to produce.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen, aged 62, is married with three children and lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She sells different products in her general store to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns PHP 1,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,500 to purchase more stock of products to sell in her general store. Helen has been a member of PMPC for over one year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of products to sell in her general store

location.town: Liloy-Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Jannet Maribel

texts.es:
Jannet de 36 años es madre de familia, vive con su familia en casa de sus suegros, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Chepén que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

Jannet se dedica a la venta de ropa, negocio que a colocado en su domicilio desde hace unos unos años, su mercadería lo ofrece a sus clientes, también trae a pedido, tratando de tener mayor demanda de clientes y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Al observar que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería y abastecer su negocio con productos innovadores, con la finalidad que su clientela siga aumentando para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jannet is 36 years old and a mother.  She lives with her family in her in-law's home, which has full utility services.  It is located in the urban area of Chepén district, which is part of the department of La Libertad.  This area is characterized by its farming, livestock, and tourism.

Jannet works selling clothing; she has been running this business from her home for several years.  She sells merchandise to her customers, and also takes orders, thereby trying to have greater customer demand and so earn more income to cover her family's expenses.

On observing that her business was growing more prosperous on a daily basis, she felt it necessary to request a loan of 3,000 New Soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  The loan is to buy a greater quantity of merchandise and stock up her business with innovative products, with the goal that her customer base will continue to grow so she can pay back her loan and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of merchandise to stock up her business.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 37 years old and has 3 children. Catalina is married and has 3 children who are in school.

Catalina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Catalina requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Catalina has been raising pigs for 12 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Catalina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gulzada's Group

texts.en:
Gulzada is the treasurer of this group. She is 49 years old and married to a builder. Together with her husband, she has raised a 21-year-old son who also works in construction. 

Twelve years ago with an initial investment of 20,000 Kyrgyzstani soms, Gulzada started breeding livestock.  She earns an additional 2,500 Kyrgyzstani soms to add to the family's budget by reselling livestock after fattening.  

With the money received from this loan, she wants to purchase more livestock. In the future she dreams of purchasing a house in Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan). 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock.

loans.name: Jero

texts.en:
It is not only the responsibility as a head of household in the family, but also the duty of a wife to provide support in meeting all the needs of families. Apart from her husband's business, Jero is a vegetable farmer who supports her husband's efforts in meeting the needs of his family. She supplements her husband's income with farming, particularly the growing of broccoli. 

In development there are some obstacles encountered in the development business, such as limited knowledge of business management as well as limited access to capital. To resolve the issue Jero has joined MUK.

Jero, 55, is a farmer who runs a vegetable farm. To improve her business Jero is participating in loan programs for small businesses from MUK. This loan will be used to purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizer supplies. Within 3 months, the vegetable broccoli will be ready for sale, and the profits used to meet family needs and for development of the farm itself.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizer supplies.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga, de 30 años, es una mujer joven muy trabajadora y responsable, es conviviente y es madre de un hijo de cinco años, quien es su razón de vivir y por quien trabajan día a día para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Juntos habitan en casa de su suegro. Su trabajo consiste en la reparación de electrodomésticos de línea blanca, así como la venta de repuestos de los mismos. Ella trabaja en equipo con su pareja, pues anteriormente trabajaba sola en otro rubro, mientras que su pareja trabajaba como soporte técnico en una tienda de artefactos de electrodomésticos, pero hace cuatro meses que dejó de trabajar para formar en sociedad con ella y emprender éste nuevo negocio. Sus clientes tiene buenas referencias del trabajo que realizan, por ello es que tiene demanda de sus servicios. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tienen tiempo a su disposición, además de que le genera ganancias considerables, asimismo se ayudan entre sí. Espera poder mantenerse en el mismo ritomo, pues su anhelo es montar un local en donde atender a sus clientes, pero sin dejar de hacerlo a domicilio. Este será el doceavo crédito con MFP, le esta yendo bien hasta ahora, y espera seguir trabajando bien como lo ha estado haciendo, ya que siempre se mostró como una socia responsable. Por otro lado agradece por la ayuda anterior ya que le ayudo a crecer en su negocio. Con el monto solicitado, comprará repuestos y herramientas para ser más eficaz en el servicio de reparación de electrodomésticos.
texts.en: Olga is 30 years old and she is a very hardworking and responsible young woman. She lives with her partner and she is the mother of a five-year old son. He is her reason for living and it is for him that she works day after day, to provide him with a better quality of life. They live together with her father-in-law. Her work consists of the repairing kitchen and laundry appliances, as well as selling spare parts for these. She works as a team with her partner. Previously she worked along in another field and his partner worked as the technical support for a parts store for appliances. But four months ago he left his employment to form this team with her and to start up this new business. Their clients provide them with good references on the work that they do, and for this reason they have demand for their services. What they like about their work is having time at their disposal and they generate considerable profits. They also help each other. She hopes to maintain the rhythm and their goal is to set up a store from where to attend their clients, while not letting go of the in-home service. This will be their twelfth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and it has gone very well until now. She hopes to keep working well as they have until now. She has always demonstrated to be a responsible person. She is thankful for the previous support she received as it help her improve her business. With the funds requested, she will purchase spare parts and tools they need to be more effective in delivering appliance repair services.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools.

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Phal, 42 years old, is a garment factory worker and earns about $3 per day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver earns about $4 per day. They have only one child, and he is 3 years old. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on rent, $15 on transportation and $13 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a Tok Tok (motorcycle) for her husband's career. Her husband wants to change his career of being a motor taxi driver to being a Tok Tok driver because it can make better income. She wants to quit working in the factory and wants to sell food and drinks in front her factory, because she saw that others can make a good income from selling food.

loans.use: To buy a Tok Tok for her husband's career.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en: Mira is a 39-year-old married woman with four children. She started her hog-raising business a year ago. Mira built a backyard piggery where she raises pigs. She also has a vegetable garden. Mira requested a loan to purchase piglets, feed and seeds. Mira hopes to expand her business in the future. She also wants to see her children succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and seeds

loans.name: Anda Yolanda

texts.es: Anda Yolanda tiene 56 años, tiene tres hijos mayores de edad. Ella es un ama de casa y al mismo tiempo se dedica a su negocio que es una pulpería.  Todos los días de la semana tiene arreglar los productos e ir al mercado para realizar las compras. Ella ofrece productos de primera necesidad como . Ella siempre está buscando la manera de mejorar cada día más. Es por eso que necesita este crédito para mejorar su inventario.
texts.en: Anda Yolanda, 56, has three adult children.  She is a homemaker and also runs a grocery store.  Every day of the week she goes to the market to do the shopping for her store.  She offers essential goods and is always looking for ways to improve her business.  She needs the loan to increase the store's inventory.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, sweets, softdrinks, bread, toilet tissue and soups.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a father of 4 between the ages of 13 and 9 years. He lives with his family in Kitale in Western Kenya where he has been carrying out farming for the last 7 years with his produce of maize, milk, eggs and beans supplied to the local market.

Robert has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy as well as insure a dairy cow. He says this will help him produce more milk for family consumption and earn more income from the milk sales to meet other family basic needs.

He laments of the shortage of animal feeds and water in the area during the dry season, which compels farmers to spend much due to high costs.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie is 47 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is married and has six children between the ages of 18 and 33, two of whom are in school and live at home.  Her husband is a  contractor, and for the past ten years she has been selling  body cream, washing  and bathing soap, and perfume.  She started her business with money from her husband and is proud that her business  provides for her needs.  Annie plans to use the proceeds of this loan to buy more body cream, perfume, washing and bathing soap as inventory for her business.

loans.use: to buy body cream, perfume, and soap for washing and bathing

loans.name: Naziran's Group

texts.en:
Naziran is 40 years old, married, and lives with her family: a husband and seven children. Three of her children work while the other four are being educated at a local school. 

Naziran’s days are focused on managing her household chores. She spends her time at home and takes care of her family. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs.

Her husband earns a living from his spare parts business. He has been in this business for over three years, and during this short time, he has developed a good reputation among his customers for his good products and respectful behavior.

With this loan, her husband will purchase spare parts for different vehicles to resell. Naziran is hopeful that her husband’s business will be better-established with this loan investment. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Naziran.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to resell.

loans.name: Galita

texts.es: Galita, de 47 años, es una mujer amable y muy solidaria, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene tres hijos quienes ya son mayores e independientes. Vive en una casa propia a lado de su pareja con quien comparte sus días trabajando mucho. EL trabajo de Galita consiste en la venta de abarrotes y otros productos en su tienda. Tiene un local acondicionado en su casa en donde acomoda sus productos a la vista de los clientes que van en busca de la variedad de cosas que ofrece. Empezó hace siete años y lo hace sola ya que se siente más cómoda de esta manera. Le agrada mucho lo que hace, pues se divierte y entretiene con sus clientes quienes al momento de ir a comprar se quedan a conversar e intercambian ideas, al principio tuvo algunas dificultades ya que no sabia muy como era el negocio, pero poco a poco fue aprendiendo y ahora tiene las pautas para poder hacer su trabajo sin ninguna dificultad y así complacer en todo lo que necesitan sus clientes. Desea poder ampliar su negocio y tener variedad de cosas para ofrecer, pero sabe que es un proceso largo y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. Este será el crédito número 2 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por su parte se compromete una vez más en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Esta muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus socios son personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará mercadería para su tienda ya que necesita tener algunos productos que siempre van a buscar por cantidades.
texts.en:
Galita is 47 years old.  She is a kind and very supportive woman.  She lives with her partner and the couple have three children who are grown up and live independently.  She lives in her own home, alongside her partner, and they spend their days together working hard.  Galita's work consists of selling groceries and other products in her store.  She has a well-equipped store in her home where she displays her products for her customers who come looking for the variety of products that she offers.  Galita started working seven years ago.  She works alone as she feels more comfortable doing this.  She really enjoys what she does as she enjoys herself and is able to spend time with her customers, chat and exchange ideas.  At first she experienced difficulties as she didn't understand the business very well.  However, she gradually learned and now she works with no difficulties.  She is able to satisfy her customers in every way they need.  She would like to expand her business and to have a variety of products to offer.  However, she knows that it is a long process and she is ready to take it on.  

This will be Galita's second loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can continue reaching her goals.  For her part, she once again pledges to make her repayments on time as she did with her previous loan. Galita is happy to belong to her community bank as they are all responsible and supportive people.

Galita will use her 1,500 soles to buy merchandise for her store as she needs some products that her customers come looking for in bulk.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products with which to stock her store

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
Nicolasa es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, tiene 61 años, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo, quien se dedica a la albañilería. Nicolasa es artesana, teje encaje jhu y ao po´i.
Cuenta que desde muy joven se dedica a este trabajo, lo cual aprendió de su mamá, por lo que ya tiene muy buena experiencia en esto. Dice que gracias al amor que le pone a su trabajo tiene buenos resultados por que le salen muy lindas las prendas y eso a la vez la ayuda a tener un buen ingreso. Hace 40 años que teje. Y ahora ella enseña a sus sobrinas e interesadas del lugar. Vende sus artesanías por las casas artesanales de Carapeguá y también recibe pedidos de Asunción.
Ella solicita la ayuda de la fundación y de Kiva para la compra de hilos, telas, colores y demás insumos necesarios para sus bordados. Agradece por esta oportunidad de progreso que se le está dando.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is from the city of Carapeguá.  She is 61 years old and a single mother.  She has a son who works in construction.  Nicolasa is an artisan.  She makes "jhu" lace and "ao po´i" [embroidered cotton cloth].

She says she has been doing this work from a very young age.  She learned it from her mother, so she already has very good experience with it.  She says that thanks to the love she puts into her work she has good results because her articles come out very pretty and this, in turn, helps her to have a good income.  She has been weaving for 40 years, and now she teaches her nieces and other interested girls in the area.  She sells her work through the artisan centers in Carapeguá and also gets orders from Asunción.

She is requesting help from the foundation and from Kiva to buy thread, fabric, dyes, and other supplies necessary to make her embroidery.  She is grateful for this opportunity to get ahead that is being given to her.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric, dyes, and other supplies.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
 
Teresita buys and peddles home products like blades in boxes, threads, needles, and pins. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of home products to sell.

Teresita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks for home products to sell

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La Señora Susana es una mujer joven de 33 años de edad que se encuentra casada desde hace 10 años con el señor Federico Ramírez Rafael, el cual es ayudante de albañil, es decir se dedica a la construcción de casas, juntos procrearon 3 hijos de las siguientes edades, uno de 9 años, otro de 8 años, y el más pequeño de ellos de 6 años, todos ellos se encuentran actualmente estudiando en la primaria.

Este es el quinto ciclo que la señora Susana entra a un préstamo y está conforme con los resultados que ha obtenido, en esta ocasión ella solicita el préstamo para invertirlo, la mitad en la compra de 3 borregos para cría y pastura; y la otra mitad para comprar: estambres, agujas, ganchos, etc. para la elaboración de manteles, chalecos, carpetas, sueteres y otros productos tejidos. Las borregas las criará en su casa es la primera vez que ella experimentará como criadora de ovejas, le llama la atención invertirlo en las ovejas ya que sabe que si las cuida las puede hacer engordar y posteriormente las puede vender. "Lo importante es invertir tu dinero en algo y cuando lo necesites vender tus bienes y así recuperas tu inversión" dice Susana.

En cuanto a los tejidos, ella lleva 2 años de experiencia, este es su negocio de éxito ya que dice que lo sabe hacer muy bien y que mejor que seguir poniéndolo en práctica, la forma en que ella elabora los tejidos es la siguiente: Con un gancho, "Como en toda actividad, el tejido también requiere de mucha paciencia y dedicación. El ganchillo es un método para tejer con lana o hilo, usando un ganchillo y un ovillo de lana. El ganchillo generalmente se sujeta en la mano derecha Incluso los zurdos pueden aprender a hacer ganchillo de este modo o también pueden invertir las instrucciones"
Para empezar haga un nudo corredizo (deslizado)
"Tira de la hebra de lana en el centro del ovillo. Se hace una lazada a una distancia de 12 a 15 cm del extremo, colocando dicho extremo delante del ovillo de lana y a continuación dejamos que el resto del extremo de lana caiga ligeramente por detrás de la lazada. Se introduce el ganchillo por la lazada. Se recoge la lana de detrás de la lazada con la punta del ganchillo. La pasamos a través de la parte delantera de la lazada. Con cuidado, tiramos del extremo de la lana para que quede la lazada tirante alrededor del ganchillo. Ya está el primer punto" dice Susana y de esta manera nos compartió sólo la forma de cómo iniciar un tejido, ya que como nos menciona para hacerlo se requiere gran paciencia, ella en un futuro espera seguir creciendo en su negocio ya que lo sabe hacer y lo quiere seguir poniendo en práctica, "Quiero seguir ayudando a mis hijos a estudiar y ayudar a mi esposo con los gastos" dice Susana.

Con las ganancias de su negocio a ella le gustaría mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Susana is a 33-year-old woman who has been married to Federico Ramírez Rafael for the last 10 years.  He’s a bricklayer’s assistant, that is to say, he works building houses.  They had three children together who are 9, 8 and 6 years old.  All of them are attending elementary school.

This is the fifth cycle Susana has taken a loan out in and she’s satisfied with the results she’s gotten.  On this occasion she’s asking for the loan to invest half of it in the purchase of three sheep to raise and put out to pasture and the other half to buy yarn, needles, hooks, etc. to make tablecloths, vests, mats, sweaters and other knitted items.  This is the first time she’s going to experiment with raising sheep at home.  She’s attracted to this because she knows that if she takes care of them and causes them to fatten up she can sell them later on.  “What’s important is to invest your money in something so that when you need to sell your assets you recover your investment,” says Susana.

With respect to the textiles, she has two years’ experience.  This is her successful business because she says that she knows how to do it very well and what better thing to do than to put it into practice.  The way she makes these textiles is the following:  With a knitting needle.  “Like any activity, knitting also requires much patience and dedication.  The “ganchillo” is a method for knitting with yarn or thread using a hook and a ball of yarn.  One usually holds the hook in the right hand but even left handed people can learn to use the hook by just inverting the instructions.”

To begin, make a slipknot.  “Pull on the thread of yarn in the center of the ball.  You pull a bow of about 12 to 15 centimeters from the end placing said end in front of the ball of yarn and then we let the rest of the end of the yarn to fall slightly behind the bow.  The hook is introduced through the bow.  The yarn is gathered behind the bow with the tip of the hook.  We pass it through the front of the bow.  Carefully we pull on the end of the yarn so that the bow is taught around the hook.  That’s the first purl,” says Susana.  She shared with us the way to knit because as she mentions to do so requires great patience.  

In the future she’d like to continue to grow in her business because she knows how to do it and wants to continue putting it into practice.  “I want to continue to help my children to go to school and to help my husband with expenses,” says Susana.  With profits from her business she’d like to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy sheep to raise and to buy embroidery supplies.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy, 60, is married and has three dependent children, one of whom is studying in a university. She lives in Kampong Thom province, where she has been growing rice and cashew for main source of income for 42 years. Sometimes, Thy works for others for a fee to supplement income. Her farming business is threatened by pest and drought.
Thy now is requesting a loan from VisionFund to pay for tuition fees for her son. She hopes that this loan will enable her son to study Bachelor of Management and to have good job for his living.

loans.use: To pay for tuition fees for her son to study Bachelor of Management.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Prasat Balang district

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
This business is a member of the Virtuous Women Group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff

Margaret is a single lady with two children. She has educated them up to secondary school. Though they have not gotten formal jobs. She has assisted them get into the Jua Kali (informal) sector where they work as Mechanics.

Margaret has been in the Jua Kali sector for the last 15 years. Her experience has made her to be very keen in studying the market trends. She therefore engages in goods that are on high demand. Currently she is engaged in selling Pishori rice. She takes her orders from retail shops, households, festivities like weddings. She joined WEEC programme in 2005. She got a loan of USD 139 and bought more stock. She paid her loan in 10 months.

loans.use: Given a loan of USD 300 she will be able to add to her stock. This will enable her supply the Pishori rice to the adjacent Langata area where she has started getting orders from.

loans.name: Ana Berta

texts.en:
My name is Ana Berta, and I hope to start a home business in the sale of Tigo y Claro cellular phone calling cards. This work and its generated revenue will allow me to attend to my family and contribute to their expenses while also offering education and greater opportunities to my children.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Ana Berta, cuento con un negocio de venta de Tarjetas para celulares Tigo y Claro, ubicado en mi casa de habitación, actividad que me permite atender a mi familia y que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia, de esa forma podemos ofrecer educación a mis hijos logrando asi mejores oportunidades para ellos.

loans.use: To purchase Tigo y Claro phone cards of different denominations.

loans.name: Khamid

texts.en:
When Khamid started his business, he traded in the Istaravshan clothing market. He had a small assortment of clothing and earned about $100 per month. Khamid wanted to expand his assortment of goods, increase his sales, and improve his business conditions.

To expand his assortment of goods and improve his working conditions, he needed funds. Starting in November 2003, he became a client of MicroInvest. Khamid's first loan was $100. He started to increase his credit, expand his assortment, increase the turnover of goods, and hire a saleswoman. By now, he has enough capital to make trips to the wholesale market himself. He would like to use the next loan for the trip to Karasuu (Uzbekistan) for goods. With the development of his business, Khamid was able to increase his contribution to the family expenses and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: Trip for goods

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
Mariana is married and has four daughters, two of whom are married and two who are still in school. Her husband works in a tortilla factory, but his income is not sufficient to cover all family expenses. Mariana and her family live with her in-laws, who have run a convenience store for a long time. They had decided to close the store because of their advanced age, but to earn extra income Mariana decided to take control of it, and in this way she has been able to help her husband with expenses without neglecting her daughters.

The family unit has been an important piece in developing this business. Thanks to the help of her daughters, Mariana has been able to keep moving the store forward. Now, to keep the business growing, Mariana is requesting a loan of $250 that she will use to purchase supplies to keep her store well stocked and offer her customers a quality service. You can help contribute to the well being of this family. Mariana and her family are grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Mariana es casada y tiene cuatro hijas, dos de ellas están casadas y dos aún estudian, su esposo trabaja en una tortillería pero el ingreso que obtiene no es suficiente para solventar todos los gastos familiares, Mariana y su familia viven en casa de sus suegros, ellos tenían una tienda de abarrotes desde hace mucho tiempo, y estaban decididos a cerrar porque su edad avanzada les impedía continuar con el negocio, pero para obtener un ingreso extra Mariana decidió hacerse cargo de la tienda, de esta manera podía ayudar a su esposo con los gastos sin descuidar a sus hijas.

La unión familiar a sido una pieza clave en del desarrollo de este negocio, gracias a la ayuda de sus hijas han logrado salir adelante. Ahora para continuar creciendo Mariana necesita un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para tener bien surtida su tienda y ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes. Tú puedes contribuir al bienestar de esta familia, no lo pienses más y decídete a ayudarlas, ellas te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for convenience store

loans.name: Noung

texts.en:
Mrs. Noung P. is a married 36 year old mother of three schoolgoing children. She runs a store selling grocery products and meat (pork and fish) in her community. Her store enables her to earn about $5 a day. Her husband (pictured here) works as a motor-taxi driver and also earns approximately $5 each day.

Mrs. Noung P. is requesting a $500 loan to increase her inventory by adding more grocery items and meat, which she hopes will help her increase her earnings.

loans.use: To increase her inventory by adding more grocery items.

loans.name: Máxima Pérez

texts.en: Máxima, is 27 years old, with two daughters and a boy. Her husband is a topographer and is working in Yamasá . Máxima and her husband have to work a lot to provide their children with a good education. She earns some money, selling clothes, curtains, tablecloths, and so forth. Currently she has a well established clientele, which continues to grow. The requested loan is to purchase more clothes to sell during the holiday season. This will increase this entrepreneur´s sales volume and will allow her to help her husband face the housing issues. Máxima also wants to set aside money to go back to her languages classes at the University at Santo Domingo next year.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for her business to increase her income, and set aside money to go back to the university.

loans.name: Zenayda

texts.es:
Zenayda has been working for 7 years selling dairy products such as cottage cheese, creme, milk, buying them directly from the small producers who travel from the country to the city to sell their products. She began her business thanks to the first loan she received, equal to about $36. Starting with a small stand outside the Terminal market in the city of Leon. She lacks a good infrastructure in her business and part of the loan she is requesting is to make needed repairs to keep out the rain.

She takes care of 4 children and is a single mother. Life has been hard for Zenayda, but with perseverance and love for her children, she has managed to improve the quality of their lives, working hard to make sure the house had food and her children could go to school. She has received ten short term loans which have helped her a lot, growing her profits and allowing her to invest more in the business, ensuring her customers of the quality of the products she offers.

Doña Zenayda ha trabajado desde hace 7 años vendiendo productos lacteos como Cuajada, crema, leche, y esto lo compra directamente a los pequeños productores que viajan del campo a la ciudad a vender este producto. Recuerda que el negocio lo comenzó gracias a un primer préstamo que hizo por la cantidad de 700 córdobas ( equivalente a 36 dólares). Empezó en un puesto fijo al aire libre fuera del mercado La Terminal en la ciudad de León. Ella carece de una buena infraestructura en su negocio y parte de este crédito lo solicita para poder mejorar sus condiciones porque cuando llueve, el agua se mete en su negocio, cuando hay mucho son tambien.

Tiene 4 hijos a su cargo y es madre soltera, la vida ha sido muy dura con ella pero con la perseverancia y el amor a sus hijos ha logrado salir adelante, trabajando fuertemente para que en su casa no le falte alimento y a sus hijos no les falte educación. Actualmente lleva trabajando con 10 créditos a corto plao y esto ha sido para ella de mucho beneficio, mucha utilidad porque las ganancias son mucho mejores, pues invierte un poquito mas en el negocio y esto le permite darle seguridad a sus clientes ya que la leche y otros productos lacteos son de calidad.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE DAIRY PRODUCTS AND GROW HER BUSINESS, ENABLING HER TO CONTINUE TO CARE FOR HER 4 CHILDREN AS A SINGLE MOTHER.

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en:
Christine N. has a bakery and also sells second hand clothes. She is 40 years old and a single mother who looks after her 6 children as well as her brother’s children. She has applied for a loan with BRAC Uganda in order to increase her inventory and baking supplies so that she can make more profits and improve her family life.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Total 2087(A) Group

texts.en:
Robinah is 35 years old married with four children. She owns a beauty salon. With the extra business profits she earns, she intends to buy a piece of land and build a house. Hajara has a charcoal selling business. Mary sells second-hand clothes. Bena has a retail shop. Teopista sells raw foods.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more salon items.

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en: B. Ramiz is a 38-year-old farmer who sells milk and yoghurt to the local bazaar traders in the small village of Saatli. He started his business in 2004 when he purchased his first cow. As dairy products are in very high demand in Azerbaijan, Ramiz applied for 1200 USD to purchase two additional cows for an estimated cost 600 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase two additional cows

loans.name: Martha Coyle

texts.es:
Martha Coyle R. G. is a member of the Banco Comunal “Picota”. She lives in San Martín, Picota province, Picota district. Her main activity is selling food, as well as fizzy drinks and offering a photocopying service, all of which takes place in her home located on Jr: Simón Bolívar Nº 660. She is actually a teacher, she has reported that the people who visit the area cannot find somewhere to have their food, and so she decided to share her time between teaching and preparing and selling food. Now that she is retired, she dedicares all her time to the latter. With the loan of S/ 1200.00, which she will repay within 6 months, she will invest in buying supplies to make a variety of different dishes to sell and fizzy drinks in different flavours and sizes. Martha, 57 years old, only achieved what she has thanks to her charisma, and sense of happiness.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Martha Coyle R. G., es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal “Picota”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia del Picota y distrito de Picota, su actividad principal es la venta de comida diaria tipo menu, además vende bebidas gaseosas, y brinda servicio de fotocopiados, todos estos instalados en su misma casa ubicada domiciliada en el Jr: Simón Bolívar Nº 660. Ella tiene la profesión de profesora ,se dio cuenta que las personas que visitaban la localidad no encontraban un establecimiento donde tomar sus alimentos, decidido compartir sus tareas de maestra con la preparación y venta de comida , hoy siendo ya jubilada se dedica por completo a este negocio. Con el préstamo de S/. 1200.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses ,lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de los variados platos de comida que ofrece y bebidas gaseosas en variados sabores y tamaños Martha, con 57 años, sola supo lograr lo que se propuso, con el carisma que siempre la caracteriza se siente feliz

loans.use: To purchase supplies to prepare food to sell

loans.name: Lower Nyamboyo Women's Group

texts.en:
Ezekiel started his matatu (public service vehicle) transport business seven years ago with a second-hand vehicle. Through hard work and determination, Ezekiel is able to feed, clothe, and educate his family of two wives and eight children.

Ezekiel operates his business along the Kisumu – Busia highway and is currently planning to buy another second-hand matatu (public service vehicle) to diversify his business. With the help of his loan, Ezekiel will also be able to buy public service vehicle spare parts which he hopes to sell to generate more income for his family. His long-term business vision is to own a fleet of many public service vehicles.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase matatu (public service vehicle) spare parts

loans.name: Khelcom 2 B Group

texts.fr:
We are the second GIE Khelcom group and we would like to request a loan from Kiva that will be used to construct a building to house a cybercafe in our village. Our ecovillage is located in an area frequented by tourists who all go to a town very far from our ecovillage to connect to the internet. The same thing happens with the young people in our village who also go to the town looking for internet connections. Since there is great demand for the internet, we would like to ask for your help in creating a cybercafé in the village which would fill our current gap in information technology. Ever since our village got connected to the telephone network and wired for electricity, we have been looking to open a cybercafé, not only in order to create jobs, but to help our locality develop by allowing the populace access to information via modern communication technology.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Nous sommes le deuxième groupe du GIE Khelcom et nous venons solliciter un Prêt auprès de Kiva pour la constructiond'un bâtiment qui doit faire usage de cybercafé dans notre village. Notre écovillage se trouve dans une zone touristique qui voit toutes les personnes qui y viennent se rendre dans une ville très éloignée de notre écovillage pour se connecter à Internet. c'est la même situation qui se répète pour les jeunes du village qui empruntent la même voie pour avoir accès à une connection. La demande étant très forte à ce sujet, nous venons solliciter votre appui afin que nous puissions créer un cybercafé dans le village et permettant ainsi de combler le gap numérique qui existait dans les environs. Depuis que notre village est connecté aux réseaux électrique et téléphonique, nous oeuvrons dans le sens de créer un cybercafé pour non seulement créer des emplois, mais participer aussi au développement de notre localité en aidant les populations à avoir accès à l'information avec les nouvelles technologies de comunication modernes.

loans.use:
Construction of a building in which to create a cybercafe

Construction d'un bâtiment pour création de cybercafé

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan, 40 years old, married with three children, lives in Saida South, Lebanon, where he owns a microentreprise that sells electricA. accessories, assembles and repairs electric batteries, and sells and installs AC split units. He has been a client of A. Majmoua for the past three years. Hassan now needs a loan $1,200 to sustain the livelihood of his economically and socially vulnerable sister. Hassan is trying to help her open a small business that would provide an income sufficient to ensure her an acceptable living.

loans.use: To sustain the livelihood of his economically and socially vulnerable sister.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase stock of materials and sewing machine

loans.name: Salama's Nia Njema Group

texts.en:
Salama is 38 years old. She is married with 6 children, aged 6 to 22 years old. She became a food seller in 2006. Every day, she works from 6am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Salama now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Huzuni, Farashuu, Aibu and Hawa.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.fr: Enyonam A. est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est revendeuse, de céréales, depuis plus de 8 ans, à Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise.  Cette activité demeure sa principale source de revenus, et Enyonam désire par ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV, accroître la capacité de son commerce en achetant des sacs de maïs, de mil, de haricots et d’arachides pour la revente. Elle espère améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille avec cette opportunité
texts.en:
Enyonam A. is a 42 year old married mother of five children. She has worked as a grain retailer for more than 8 years in Kpalimé, a city located approximately 120 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. This business is her main source of income and with her second FECECAV loan Enyonam wishes to grow her business capacity by purchasing bags of corn, millet, beans and peanuts for resale. With this opportunity she hopes to improve the quality of life of her family.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of bags of corn, millet, beans and peanuts

loans.name: Sevda

texts.en:
Sevda F. is 36 years old and married with four children. Her children study at school. Sevda's husband is currently unemployed and that is why she is the main breadwinner in the family. For last five years, Sevda has been breeding cattle. Currently, she is breeding two cows. Her son helps her and her husband sells the meat of the cattle in the market.

This family business brings a stable income for the family of Sevda. The main activities are selling calves and dairy products, such as milk and yoghurt. Sevda is planning to expand her business and to purchase two calves and one cow. For this reason, she requests 1200 USD. Being very accurate by her nature, Sevda promises to pay the loan timely and precisely. She expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her.

loans.use: To purchase two calves and one cow

loans.name: Lan

texts.vi: Chị Ngô Thị Lan năm nay 52 tuổi, gia đình chị có 3 con đèu đã trưởng thành. Hiện nay chị Lan đang bán hàng ăn sáng tại chợ còn chồng chị cho thuê bàn ghế phục vụ đám cưới. Với tổng thu nhập đạt 2.000.000đ/ tháng cuộc sống của hai vợ chồng chị khá ổn định. Vòngvốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9 triệu dồng, một phần chị đầu tư thêm vốn vào mua thêm thực phẩm phục vụ việc kinh doanh hàng ăn sáng, phần còn lại chị đầu tư mua thêm bàn ghế phụcvụ cho công việc kinh doanh của chồng.
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Lan is 52 yrs old and has 3 grown children. Currently she sells breakfast food at the market, while her husband rents furniture for wedding parties. With a combined income of 122 USD per month, their family life is stable. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 550 USD with 1/4 of the loan to purchase additional food items to serve in her restaurant, and the remainder of the loan to buy more chairs and tables to use in her husband's business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Ufuoma

texts.en: Ufuoma O. is a hairstylist. She also sews and sells clothes. She stated her business in 2004. Ufuoma is 37 years old and married with 3 children. With the festive season fast approaching, the demands for her clothes will increase. Ufuoma needs the loan amount of $700 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support and to LAPO MICROFINANCE for their business training.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: Adolfo es padre soltero, vive con su único hijo que estudia y es su fuerza de seguir trabajando. El se dedica a brindar servicio de mecánica y reparación de motos y motocarros, este trabajo lo viene realizando desde hace ya 10 años atrás, y le va muy bien, ya que su taller se encuentra ubicado en un buen lugar. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que sus clientes siempre se queden satisfechos de su buena labor, además, le proporciona buenas ganancias que le permiten solventar sus gastos en el hogar y los estudios de su hijo. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se encuentra comprometido en ser puntual y responsable. Con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a ampliar su taller de mecánica, y así poder recibir más vehículo para reparación.
texts.en:
Adolfo is a single father and lives with his only child, who is currently studying. Adolfo strongly desires to continue working. Adolfo works as an auto-mechanic, repairing motorbikes and motocarros (small three-wheeled vehicles often used for deliveries). He has worked as a mechanic for ten years and his business is very successful as his workshop is very well located. What he enjoys most about his work is that his customers are always satisfied with his repairs, and that it offers a good income which allows him to cover his living expenses and the cost of his son's studies. This is his first loan with MFP, and he is committed to repaying the loan punctually and responsibly. He will use the loan to expand his workshop, which will allow him to receive more vehicles for repair.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand his auto-repair workshop

loans.name: Koem

texts.en: Koem L., 43, is a widow living in the Kampong Cham province with her two children. One child is at home and one is in school. She has had a business selling noodles and porridge in the village since 1999 to earn a living and is able to make US$ 10 in revenue each day. L. is asking for a loan of US$ 800 to purchase utensils and reinvest in her business to attract more customers.

loans.use: To purchase utensils

loans.name: Rous

texts.en: Rous T., 46, of Siem Reap, Cambodia, stays at home doing housework and cooking for the family members while her husband is employed as a construction worker at Angkor Wat Temple, earning $130 every month, a little more than $4 a day. They have four children, one employed in construction, another as a security guard, and two who are students.  Rous would like to take out a loan of $500 to repair her leaky roof, which is very troublesome during the rainy season.

loans.use: To repair her leaky roof.

loans.name: Minavar

texts.en:
S. Minavar is a 52-year-old widow. She has a son from her marriage. Minavar works cultivating a small farm, which she has done for more than 20 years. She grows different types of vegetables such as potatoes, tomatoes and cucumbers. Every day she gets up very early. At 5 AM, Minavar drives to the produce market in the capital to sell her products, while her son takes care of the daily work on the farm.

Minavar is very proud of the work they've done together, she and her beloved son, and grateful that they've been able to acquire the comforts they have in their home. They have made good use of the loans since today it's very difficult without the extra help. Minavar is applying for a loan through IMON International for the fourth time. The loan will be used to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticide that they need for their business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.
