But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Khy

texts.en:
Khy S., 37, is a villager living in Phnom Penh City. She is the mother of three children who go to the local school.

Her husband, Noeun, is 37 year old, who works as a local building worker for a company. She makes a living selling Khmer noodle in the small store front of her home. She can generate a daily income of $4 to support her family. Most of her clients are neighbors who living near her house.

To make extra income, Khy is applying for an $800 loan to purchase a trailer-motor, so she can transport vegetables to sell at the market. With the extra income, they will attain a higher standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase a trailer-motor.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
Herminia es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras.
Herminia es casada, tiene 50 años y 4 hijos, Herminia venD. carne D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad, los animales los compra en las feria y luego los beneficia en el camal D. la ciudad.
Herminia necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. animales.
Los sueños D. Herminia son construir su casa y tener capital propio.
texts.en:
Herminia is a member of the Alondras Community Bank. She is 50 years old, married, and has 4 children. Herminia sells meat as a traveling vendor in the market in her city. She buys the animals at an animal market and then takes them to the slaughterhouse. Herminia needs a loan of 2000 soles that she will invest in the purchase of more animals. Herminia dreams of building her own home and having her own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: animals

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 42-year-old married man with three children and lives in Shwaifat, Mount Lebanon. He has owned his own business since 1984 when he first started waxing tiles and painting houses. Now, Hussein is requesting to borrow $800 USD to purchase the necessary equipment for his upcoming project.

loans.use: To purchase equipment

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es: Ana Rosa H. D. H. D. 49 años D. edad resiD. en Colón departamento D. La Libertad, vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como mecánico y no tiene hijos. Ana Rosa posee un comedor en la terminal D. buses, en el cual venD. tortillas bebidas, y comida, ella solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más jugos y sodas, así también más pan, D. manera que pueda surtir su negocio y tener mucho más que ofrecer a sus clientes, esperando obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana Rosa Hernandez Hernandez is 49 years old and resides in the state of Colon D. la libertad. She lives with her husband who works as a mechanic and has no children. Ana Rosa has a dining business in the bus station, where she sells tortillas drinks and food. She is asking for a loan in order to buy more juices, sodas, and bread, so she can have much more to offer to her customers and obtain higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perishable goods

loans.name: Nur Hasanah

texts.en:
Nur Hasanah (DNR.M-0684) is a 40-year-old woman who lives in the town of Ds. Sumberkima, in Buleleng, Bali, Indonesia. She is married and has two school-aged children. To making a living, Nur Hasanah owns and operates a handicraft business where she sells traditional handicrafts to tourists and the local community. Nur Hasanah has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 200,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2009, Nur Hasanah joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nur Hasanah is now requesting a new loan of 3,400,000 IDR which will be used to purchase additional inventory. This will be Nur Hasanah's first loan from DINARI. Nur Hasanah plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Nur Hasanah - (DNR.M-0684) merupakan 40 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Ds. Sumberkima - Buleleng. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Nur Hasanah memiliki and menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor seni. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah mengoperasikan usaha kerajinan. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menjual kerajinan tradisional kepada wisatawan dan anggota masyarakat setempat. Nur Hasanah sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 10 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Nur Hasanah menghasilkan sekitar 200,000 IDR sebulan. Dalam 2009, Nur Hasanah bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Nur Hasanah telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 3,400,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli inventaris and modal kerja tambahan. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Nur Hasanah berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam. Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil. *Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi and menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu and akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Armie

texts.en: Armie G. is from the town of Sinian, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. Armie owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising chickens for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over thirteen years and earns approximately 3,000.00 PHP a month. In 2007, Armie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000.00 PHP from PMPC. Armie is requesting a new loan of 3,000.00 PHP which will be used as capital for her rice production. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To be used as capital for her rice production

loans.name: Svay

texts.en: Svay T. has been a local cultivator for 50 years, planting different kinds of crop to earn a living. She also grows rice, vegetables, and some fruit crops, which she can plant 3 or 4 times a year with two seasons, the rainy season and the dry season. To help be responsible for her family’s living needs, her husband also works in construction. Svay T. has now been blessed with two school-age children. Because Svay T. depends on doing farming, she is looking for a loan to purchase a plot of a neighbor’s farmland in order to grow even more various crops on it.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of neighbor’s farmland

loans.name: Kareem

texts.en:
Kareem lives in Lagos and she sells drinks and provisions from her home. Kareem has been in this business for the past six years and she has been borrowing from LAPO for the past two years. She is 34 years old and married with five children. Kareem is very optimistic about the prosperity of her family and her business growth. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell. 
She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: La señora Adela Ramírez de 33 años de edad, casada y con cinco hijos que procreo todos estudian, reside en el barrio Isaías Gomez en la capital de Managua,  su negocio es la venta de abarrote en donde vende una variedad de productos, antes se dedicaba ala venta de fritanga. Sus planes es poder poner una venta surtida de productos en su casa, entre poder dar estudios  a sus hijos para que tengan una buena educación. Con este préstamo comprara granos básicos, canela, achotes, manzanillas entre otros productos para ofertar a sus clientes. Da las gracias Afodenic por la oportunidad de los prestamos lo cual han sido de mucho beneficios para mejoras a su negocio como para su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Adela Ramírez is 33 years old, married, and has 5 children who are all students. She lives in the neighborhood of Isaías Gomez in the capital city of Managua. Sra. Adela operates a grocery store where she sells a variety of products. Previously she sold fried foods. Her plans include putting a fully stocked store in her home. This will enable her to pay for her children to have a good education.

With this loan, she will purchase basic grains, cinnamon, annatto, chamomile, and other products to offer to her customers. She thanks AFODENIC for providing the opportunity to borrow and the many benefits that have improved her business as well as her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, cinnamon, annatto, chamomile, and other products

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr: Yao D. est un jeune homme âgé de 31 ans marié et père d’un enfant. Il est électricien à Lomé, quartier awatame. Il fait  son deuxième crédit à FECECAV. Avec ce crédit il voudrait acheter certains outils de travail afin de  pouvoir travailler en toute quiétude.  Il espère que ce crédit lui permettra d’augmenter ses bénéfices. Avec ces bénéfices, il veut  assurer le bien-être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yao D. is a young man who is 31 years old, married, and the father of one child. He is an electrician in the Awatame district of Lome. This is his second loan through FECECAV (Kiva Field Partner). With this loan he would like to purchase tools so that he will be able to work comfortably. He hopes that this loan will translate into greater earnings. With his improved earnings he wants to provide for the well-being of his family.

Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a battery and a charger.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie A. is from the simple village of Bolinao Aurora, Isabela. Tessie is engaged in vegetable production and sells their produce in the market and in nearby villages at a lower price, using their motorcycle. Her husband serves as the driver and she is glad that they can earn good income for their family.

They have been doing the business for 12 years. She is now 47 years old and they are blessed with three children, of whom two are already studying. Because she wants their business to become more productive for the welfare of their children, Tessie wants to take out a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 10,000 as additional business capital. She hopes to purchase enough supply of farm inputs needed in the maintenance of their vegetable farm and also pay for the maintenance of their motorcycle.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en:
Miss. Vuthy S., age 30, is single and has three brothers and a sister. She lives with her parents on an island in Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Vuthy has been a silk weaver since she was 13 years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in the Phnom Penh market or other places. Vuthy is asking for a loan of $200 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
"The ultimate goal of every couple is to build a happy family having all their needs met so they can enjoy the essence of life," said Violeta.  She and her husband are doing their best to meet their needs and give their children a better future.  

Farming is their main source of income. They plant rice and vegetables twice in a year. Furthermore,  Violeta engages in retailing rice in their village to earn additional income since harvest time takes a long time. She is requesting for $175 a loan from the KIVA lenders to purchase rice for re-selling in the Solano public market. She needs to earn more income to finance the education of her children. Their schooling costs more now that they are in higher levels of learning. She hopes that with patience and sacrifices, she will improve her small business and give their children a better future.

loans.use: To purchase more rice for re-selling

loans.name: Soeu

texts.en: Soeu L., 41 years old, is a married mother caring for three kids who are students in the local public school. For years, Soeu L. and her husband have owned a handicraft business, which they run, from their home. They produce rattan baskets for sale. They also sell their products in bulk to middlemen who then take them to retail at the market. The demand for their craft is so high, almost all of their customers need to wait a few weeks before they can meet the orders. This couple can make about $5 of income per day. Besides the current work, the family has also always cultivated a rice crop. Soeu L. is applying for a loan to buy a cow in order to aid her farming business.

loans.use: To buy a cow in order to aid her farming business.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
El señor Leonardo L. tiene ya más de dos años dedicándose a la venta de elotes preparados.
Al negocio le está haciendo falta mejorar el equipo de trabaja que el actual y no esta en buenas condiciones. 
Pero en este momento no cuenta con el capital necesario para poder arreglar los equipos de trabajo, ya que tiene dos carritos, uno lo trabaja en diferentes partes de la ciudad y el otro su esposa la señora Irma Santiago, en otra partes de la ciudad, estos son los ingresos que obtiene para sus tres hijo a quienes les quieren dar lo mejor.
Es por eso que están solicitando el préstamo, desean dar una buena presentación a sus clientes al consumir sus deliciosos elotes calientitos.
texts.en:
Leonardo L. has dedicated himself to selling cooked corncobs for more than two years. His business needs some better equipment, as what he is currently using is not in good condition. However, he does not have the capital necessary to make repairs to his equipment. He has two little carts, one of which he uses throughout different parts of the city. The other is used by his wife, Irma Santiago, in other sections of the city. This is how he generates income to support his three children, for whom he wants to provide all the best. He is requesting a loan so he can give a better quality of service to his customers, who consume his delicious hot corn.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve his work equipment.

loans.name: Kanoni Tweyambe Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
A. Annet is 28 years old and married with six children aged 11 – 1. She is a sociable and hard-working lady with a business in agriculture, a tea plantation in Kanoni cell for 7 years. Annet says that she is successful because of the location of her business and customer care, and she works hard to become well-off, to educate her children as well as expand further in business.

Annet needs a loan to be able to rehabilitate her tea plantation for expansion. She is the leader of her lending group in Kihihi.

loans.use: Rehabilitating her tea plantation for improved output

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed began a business in 2008 selling mobile phones and mobile phone accessories. He has a shop near the city of Ramallah in Palestine. He requests a loan to enable him to procure an increased stock of mobile phones and accessories for sale. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his savings and to expand his business.

Mohammed is 25 years old and unmarried, and he works hard to provide for himself and his parents.

loans.use: To increase his stock of mobile phones and accessories for sale

loans.name: Jose Benjamin

texts.es:
El señor José Benjamín A. S., se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como cultivo de frijol y maíz, razón para la cual utiliza este financiamiento. para comprar insumos ( 2 quintales de abono, herbicidas, y mano de obra para preparación del suelo y siembra de frijol de riego), este cliente comenzó cultivando granos básicos como frijol y maíz únicamente en épocas de invierno y ahora lo hace con sistema de riego, este trabajo lo hacía con ayuda de un hijo el mayor  de sus 5 hijos que él tiene los otros 4 hijos son menores de edad pero si ayudan por ejemplo la madre cocina en casa y los hijos menores llevan la comida al campo o lugar de trabajo, este cliente todo el tiempo se ha dedicado a esta actividad de trabajo y actualmente continua haciéndolo sembrando frijol y maíz semitecnificado, con esto el espera seguir mejorando su actividad de trabajo y poder llegar a producir más y mejor algo que le ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos permitiéndole alcanzar un mejor nivel de vida más digna.
Don José Benjamín A. S. es casado, tiene 5 hijos dos están en la escuela únicamente, su esposa trabaja en su casa encargándose de hacer los oficios  de su hogar como es cuidar de hijos menores preparar alimentos para los que van a trabajar al campo y los demos miembros del hogar, don José ha tenido 8 créditos  desde el año 2005 lleva 5 años de trabajar con Ceprodel.
El impacto y beneficios que ha tenido con los financiamientos  es bastante importante ya que le permitieron mejorar sus actividades de trabajo lo que le han dado como resultado tener e ir mejorando su nivel de vida teniendo mejores ingresos lo que le ha permitido que sus hijos puedan estudiar y tener mayores oportunidades en sus vidas.
texts.en:
José Benjamín A. S. farms beans and corn. He will use this funding to buy supplies [2 quintales (weight measure equivalent to 46 kilos) of natural fertilizer, herbicides, and labor costs to prepare his fields for planting beans]. He began planting beans and corn only in the Winter season but now, he has an irrigation system. The eldest of his 5 sons helps him with his work; his other 4 children are all minors but they also help out; for example, they help their mother in the kitchen and the youngest children help out by taking lunch out to the fields or other work locations. This client has always been a farmer and he still continues to grow beans and corn though now with some degree of technical assistance. He hopes to continue to improve his work and produce more and better crops so that his income will increase thereby attaining a better quality of life. José Benjamín A. S. is married and has 5 children, two of whom are full-time students. His wife is a housewife taking care of household chores like caring for the younger children, preparing meals for those that will go work the fields and for the other family members. José has had 8 previous loans since 2005 and has cooperated with Ceprodel for 5 years. The impact and benefit of these loans has been quite important in that they permitted him to improve his field activities resulting in an improved economic level which, in turn, has allowed for his children to go to school and have still better opportunities in their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies: 2 quintales (weight measure equivalent to 46 kilos) of natural fertilizer, herbicides, and for labor costs to prepare his lands for planting.

loans.name: Ortencia

texts.es:
Ortencia, de 39 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Manuel (40) y sus tres hijos Rosmery (14), Lisbeth (11) y Renzo (1).
Esta emprendedora mujer tiene muchas ganas de trabajar y progresar. Se dedica desde hace 7 años a la crianza de animales de corral como pollos, codornices, patos y conejos, los que comercializa a los comerciantes del mercado de su localidad. El negocio es muy rentable, ya que sus animales se reproducen rápido por la buena crianza y alimentación que les brinda, por lo cual  obtiene muy buenas ganancias, las cuales que le alcanzan para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. 
A su vez, a Ortencia le gusta mucho esta actividad porque le va muy bien, además tiene muchos planes en mente para progresar, ya que quiere brindar a sus hijos una buena educación y mejor calidad de vida. Como le sobran las ganas para salir adelante, a base de esfuerzo, tiene pensado para el futuro sembrar verduras y empezar con la actividad agrícola.

Este es el 13avo préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser puntual, como siempre lo hizo, en el pago de sus cuotas. Además quiere seguir sacando préstamos con esta institución porque dice que desde el principio confió en ella y le ayudó a progresar.
El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de gran cantidad de alimento para sus animales, y así seguir con la crianza exitosa de éstos. También destinará otra parte del dinero para dar la cuota inicial del terreno donde empezará a sembrar.
texts.en:
Ortencia, 39, lives in her own home along with her husband Manuel (40) and their three children Rosmery (14), Lisbeth (11) and Renzo (1). She is an enterprising woman who has a strong desire to work and get ahead. For 7 years she has been raising barnyard animals such as chicken, quail, ducks and rabbits, which she sells to the market traders in her area. This business is very profitable, since her animals reproduce rapidly due to the good quality of care and feed that she provides them. She gets very good earnings, which allow her to help her husband with the household expenses. Ortencia likes this work very much because it is going very well. In addition, she has many plans in mind to develop, since she wants to provide her children with a good education and a better quality of life. As she continues to have a desire to advance, through effort, she is thinking in the future of planting vegetables and starting up with agricultural activities. This is her 13th loan with MFP, and she is committed to be punctual, as she has always been, in her payments. In addition, she wants to continue taking loans from this institution because she says that from the start they trusted her and helped her to advance. The money that she requests now will be used to buy a large quantity of feed for her animals, so that she can continue to be successful with them. In addition, another part of the money will be used to make a down payment on some land where she will begin to cultivate.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals

loans.name: Y

texts.en:
Mrs.Y U. is 38 years old, married, and lives in Trapeang Snao village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare field to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Heng Nget is a construction worker. Together, they make a small income to support their family.  

Mrs. Y U. is requesting a  2,000,000 from AMK to buy two oxen to help with farming the crops. The couple has four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other three attend the local school. Her husband is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To buy two oxen to help with the farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Maria Eva

texts.es:
La Señora Maria Eva M. tiene un negocio de venta de comida en el mercado Santa Ana ubicado en el sector comida, tiene de vender 20 años  anteriormente era ayudante de su mamá pero decidio ahorrar para vender ella su producto ella vende lo que es sopa vende diario de lunes a domingo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde, es madre de dos hijos en edad escolar se siempre se ha esforzado por sacarlos adelante ya que es madre soltera.
Tiene año y medio de trabajar con ceprodel y sus creditos le han servido bastante tanto en el negocio como en el hogar
texts.en:
María Eva M. sells food in the food court of Santa Ana market. She has been in this line of work for 20 years; she used to be her mother's assistant but she decided to save up so that she could sell her own products. She sells soup every day from Monday through Sunday from 8am until 2pm. She has two, school-aged children and she is always seeking ways to move them ahead in life because she's a single mother. She has collaborated with Ceprodel for a year and a half and the loans have been of much help to her both at her business and in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita M. is from the village of Culpan. She is 43 years-old and married with six adult children. To make a living, Conchita owns and operates a "sari-sari" (general) store.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Conchita has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for this activity.

In 2009, Conchita joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Conchita has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Conchita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Conchita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Melodia

texts.en:
Mrs. Melodia S. is from Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children. To make living, she operates her piggery and her husband is a teacher at Zamboanga del Sur Maritime Institute of Technology in Pagadian city. She has operated her business for more than 1 year and approximately earning 4000 a month.

Melodia joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to engage in other business activities.This is her 1st cycle of availing loans from PMPC and this loan is for the expansion of her piggery. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Towards additional capital for her piggery.

loans.name: Marcelline

texts.fr: T. Marcelline est née le 10 Mars 1979 et est mariée à BALOGOUN Christophe, un instituteur. Marcelline a deux enfants dont un est scolarisé. Marcelline vit avec sa famille au quartier Tokplégbé à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Il y a environs sept ans que Marcelline s'est installée dans ce quartier. Marcelline vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges familiales. Marcelline n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Marcelline vend de la farine de blé et de l'huile d'arachide à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Marcelline vend du charbon de bois en détail. Marcelline s'approvisionne à Savè, dans le département des Collines au Bénin. Marcelline a déjà obtenu une fois de prêt à ALIDé et a bien effectué le remboursement. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle, Marcelline sollicite un deuxième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Ms. T. Marcelline was born on March 10, 1979 and is married to Mr. BALOGOUN Christophe, a grade school teacher.  She has two children, of whom one is in school.  Marcelline lives with her family in the Tokplégbé district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She settled in this district about seven years ago.  She helps out her husband and, along with him, ensures that the various family expenses are covered. Marcelline attended primary school only.  To provide for herself, she sells wheat flour and peanut oil out of her home.  Secondarily, she sells charcoal retail.  She gets her supplies in Savè, in Collines County, Benin.  Marcelline once obtained a loan from ALIDé and has repaid it.  With the goal of bolstering her business and coping better with customer demand, she is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of wheat flour, oil, and charcoal

loans.name: Constancio

texts.es: El Sr. Constancio tiene como actividad la venta de lubricantes para vehiculos como ser: aceite, liquido de frenos, liquido hidraulico y otros, ademas, de realizar cambio de balatas y pastillas de freno de automoviles y camiones, estas actividades que realiza son la principal fuente de ingreso para el y su familia que esta compuesto por su esposa, doña Florencia y sus tres hijas, que tambien ayudan trabajando y vendiendo fruta en el mercado de villa fatima zona populosa de nuestra ciudad, es una familia muy trabajadora y emprendedora, esta ocacion solicita credito para aumentar su capital de trabajo con la compra de turriles de aceite y compra de repuestos de vehiculos agrandando de esta manera  su tienda y mejorando su calidad de vida, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Constancio sells vehicles lubricants like brake fluid, hydraulic fluid, and others. He also changes car and truck brake pads. These activities are the main source of income for him and his family. His family is comprised of his wife, Florencia, and their three daughters. They help by working and selling fruit in the Villa Fatima market, which is a populous area in our city. The family is very hard-working and enterprising. He is now requesting a loan to increase his working capital to buy barrels of oil and vehicle replacement parts. This way he will be expanding his store and improving his quality of life. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in him by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy oil and stock replacement parts

loans.name: Bella Maria Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Bella Maria” esta representado por la señora Liliana y conformado por 12 miembros todas mujeres muy unidad y trabajadores y sobre todo muy responsables y honestas como lo han ido demostrando en los cuatro ciclos que van cursando con la institución. La señora Liliana se dedica a la venta D. comida y es ama D. casa tiene 3 hijos y vive en la casa D. su suegra, ella es casada y su esposo también trabaja duro para poder salir adelante, la señora Liliana requiere el préstamo para poder comprar mesas y sillas para poder darles mayor comodidad a sus clientes y para la compra D. una cocina mas rápida que le permita tener a tiempo su almuerzo para la gente que ya tiene costumbre D. almorzar en su pequeña pensión improvisada la cual fue montando poco a poco con los financiamientos otorgados por la institución . el resto D. la socias se dedican a la venta D. pan, cosméticos y abarrotes, una mayoría del resto D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. comida. En cuanto a la competencia todas las socias venden casi por la misma zona y para no tener competencia entre ellas se ponen D. acuerdo para no cocinar lo mismo y tener un menú variado del cual puedan escoger los clientes. El crédito será utilizado para la compra D. mercadería, insumos y para la ampliación D. sus puestos D. venta D. comida y la compra D. materiales que ayuden a darles mejor atención a sus clientes. La socias van cumpliendo un cuarto ciclo con la institución por lo que tienen experiencia en créditos solidarios y saben como salir adelante con el crecimiento D. sus negocios para generar mejores ingreso que les permita darles una mejor calidad D. vida a sus familias.
texts.en:
The "Bella Maria" group is led by Liliana and comprised of 12 women, all very united, hard working, and most of all very responsible and honest, as they have demonstrated in the four cycles that they have been involved with this institution. Liliana sells food, and she is the head of her household and has 3 children. They live in her mother-in-law's house. She is married, and her husband also works in order to get ahead. Liliana is requesting this loan in order to buy tables and chairs to proviD. a better level of comfort to her clients. Also, she wants to buy a better kitchen that would allow her to more quickly manage the lunch hour for the people who are used to coming to lunch at her small, improvised pension, a place that has been growing little by little though this institution's loans. The rest of the group's members work by selling bread, cosmetics, and groceries. The majority of the others sell food. In terms of competition, these women all work in nearly the same area, but they have agreed to not cook the same foods and to have a varied menu from which the clients can choose. This loan will be used to buy merchandise, ingredients to expands their food stands, and materials that will help them give a better experience to their clients. The members are enjoying their fourth cycle with this lending institution because they have experience with joint credits and know how to succeed in making their businesses grow and generating greater incomes that allow a better quality of life for them and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es: Juana Antonia M. D. B. D. 45 años D. edad, resiD. en Ciudad Delgado, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Ella es una madre D. familia muy responsable y dedicada a su familia, la cual posee dos negocios propios, entre los cuales reparte su tiempo para dedicarse a ambos. Juana vive junto a su esposo el cual es empleado, y junto a dos hijos. Ella posee una carpintería, la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación y en donD. trabaja elaborando todo tipo D. artículos hechos D. madera los cuales son hechos por pedidos previos, así mismo Juana se dedica a la venta D. ropa para niños y mujeres, la cual comercializa D. forma ambulante en diferentes municipios D. San Salvador, tales como Soyapango e Ilopango. Ella trabaja muy duro ya que es una persona la cual desea mucho ver a su familia D. una forma estable, la cual cuente con todo lo necesario. Juana solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar madera por mayor, así mismo herramientas para la elaboración D. pedidos hechos por sus clientes, tales como serruchos, pegamento, clavos y otros más, D. esta misma forma ella desea poder comprar mayor cantidad D. ropa, en diferentes tallas y colores, D. manera que sus ventas se puedan incrementar.
texts.en:
Juana Antonia M. D. B., age 45, lives in the city of Delgado, which is located in the San Salvador department. She is a very responsible mother who is dedicated to her family. She has two of her own businesses. She divides her time between both activities. She has a carpentry shop, which is located in her house. She works making all types of things from wood. They are maD. by prior order. Juana also sells clothing for children and women. She sells by traveling to different municipalities in San Salvador like Soyapango and Ilopango. She works very hard because she is a person who really wants to see her family in stable condition and having everything they need. Juana is requesting a loan to be able to buy wood wholesale. She will also buy tools to make the orders received from her customers. She will buy things like saws, glue, nails, and other things. This way she hopes to be able to buy a larger quantity of clothes in different sizes and colors. This way she will be able to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood and carpentry tools and clothes to sell

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Mun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mun Y. is a 46-year-old village bank president selected by the group's 14 members in Kab Nuem village, Takeo Province. With the loans, the members hope to increase their incomes to improve their families' living standards.

Mrs. Mun Y., a Khmer noodle-seller earning a small income to help support her two children, both students, is requesting a loan to add to her savings to buy more Khmer noodles to sell. Her husband, Mr. Chea Teng, is a construction worker whose small salary, combined with his wife's income, helps to improve the family's living standard. Mrs. Vanna Nop, a group guarantor, is included in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more Khmer noodles to sell

loans.name: Houssam

texts.en:
Houssam is a 38-year-old divorced man. He has four teenagers who are attending school. They live in Bint Jbeil. 

For the past four years, he has been working as a house painter as a freelancer to provide a better living for his family members. It’s been 12 years total for him in this domain of work.

This is Houssam’s fourth loan with Al Majmoua and he is requesting it in order to buy necessary industrial equipment to improve his business in a faster way. This loan will help him to greatly improve his family's living conditions and to improve his income to cover his most pressing needs as his economic limitations are an obstacle. His children will benefit from this new income since they need better conditions and independence.

loans.use: To buy necessary industrial equipment to improve his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase merchandise to stock her inventory.

loans.name: Mujeres La Esperanza Group

texts.es: Doña Ana María Canatuj T. de 32 años casada, tiene dos hijos curzo sexto grado primaria, vive con su esposo en el lugar conocido como cantón Chuixtoca  en los parajes ChuiC. y ChiT., del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, con el fin de ampliar su negocio integran un grupo, cada una de ellas se dedica a diferentes actividades las cuales son: la elaboración de Cortes Típicos y otras brindan servicios farmacéuticos por lo que se acercaron a las instalaciones de la Asociación Asdir Para adquirir un préstamo que les servirá para ampliar su capital de trabajo ya que cada una de ellas tienen el deseo de superar y poder seguir estudiando y una de ellas poder mejorar su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias dando asi una mejor condición de vida ba su familia.
texts.en:
Ana María is 32 years old, married, and has two children in the 6th grade at school. She lives with her husband in a place know as Cantón Chuixtoca near Chuicanatuj and ChiT., in the municipality and department of Totonicapán. She joined a group with the goal of growing her business. Everyone in the group has a different business activity, and they include: making the typical clothes of the region and offering pharmaceutical services. They approached the "Asociación Asdir" to access a loan that would enable them to grow their business capital since everyone one of them wants to overcome challenges and to be able to continue studying and one of them wants to be able to grow her business and gain a better income so that she can offer a better standard of living to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Since 1981, Laurence has been into farming to support his family. He is from the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. He is 49 years old and is married with four children aged 21, 19, 14 and 10.

With the money from the loan, Laurence plans to buy more farming tools and farming inputs like seed, fertilizer, and other items. Business profitability is his main goal so that he can send his children to school and give them a better future. The additional income will go to his family's daily consumption, to his children's education and to possible new business opportunities.

loans.use: To buy farm tools and inputs like seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Roath

texts.en:
Mrs. Roath T. lives in Roluos village in Takeo province. She was born in 1959. She and her husband, Mr. Man Chhouk, are farmers who own a 4 hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. She is also a Khmer cake maker. She is the mother of three children:  one is a laborer in Thailand, one owns a threshing machine and the other one is a student. Her husband is in the picture with her. 

Mrs. Roath T. has a problem because it is time to grow rice but she does not have money to support her field. So, to improve production, Mrs. Roath T. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, rice seed and pesticide. With the rest of the loan, she will rent a machine to plow her field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed and pesticide

loans.name: Felipa María Eva

texts.es: Felipa María Eva F. Vda. D. L. D. 73 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador, ella vive sola debido a que enviudó hace un par D. años atrás, es por esta razón que ella trabaja muy duro para poder sostener su negocio y D. esta forma contar con todo lo necesario para tener una vida digna. Con el deseo D. poder vivir mejor, desD. hace 5 años y medio que Felipa inició su propio negocio el cual es una tienda D. productos perecederos, la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación. Felipa atienD. el negocio D. lunes a domingo, su faena inicia cada día a las 6 D. la mañana y termina a las 10 D. la noche, a pesar que su trabajo es pesado ya que debe atender clientes a lo largo del día, le permite estar en su casa y así mismo vender con sus vecinos los cuales la conocen desD. hace mucho tiempo atrás. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir comprando mayor cantidad D. productos D. primera necesidad y D. esta manera mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en: Felipa María Eva F. Vda. D. L. is 73 years old and lives in the San Salvador department. She lives alone owing to the fact that she was widowed a few years ago, and for this reason she works very hard to be able to sustain her business and in this way have everything she needs to have a dignified life. With the desire to live better, 5 1/2 years ago Felipa began her own business, a grocery store, which is located in her home. Felipa attends to the shop from Monday to Sunday, and her job begins each day at 6 in the morning and finishes at 10 at night. Apart from her job being hard as she has to attend to customers during a very long day, it allows her to be in her home and sell to her neighbours, whom she has known for many years. It is for this reason that Felipa is seeking a loan to be able to invest in purchasing a greater quantity of grocery products and in this way improve her sales.

loans.use: Purchase grocery items

loans.name: Urther

texts.en: Urther I. M. is fifty-one years old and married to a business woman. They have four children between the ages of twenty-five and fifteen and they hope to be able to send their children to school through the university level. Urther's business is located in Kakamega. Kakamega is a region in Kenya, known for the production of sugar cane and widely referred to as the sugar belt region. He sells plastic containers and basins to the local people. He has been in this business for the last five years. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are many other people in the area operating the same kind of business as his so customers are not loyal to him as they have many vendors to choose from. However, he works very hard, from early morning to late evening, to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more inventory that will meet his customer's demand. He hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. He describes himself as a hardworking man.

loans.use: Plastic basins and cups

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is a married man who has eight children, three have graduated from school while five still attend school. He lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

Augustine operates a second hand clothes sales business, selling at the market and from door to door. His potential customers are neighbours and passersby. Augustine faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to expand and establish a retail shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 he wants to purchase a bale of clothes and to pay rental bills for his sales stall. He decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes and to pay rent bills for his sales stall.

loans.name: Daniel Alberto

texts.pt:
Daniel Alberto B. nasceu na Provincia de Zambézia, centro de Moçambique, solteiro, não tem filhos. Fez 10ª classe não continuou devido a dificuldades financeiras. Vive numa casa alugada pagando mensalmente 800.00mt. responsabiliza se pelo seu sobrinho que vive com ele em sua casa.

Saiu de Zambezia para o Distrito de Namaacha com seu tio alegando que ia estudar. Após sua chegada dá continuidade dos seus estudos e faz a  10ª classe, mas devido a morte do seu tio teve que interroper com os estudos,  consecutivamente  teve que iniciar o seu próprio negócio com o fundo da indimunização que obteve no serviço do falecido tio para sua sobrevivência. Hoje é proprietário de duas Bancas no Mercado Central que suporta uma mercadoria de aproximadamente 25.000,00mt graças aos empréstimos que teve na Hluvuku e Kiva.  Trabalha das 7h as 17h tem como melhor produto (faces e baterias de telefone, filmes e mais) gastando em média de 8.000mt na compra dos mesmos e tendo de lucro um valor de 2.500.00mt semanalmente que aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria. Conta com ajuda do seu sobrinho pagando lhe mensalmente um valor de 1.000mt.

Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Daniel na Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar (baterias de celular, discos de filmes e musica e outros) para aumentar a quantidade de seu produto. Os anteriores de (5.000.00 e 10.000.00) foram para a mesma finalidade. 

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir novo empréstimo para legalizar o seu próprio terreno.
texts.en:
Daniel Alberto B. was born in the province of Zambézia in central Mozambique. He is single and has no children. He only studied through 10th grade, and didn't continue due to financial difficulties. He lives in a rental house and pays 800 Meticais a month in rent. He helps to support his nephew who lives with him. 

Daniel left Zambezia for the district of Namaacha with his uncle, thinking that he would go to school there. After arriving in Namaacha he did continue with his studies, and finished 10th grade, but his schooling was interrupted when his uncle died. He then started his own business with the money he received after his uncle's death, intended to help him get by on his own. Today Daniel is the owner of two kiosks in the Mercado Central [Central Market] with merchandise valued at approximately 25,000 Meticais, thanks to his loans with Hluvuku [the Kiva field partner].  He works from 7:00 AM to 5:00 PM, and his best selling products are telephone batteries and covers, and movies. He spends 8000 Meticais on average to purchase these items and makes a profit of 2500 Meticais per week. He uses this income to cover household expenses and also saves some in his bank account. His nephew helps out by giving him around 1000 Meticais each month.

This is Daniel's 3rd loan, for the amount of 15,000 Meticais. He plans to use this money to buy cell phone batteries, DVDs and CDs, and other items, in order to increase his range of products. His earlier loans, for 5000 and 10,000 Meticais, were used for the same purpose. 

Daniel is confident that he will be able to repay the loan ahead of schedule and take out a new loan to cover the legal fees needed for his land.

loans.use: Purchase of cell phone batteries, DVDs and CDs, and other items

loans.name: Gissela Renata

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Américas.

La señora Gissela lleva en el Banco Comunal  5 años, desde que cumplió la mayoría de edad y pudo ingresar ella entro a formar parte del Banco en el cual está  muy contenta, le gustan las charlas más que todo las de salud. Tiene 23 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hermoso bebe de 7 meses.
 
Se dedica al comercio, vende de ropa de todo tipo, sandalias y además tiene  una pequeña distribuidora de agua en bidón. tiene muchos clientes que le realizan pedidos  y entrega sus productos en su casa. Ella deja sus productos a créditos y cobra semanalmente. Compra su mercadería en Guayaquil ciudad a la que viaja cada fin de mes y a veces hasta dos veces  dependiendo de las ventas que realice. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 14h00.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, sandalias y ropa de niñas. Sus sueños son tener una casa propia y un  local comercial.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the Las Américas communal bank meets every two weeks.

Gissela has been in the communal bank for five years.  Since she became an adult and was able to join she became part of the bank.  She is very happy in it.  She enjoys the talks, especially the ones on health.  She is 23 years old and is in a common law relationship that has produced a beautiful 7 month old baby.

She is a merchant.  She sells all kinds of clothing and sandals.  She also has a small drinking water jug distributorship.  She has many customers that place orders with her and she home delivers.  She sells on credit and collects weekly.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil, a city she travels to every end of the month and sometimes even twice depending on how sales go.  She works every day from 8am until 2pm.

She will use this loan to buy pants, blouses, sandals and girls’ clothes.  Her dreams are to have her own house and a commercial locale.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, sandals and girls' clothes.

loans.name: Mayra Selsa

texts.es: Mayra tiene 42 años, tiene más de 6 años que se dedica a brindar el servicio de ferretería. Ella es una persona muy luchadora por lo que se siente muy contenta con este medio de vida. Tiene 1 hijo de 16 años a su cargo, ella se preocupa por proporcionarle lo más necesario a su hijo la mayoría de sus clientes saben que Mayra proporciona un buen servicio y se siente muy contenta con su negocio. el crédito que solicita es para la compra de clavos, candados, llaves, tubos, cables entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Mayra is 42 years old and has been running a hardware store for over six years. She is is a very determined person and feels very content with this way of life. She has a 16-year old child who she looks after, and takes care of giving him everything he needs. Most of her customers know that Mayra offers a good service and she feels very happy with how her business is going. The loan she is requesting is to buy nails, padlocks, keys, pipes, cables and other items.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en el sector Tongorrape, una zona rural del distrito de Motupe. Una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar como comerciante acopiador de maracuyá y limón, la zona en donde reside se caracteriza por producir principalmente estos productos. El adquiere sus productos a los agricultores de la zona y los comercializa con las procesadoras que se encuentran situadas en la zona donde reside. Adicionalmente trabaja como obrero en un fundo agrícola de la zona.

Lorenzo desea ampliar su negocio obteniendo capital estable para seguir adquiriendo más frutas para ofrecerlas en venta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is 23 years old, single, and lives with his family in Tongorrape sector, a rural, agricultural area in Motupe district, Lambayeque province, one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Lorenzo works as a passion fruit and lemon trader.  The area where he lives is noted for producing these fruits.  He acquires his products from the farmers in the area and then sells them to the processing plants in the area.  He also works as a laborer on a farm in his area.

Lorenzo would like to expand his business, obtaining stable capital so that he can continue acquiring more fruit to offer for sale.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa that will allow him to achieve his goal.

loans.use: To expand his business, obtaining stable capital so that he can continue acquiring more fruit

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita M. is from the village of Bacnor East. She is 60 years old. Rosita is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Rosita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Rosita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Joseph Kariuki

texts.en: Joseph has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last six years. He is 50 years old, married to Rose Ntheya and they have two children. Joseph was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our staff and this will be his fourth loan. He has repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. Joseph plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and potato seedlings for planting. In the future, Joseph hopes to practice large scale farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and potato seedlings for planting

loans.name: Percy

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CHASKA ÑAHUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Percy; el tiene 75 años de edad y es casado y tiene 7 hijos; el socio es médico cirujano cesante de profesión el tiene su consultorio por el centro de la ciudad de Cusco donde aun trabaja el atiende de lunes a sábados por las tardes a todos sus pacientes que le solicitan el socio es una persona bien alegre con muchas ganas de seguir ayudando a la gente de esta forma el socio se siente muy feliz. 

El socio solicita el préstamo para la implementación de su consultorio.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
The borrower is a member of the communal bank, “CHASKA ÑAHUI”; located in the district of Cusco, in the department of Cusco in the Cusco province.

The borrower is Sr. Percy, 75 years old, who is married with 7 children. He is a doctor, and unemployed surgeon, with a surgery in the center of the city of Cusco where he works afternoons from Monday to Saturday, attending to every patient that comes to see him. He is a very happy person with a strong desire to continue helping people, something which makes him feel happy. He is applying for the loan to equip his surgery. He is very happy about the loan and is committed to fulfilling the repayment schedule.

loans.use: The applicant requests a loan to equip his surgery.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is a 26-year-old, married woman with two children aged five and eight.  Both of her children attend school. She has worked in mixed farming for six years and produces maize and beans that she sells to the local market. She earns additional income from a retail shop business that she runs locally.

She is requesting a 45,000KES loan from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She hopes to generate enough income to pay the school fees for her children and improve their standard of living. She plans to expand her farm in the future, but identifies drought as a big challenge for her farming activities.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Topi Group

texts.en:
Sospeter K., who is in his early thirties, is single. He has been a photographer for two years.  He works from 8:00am to 10:00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Sospeter's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He hopes for a loan to buy a printer. His dream is to one day make his business big and famous.

Sospeter will share this loan with his loan group, "Topi", which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture Sospeter is 1st on the left in a blue shirt and holding a book.  Another group member, Max N., was unfortunately behind a big leaf, so a part of his face is not seen.

loans.use: To buy a printer

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad R. is from the village of San Sebastian, Ramon, Isabela. She is 46 years old. Trinidad is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Trinidad owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Trinidad has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Trinidad joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Trinidad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Trinidad is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Trinidad from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Luciola

texts.es:
Luciola tiene 62 años de edad, es viuda y vive junto a sus hijos en el sector José Barsallo del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz. Uno de los distritos más poblados de la región Lambayeque, caracterizado principalmente por tener altos índices de pobreza, ya que las personas viven generalmente en zonas urbanas marginales que carecen de servicios básicos.

Ella se dedica a la venta de fruta especialmente de plátano y granadilla. Desde hace 15 años tiene instalado un pequeño puesto que está ubicado entre la Av. Venezuela y la Calle Uruguyay cerca al mercado del mismo distrito. Todos los días ofrece a sus clientes la fruta fresca los cuales adquiere en el mercado mayorista de Moshoqueque. 

Luciola desea adquirir un lote de fruta (plátano y granadilla) además de otras frutas que le permita ofrecer variedad e incrementar sus ingresos Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 200 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Luciola is 62 years of age.  She is a widow and lives with her children in the José Barsallo sector of the district of José Leonardo Ortiz, one of the most populated districts of the Lambayeque region, characterized principally by a high poverty index since the people live generally in marginal urban zones that lack basic services.  

She is dedicated to the sale of fruit especially bananas and passion fruit.  For the past 15 years she has had a small stall located along Venezuela Avenue and Uruguyay street close to the market of the same district.  Every day she offers her clients the fresh fruit which she acquires in the wholesale market of Moshoqueque.  

Luciola desires to acquire a lot of fruit (bananas and passion fruit) as well as other fruits that will allow her to offer variety and to increase her income.  Because of this she has found it convenient to request a loan of 200 new soles from Edpyme Alternative.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fruit.

loans.name: Ketty Carmen

texts.es:
En la parroquia San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Unión Y  Solidaridad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ketty, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 14, 9 y 6 años  de edad, el mayor de ellos estudia en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Es un muy buena ama de casa que realiza el crédito para ayudar a su esposo en su negocio por el bien de toda la familia, el se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de utensilios de cocina, como por ejemplo platos, ollas, cucharas, entre otras muchas cosas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, el se desplaza en su carro a otras ciudades para realizar sus ventas, nos cuenta que muchas veces ella también  lo acompaña sobre todo cuando hay ferias en esos lugares ya que en esos días las ventas son muy buenas.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su negocio va a comprar ollas, platos, cubiertos, entre otras cosas. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 3 ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos le dan rápido y sin tantos requisitos.
 
Su sueño es tener un local en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Unión y Solidaridad' (Unity and Solidarity) community bank meet in San Pablo parish, in the city of Portoviejo. Portoviejo is the capital of Manabí, and it has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

This is where we meet Kitty, age 34.  She is married and has three children, ages 14, 9, and 6.  The oldest is in high school, and the two younger children are in elementary school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She is a very good housewife who will, for the good of the whole family, use the loan to help her husband in his business.  He sells all types of kitchen utensils like plates, pots, spoons and many other items.  He sells door to door.  He goes to other cities in his car to make his sales.

She tells us that she goes with him a lot, especially when there are fairs at these locations.  She does so because those are the days when sales are very good.

She will use the loan to stock the business more.  She will buy pots, plates, and cutlery, among other things.  She has been in the communal bank for three cycles.  She likes it because the loans are given quickly and without so many requirements.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils like pots, plates, and cutlery, among other things.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a 45-year-old married woman with five children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She takes care of the family with the help of her husband, and their desire is to educate their children until they attain a degree as a minimum qualification. 

She has had a retail shop for four years, and the business is profitable despite the hardship of limited funds for capital. Her vision is to have a wholesale business. Harriet needs the loan to buy sodas, Omo (detergent) and flour for selling.

loans.use: To buy sodas, Omo (detergent) and flour

loans.name: Cuanicuti Group

texts.es:
La señora Judith es una mujer muy emprendedora y trabajadora ella es originaria del Distrito Federal, pero se fue a vivir desde hace 15 años a la población de Zitacuaro Michoacán por que a su esposo le ofrecieron un mejor trabajo en esa población. Ella esta casada con el señor Ernesto el cual es Chef, ellos tienen dos hijos un joven de 17 años estudiante de preparatoria y una niña de 8 años estudiante de primaria. ella se dedica hacer banquetes para fiestas como quince años, bautizos, presentaciones, bodas, cumpleaños etc. y repostería para vender a sus clientes, ella hace piernas de pavo, lomos, pavos, ensaladas, sopas, pastas, postres, comenta que quien le enseño hacer todo esto fue su esposo ya que el se había quedado sin trabajo y decidieron hacer este negocio ellos dos. Comenta que ella hace cada tercer día empanadas rellenas de comida o de mermeladas, bisquets, pays, y ya le gente le manda hacer pedidos. Comenta que ella esta pidiendo un préstamo para comprar la materia prima para hacer sus comidas y sus postres para venderlos, dice que surte todos los productos en diferentes tiendas de su población, también comenta que desgraciadamente no ha podido crecer su negocio tan rápido ya que las rentas son muy caras y ya hay mucha competencia en su población. La meta que tiene Judith es hacer un local propio en cual pueda poner su negocio estable y así tendría más clientes.
Los demás integrantes del grupo se llaman Araceli, Manuel, Decire, Minerva, Fabiola, Blanca, Melina, Nadia, Enriqueta y ven a ocupar sus prestamos para invertir en sus actividades económicas como papelería, venta de cosméticos por catalogo, venta de ropa usada, tienda de ropa nueva, zapatos por catalogo, tienda de abarrotes etc.
texts.en:
Judith is a very entrepreneurial and hard-working woman.  She is originally from Distrito Federal but 15 years ago she moved to the town of Zitacuaro, in Michoacán, because her husband was offered a better job in that town.  Judith is married to Ernesto who is a chef.  They have two children: a young boy of 17 who is in high school and an 8 year-old girl who is in elementary school.

Judith's business is catering for events such as 15th birthday celebrations, christenings, society debuts, weddings, birthdays etc.  She also bakes pastries to sell to her customers.  She prepares turkey legs, fillet steaks, turkeys, salads, soups, pastas and desserts.  She tells us that it was her husband who taught her how to do all this since he had lost his job and they decided to set up this business between the two of them.

Judith tells us that every three days she makes empanadas, jellies, biscuits and pies, and people also make orders with her.  She is requesting a loan so that she can buy the raw materials she needs to make the food and desserts that she sells.  She says that she stocks up with products in the different stores in her town.  She also says that, unfortunately, she has not been able to grow her business so quickly because her rent is very expensive and there is a lot of competition in her town.

Judith's goal is to own her own premises where she can set up a stable business and thereby have more customers.  The other members of her group are called Araceli, Manuel, Decire, Minerva, Fabiola, Blanca, Melina, Nadia and Enriqueta.  They will invest their loans in their respective business activities which include a stationery store, selling cosmetics through a catalog, selling used clothes, a [new] clothes store, selling shoes through a catalog and running a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her catering business

loans.name: Mario Arístides

texts.es: Mario Arístides de 62 años, vive con su esposa de 65 años ambos tienen dos hijos los cuales son mayores de edad y uno de ellos se encuentra estudiando en la Universidad el otro ya logró sacar su carrera gracias a los esfuerzos que día a día realizan sus padres. Hace muchos años que  Mario se dedica al comercio y esta actividad es la que le ha dado los ingresos para sacar a delante a su familia. Cuenta con una pequeña  ferretería en la cual vende herramientas y utensilios básicos. Es un hombre lleno de energía que a pesar de su avanzada edad no se da por vencido y sigue trabajando junto a su querida esposa para lograr mejorar su condición de vida. Gracias a Dios ha logrado dar el estudio a sus dos hijos y es ésto lo que lo motiva a seguir adelante, es un hombre que le gusta recibir los frutos de su esfuerzo. Mario cuenta con mucha clientela ya que gracias a su carisma a logrado ganarse la confianza de sus vecinos. El sueña con ampliar su negocio, con tener mayores opciones de herramientas para sus clientes y aumentar el nivel de ventas para que de esta manera logre obtener mayores ingresos y poder ofrecerle a su esposa una vida más confortable. Esto lo ha impulsado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL  para comprar variedad de herramientas manuales, herramientas de jardín,  utensilios eléctricos, pintura,  etc. De esta manera espera lograr  el sueño que tanto anhela.
texts.en:
Mario Arístides, age 62, lives with his 65 year old wife.  They have two adult children.  One of them is studying at the University, and the other one managed to get a career, thanks to his parents’ daily efforts.

Mario has been a merchant for many years.  This business activity has given him the income to get his family ahead.  He has a small hardware business where he sells tools and basic supplies.  He is a man who is full of energy who does not give up.  He keeps working together with his beloved wife in order to manage to improve their living conditions.

Thank God that he has managed to give his two children an education.  That is what motivates him to move forward.  Mario has a lot of customers.  Thanks to his charisma he has managed to win his neighbors’ confidence.  He dreams of expanding his business and having more tool options for his customers.  He also dreams of increasing sales in order to get more income and being able to give his wife a more comfortable life.

This has driven him to request this loan from INTEGRAL.  He will use the loan to buy a variety of hand tools, gardening tools, electrical supplies, and paint, etc.  That way he hopes to achieve his dream that he so desires.

loans.use: to buy a variety of hand tools, gardening tools, electrical supplies, and paint, etc.

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en: Carlito, 54 years old, is married and blessed with 4 children. He is engaged in food vending business and his primary activity is butcher shop. He sells pork meats in his village. He is asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase hogs to sell as meat. His net income is 6,000 PHP a month. He would like to continue receiving loans to aid the growth of his business and generate profits to invest in the future.

loans.use: To purchase hogs to sell as meat

loans.name: Joselo

texts.en:
Joselo owns a well-known health center that provides acupuncture services, massage therapy, nutritional courses and other innovative health services. He graduated from the Swedish Institute School of Acupuncture and Oriental Medicine and has been working in this field since 1998. He decided to open his own business last year and was shocked by how fast it took off. The community he serves has quickly learned of his services and he strives to make acupuncture an affordable healing method for anyone who is interested. 

With this loan from ACCION USA, Joselo will purchase health equipment and make some small decorative upgrades in the office to improve its ambiance.

loans.use: to purchase health equipment and make small decorative upgrades in the office

loans.name: Kibasi Tweimukye Group

texts.en:
Eric is a 31 year-old married man with four children, living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He is the bread winner of the family and his dream is to have enough income-generating projects to eliminate poverty from his home.

His main challenge has been limited funds to meet the increasing demand, and his dream is to have a wholesale shop.  Eric needs the loan to buy  beans, sugar and maize flour for resale.

loans.use: To buy beans, sugar and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Steven

texts.en:
Steven is a 35-year-old, married man with two children living in his own house in Fort Portal Uganda. His dream is to buy a plot of land in a trading center and also educate his children up to university.

Steven grows tomatoes on a large scale and has been doing so for 5 years amidst hardships of seasonal changes and product price fluctuations. None the less, he longs to clear more land and plant more tomatoes since the venture has proven to be worthwhile. Steven needs the loan to clear land for tomato growing.

loans.use: to clear land for tomato growing

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.

Imelda has a retail shop that sells fruits (like avocados) and vegetables (like squash). She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

Imelda is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Imeld hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Fazila

texts.ru:
Фазила трудолюбивая, умная и добросовестная девушка. Она занимается откармливанием скота дома вместе с братом. Когда её брат ездит за покупками скота, в это время она ухаживает и откармливает скота. Она откармливает их в течение 20 дней, а потом продает на выгодную цену на базар. Фазила хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свой прибыль для того, чтобы улучшить свое жилищное условие. Она запрашивает займ в размере 1000$ США для покупки скота. Она заранее благодарит всех кредиторов за поддержку и поощрение.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition.
